loans.name: Yohana

texts.en: Yohana is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Barau Village. Yohana joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yohana will have access to the best farm inputs on the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Yohana now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica es una madre cabeza de familia, imponente, luchadora, una persona que saco su familia adelante, tiene tres hijos, dos mujeres de 17, 8 y un hombre de 14, ella los crío, los alimento, les brindo educación, una mujer increíble que hace todo lo que está a su alcance y mucho más por sus amados hijos. 


Jessica para generar ingresos se apoya mucho en su negocio de cafetería, oferta bebidas, alimentos, licor, frituras, confort y un muy buen servicio.

El gran sueño de Jessica es comprar una vivienda propia y poder comprar el local, puesto que los arriendos de los dos negocios están carcomiendo la mayoría de su utilidad, dejándole incluso en meses difíciles sin capital para surtir su negocio.

Jessica quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido, primeramente café, bebidas, cerveza, ´productos fritos, buñuelos, pandequesos e insumos para la preparación de almuerzos.
texts.en:
Jessica is the head of her household.  She is an impressive woman with the drive to raise her family of three: two daughters, ages 17 and 8, and a son, 14.  She is the one who feeds them and gives them an education.  She is an extraordinary woman who does all she can and much more for her beloved children.

Jessica depends a lot on her coffee shop to earn an income.  She sells beverages, foods, beer and fritters in a comfortable atmosphere with very good service.

Her goal is to buy a house and shop space since the rental she pays for both of her businesses is eating into most of her profit, making some months very difficult due to a lack of working capital.

Jessica is requesting a loan to buy a variety of goods, especially coffee, beverages, beer, fritters, "pandequeso" (corn and cheese bread) and supplies to make lunches.

loans.use: To buy a variety of coffees, beverages, beer, fritters, "pandequeso" (corn and cheese bread) and supplies to make lunches.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Barau Village. Ibrahim joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ibrahim will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably.  This season Ibrahim has ambitious plans to harvest 100 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ibrahim now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 30 years old. She is married with three children between the ages of 6 and 14. All of them go to school. She sells clothes and has been doing business for the past 15 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shorts and shirts to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and to pay school fees for her children. In the future, she wishes to earn at least 1,000,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: To buy more shorts and shirts to sell.

loans.name: Anne Marie

texts.en: Anne Marie is 54 years old. She is married with six children between the ages of 11 and 25. All of them go to school. She sells food stuffs and has been in business for the past 30 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Magnolia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Magnolia es una gran empresaria de 59 años de edad que gracias a su conocimientos en confección que adquirió de su madre y a su mente triunfante monto un negocio de confección a terceros donde genera 4 empleos y se proyecta a crecer debido a la calidad y al cumplimiento en los tiempos de entrega de esta responsable mujer. 

Magnolia no solo se está preocupando por cumplir sus pedidos, en tiempos libres y con sus operarias están sacando una línea de camisas propias (ver foto), quiere impulsar esta idea con la que podrían generar más ingresos y más empleo.

Magnoplia quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de cartera y de tela, este préstamo el ayudara a seguir impulsado su línea de camisas propia, piensa emplear una persona para que sea la encargada de confeccionarlas mientras ellas y sus 4 empleadas antiguas se encargan de los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fifty-nine-year-old Magnolia is a great businesswoman who, thanks to the dressmaking skills that she learned from her mother, and her sharp mind, started a business producing clothes for third parties. The business has generated four jobs, and is expected to grow owing to the quality of clothes and punctual delivery of products by this responsible business-owner.

Magnolia is not just worried about fulfilling orders from customers but, in her spare time, she and her staff are moving forward with their own line of shirts (shown in the photo). Magnolia wants to drive this forward and generate a higher income and more jobs.

Magnolia is applying for a loan in order to buy material. This loan will help her to drive forward her own line of shirts. She is thinking of hiring somebody to make the shirts while Magnolia and her other employees take care of her customers’ orders.

loans.use: to buy material and then this loan will help her to continue working on her own line of shirts.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 27 years old. She is married with three children between the ages of 8 months and 4 years. They do not yet go to school. She owns a shop and has been doing business for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more maize flour, sugar, and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more maize flour, sugar, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Poner cerámica al piso de su casa, tener una cocina integral, puestas en las habitaciones, paredes revocadas y pintadas, lámparas decorativas es así como se sueña su casa la señora Luz una empresaria de 59 años de edad que se dedica a atender un negocio de tienda de abarrotes, (la típica tienda de barrio), inicio su negocio pro necesidad económica pero ahora tiene un meta trazada la cual es remodelar su vivienda. 

Luz tiene dos formas para realizar este sueño una es préstamo capital e invertirlo en su casa y la otra es prestando capital e invertirlo en su negocio, garantizando la estabilidad financiera de su hogar y si aumenta las ventas podría ahorrar para cumplir su sueño, aunque sea más demorado es seguro, por ello Luz necesita un apoyo financiero para invertir en surtido para su tienda, comprara abarrotes, granos y productos de refrigeración, con el préstamo lograra tener variedad  de marcas y surtido de carnes frías que anteriormente no contaba con ello.
texts.en:
A ceramic floor, a kitchen installed, walls plastered and painted, decorative lamps…this is how Luz imagines her house. Luz is 59 years old and a businesswoman. She makes a living at her grocery shop (they ‘typical’ corner shop). Luz started her business out of financial necessity but now her goal is to renovate her home.

Luz has two ways of achieving this dream: one, through a loan that she can invest in the house; two, through a loan to invest in her business, guaranteeing financial stability in her home. If sales increase, Luz can save up and achieve her dream and, even though it will be slower, it is more secure. As a result, Luz needs financial support to invest in stock for her business, to buy groceries, grains and refrigerated products. This loan will allow Luz to sell a variety of brands and a stock of cold meats that she has previously not had on offer.

loans.use: to buy groceries, grains and refrigerated products.

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en: Lawal is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Barau Village. Lawal joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Lawal suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Lawal  will have access to the best farm inputs on the market such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. This season Lawal has ambitious goals to harvest 80 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Lawal now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabrics, sewing threads, rope and elastic bands, as well as to pay her employees' salaries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes and smoked fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabrics, sewing threads and cords, as well as to pay her 3 employees' salaries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy local soap

loans.name: Sandra Yamile

texts.es:
Sandra una mujer de 32 años edad que por necesidad inicio con un negocio de venta de comidas para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar y el sostenimiento de su familia conformada por 3 hombres de 13, 11, 3 años de edad.

Sandra usa el espacio y los implementos que tiene en su cocina por lo que su producción no es muy abundante, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para aumentar su producción comprando equipo e insumos para estandarizar su negocio. 

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de una estufa, utensilios de cocina, ollas y compra de hornos.

Este equipo dará un gran apoyo y ayuda a Sandra tendrá lo necesario para aumentar su producción y dejar de usar los implementos de su hogar.

tuvo un crèdito anterior, exitosamente terminado
texts.en:
Sandra is a 32 year-old woman that started up her own business of selling meals in order to support her husband with the household expenses and to sustain her family which includes her 13, 11, and 3 year-old boys.

Sandra uses the space and tools she has in her kitchen which means that she is restricted in terms of the quantity of meals she can produce. For this reason, she is asking for a loan in order to increase her levels of production by buying equipment and supplies to turn what she has into a proper business.

She is asking for a loan to purchase an oven, stove, cooking utensils and pots and pans.

This equipment will really help Sandra by providing her with the necessary items to increase her levels of production and allow her to stop using the tools from her home. 

She previously received a loan which ended successfully.

loans.use: to purchase an oven, stove, cooking utensils and pots and pans.

loans.name: William Enrique

texts.es:
William es un comerciante dedicado a la venta de frutas, tiene un carro (ver foto), se desplaza por centros comerciales, por las calles del centro de Medellín vendiendo sus frutas exóticas, uvas, manzanas, borojo, chontaduro, bananas, entre otra variedad, las vende enteras o en jugo.

William lleva realizando esta actividad desde el año 1998 y gracias a su negocio ha dado una buena vida a su familia conformada por sus dos hijos menores de edad que viven con su ex-esposa y para él.


William quiere solicitar un préstamo para reparar y ampliar su carro frutero, es pequeño le caben pocas frutas, su idea es hacerlo más ancho pero que aún siga cabiendo por los corredores de los centros comerciales, esto principalmente pensando para almacenar mayor número de frutas, quiere vender jugos de lulo, maracuyá, uchuva, entro otros.
 
Se decidió a realizar esta inversión porque busca generar mayor dinero para no defraudar a sus hijos a los cuales les prometió que les pagaría la educación.
texts.en:
William sells fruit. He has a cart (see photo) which he takes through shopping centres and the streets of Medellin city-centre, selling exotic fruit such as grapes, apples, the fruit commonly known as borojó, peach-palms, and bananas among others. He sells this fruit either whole or as juice. 

William has been doing this since 1998 and it has allowed him to provide a good life for his family, which is made up of him and his two small children who live with his ex-wife.

William wants to ask for a loan in order to repair and increase the size of his cart as now it is small and cannot carry much fruit. His idea is to make it wider but ensuring that it still fits through the shopping centre's hallways. This will allow him to store more fruit. He wants to sell juice from fruits such as: little oranges known as "lulo", passion fruit and cape gooseberries among others. 

He has decided to make this investment in order to improve his income and thus not let his children down as he promised to pay for their education.

loans.use: to sell exotic fruit and drinks.

loans.name: Luz Adriana

texts.es:
Ella es Luz Adriana una persona sonriente, tierna, amorosa, de 42 años de edad, se separó de su esposo quedando sola como cabeza de familia y con una hija en los brazos, en ese tiempo se le ocurrió la idea de iniciar un negocio de repostería, aprovechando sus habilidades y conocimientos que adquirió gracias a su madre y un curso que realizo.

Adriana necesita un apoyo financiero para la compra de herramienta para facilitar y agilizar su labor, ya que sus ventas están aumentando y también lo hace por salud.

Con el dinero solicitado Adriana quiere comprar un batidor industrial e implementos para repostería, al apoyar esta empresaria le estarías dando las herramientas para agilizar y facilitar su trabajo, logrando aumentar su producción y permitiéndole soñar con tener una vida mejor y lograr su sueño de comprar un vivienda propia y pagar la educación de su hija.
texts.en:
This is Luz Adriana. She is a smiling, gentle, loving person who is 42 years old. She separated from her husband and then became the only head of household with a daughter in her arms. That was when she had the idea of starting a pastry business, making use of her abilities and knowledge that she acquired thanks to her mother and a class she took.

Adriana needs financial support to buy tools to facilitate her work and make it more efficient. Her sales are increasing and she also needs to do this for her health. 

With the money that Adriana has asked for, she wants to buy an industrial mixer and pastry tools. By supporting this entrepreneur, you will be giving her the tools to facilitate her work and make it more efficient, working to increase production and allowing her to dream of a better life and make her dream come true of buying her own home and paying for her daughter's education.

loans.use: to buy an industrial mixer and pastry tools.

loans.name: Mary Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mary es una vendedora de alimentos muy energética, animada, sonriente y cordial, ella vende productos como deditos de pollos, empanadas, kisses, butifarras entre otros, con el capital generado brinda un gran aporte y apoyo en su hogar, pues se encarga de pagar los servicios públicos, mientras que su marido paga la alimentación, son personas humildes de ingresos básicos que juntos realizan un óptimo trabajo para tener una buena estabilidad económica. 

Mary desea realizar una inversión, quiere mejorar su producción y vender otros productos como salchichón con arepa, papas con salchicha y pasteles de pollo, por ende quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar surtido de estos productos, esperando mejorar sus ingresos para que en su hogar vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Mary sells food. She is energetic, animated, cheerful and polite. She sells products such as chicken fingers, empanadas, meringues, butifarra sausages, and more. With the capital she generates she really contributes to and supports her home. She pays for the utilities, while her husband pays for the food. They are humble people with basic income and together they do a great work in order to have financial stability.

Mary wants to make an investment. She wants to improve production and sell products such as sausage with arepa, potatoes and sausage and chicken pastries. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy inventory of these products. She hopes to improve her income so they have a better standard of living at home.

loans.use: to buy inventory to sell a wider variety of products, such sausage with arepa, potatoes and sausage, and chicken pastries.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Barau Village. Samuel  joined Babban Gona to improve the life of his family and children. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Samuel will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income significantly. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Samuel now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to buy improved farm machinery and hire skilled labour.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Barau Village. Yahaya joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Yahaya now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

loans.name: Radegonde

texts.en:
Radegonde is 43 years old. She is married with 4 children, aged between 8 and 15 years; they all go to school. 

She sells food and she has been in a business for five years, while her husband is a farmer. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, bananas and cassava to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In future, she aims to earn at least 200,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy more rice, bananas and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish nets and materials for boat repair.

Roselyn has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Roselyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish nets and materials for boat repair

loans.name: Ruthly

texts.en:
Ruthly is a 42-year-old married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a grinder business in the Philippines. 

Ruthly requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her grinder business.

Ruthly has been in this business for 10 years. In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her grinder business

loans.name: Versilda

texts.en:
Versilda is 37 years old and married with five children, three of whom in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Versilda has been in this business for five years.

In the future Versilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Enadis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Enanis un verdadero ejemplo a seguir, una persona que no tuvo puso excusa, que no se quejó por la falta de trabajo  o capital para iniciar un negocio propia, una persona que con poco dinero logro montar un negocio con el que está generando calidad de vida y es que tal y como se puede ver en la foto, clavo un par de clavos en la pared, saco la mesa de su hogar e inicio a vender productos de la canasta familiar, no por necesidad o por gusto a trabajar lo hizo fue por su hijo, por su estudio, porque no iba a permitir que estuviera en casa.

Ahora Enanis quiere crecer, busca un apoyo financiero para comprar estanterías, comprar mayor surtido de papas en bolsa, vegetales y granos e ir transformando su venta informal en una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Enanis is a real model to follow, a person who did not take any excuses, who did not complain about the lack of work or capital to start her own business, a person who, with a little money, managed to establish a business that is generating a quality of life and that is as can be seen in the photo. She hammered some nails in the wall, took the table from her house and began to sell basic pantry products, not for necessity or for a desire to work, she did it for her son, so he could go to school, because she wasn't going to allow him to be at home. 

Now Enanis wants to grow, she seeks a loan to purchase shelving, and buy a wider assortment of bagged potatoes, vegetables and grains.

loans.use: to purchase shelving, and buy a wider assortment of bags of potatoes, vegetables, and grains.

loans.name: Wilma Rosa

texts.es:
Ella es Wilma una madre cabeza de familia que se dedica a vender alimentos como desayunos, almuerzo y antojos y la venta de mercancía por catálogo como ropa., chocolates, accesorios y lociones.

Wilma es madre de un hijo de 16 años de edad, lo alimento, crio y levanto sola, ahora que está próximo a salir de su educación secundaria quiere realizar todos los esfuerzos necesarios para que estudie la carrera que desee en alguna universidad que esté al alcance de su capital.

Wilma quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de utensilios de cocina, platos, vasos y cubiertos desechables, papel chicle para envolver los productos, servilletas, paquetes de bocadillos y el capital restante lo piensa invertir en un pedido que tiene de pijamas, relojes, blusas y lociones.
texts.en:
This is Wilma, a female head of household, who works selling food such as breakfast, lunch, and snacks, and selling catalog products such as clothing, chocolate, accessories and lotions.

Wilma is the mother of a 16-year-old son. She fed him, raised him and got him up alone. Now that he is about to finish his secondary education, she wants to put all the necessary effort into him studying for a degree that he wants at a university that is in financial reach.

Wilma wants to ask for a loan to purchase kitchen utensils, disposable plates, glasses and silverware, plastic wrap to wrap the products, napkins, 
packets of snacks, and the remaining capital she plans to invest in an order that she has of pajamas, watches, blouses and lotions.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils, disposable plates, glasses and silverware, plastic wrap to wrap the products, napkins, pajamas, watches, blouses, and lotions.

loans.name: Marelvis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marlevis empresaria de 32 años de edad, madre de 2 hijos de 12 y 2 años de edad y que está próxima a tener el 3, se dedica a la venta de productos de la canasta familiar y de accesorios en un negocio que ubico en la sala de su casa el cual genera los ingresos suplementarios para el mantenimiento de su familia. 

Marlevis quiere hacer crecer su negocio, quiere dejar de generar el suplemento para el hogar, quiere ser la gestora de los fondos que sostiene su familia, por ello planea realizar una inversión que le servirá para la compra de surtido de abarrotes, granos, y accesorios para mujeres, busca la manera de que su negocio genere mayor número de ventas y sea auto sostenible.
texts.en:
Marlevis is a 32-year-old businesswoman, and the mother of two children ages twelve and two, with a third child on the way.  She sells products for the family food basket and accessories, in a business that she has in the living room of her house. It generates supplementary income for the maintenance of her family.

Marlevis wants to make her business grow; she wants to stop generating just supplementary income for the home and be the one who supports her family.  For this reason she wants to make an investment that will help her to purchase a supply of groceries, grains, and women’s accessories. She is looking for the way that her business can generate a greater number of sales and sustain itself.

loans.use: to purchase a supply of groceries, grains, and women's accessories.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 37 years old. She is married with 4 children, aged between 5 and 13 years; they all go to school. 

She sells local drinks from sorghum and she has been in a business for the past seven years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more biscuits and sugar to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare. In future, she wishes to earn at least 200,000 per month

loans.use: To buy more biscuits and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Teresita Edilma

texts.es:
Teresita es una mujer viuda de 64 años de edad que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de una freidora para su carro de comidas rápidas, un apoyo que sería de gran ayuda para esta humilde y trabajadora mujer que no tiene hijos solo su negocio para generar los ingresos necesarios para su mantenimiento.

Sueña con llevar una vida tranquila, tener salud para poder trabajar y gozar su vida.
texts.en:
Teresita is a 64-year-old widow. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of a deep fryer for her fast food cart.  This support would be a great help to this humble and hardworking woman, who does not have children, and has only her business to generate the income necessary for her support.

She dreams of leading a peaceful life, being healthy enough to work, and enjoying her life.

loans.use: to purchase a deep fryer for her fast food cart.

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
Angélica es una responsable ama de casa que alterna sus labores de hogar con su negocio, tiene tres hijos el mayor de 12 y las dos princesas de 9 y 3, como ama de casa se encarga de las labores domésticas, la alimentación de sus hijos, llevarlos al colegio etc., pero también genera ingresos muy necesario para su hogar con la venta de alimentos fritos como pasteles, empanadas, las cuales compaña con ricos jugos naturales. 

Angélica inicio hace poco más de un año de trabajo se está acoplando a la competencia, a los altos costos de insumos, la inseguridad en la zona, pero ve muchas esperanza de progreso con su puesto de trabajo, quiere mejorar, vender, tener mayor número de clientes, generar empleo, tener su negocio pro largo tiempo. 

Solicita un aliento económico para la compra de surtido de frutas para elaborar jugos naturales, surtido de alimentos congelados, platos y vasos desechables, servilletas, y enseres para la cocina.
texts.en:
Angélica is a responsible housewife who alternates between the household jobs and her business. She has three children, one son aged 12 and two little princesses aged 9 and 3. As a housewife she is responsible for doing jobs around the house, feeding her children, taking them to school etc. However, she also earns her own income, which her family needs, by selling fried food such as cakes and pastries which she usually accompanies with tasty natural juices.   

Angélica started her business little more than a year ago and although she is now having to adapt to competition, the high prices of supplies and insecurity in the area, she is very hopeful that she will progress in her current job. She wants to improve, to sell, to have more customers, to provide employment for others and to maintain her business for a long time.  

She is asking for a loan to buy a variety of fruit to make natural juices, a range of frozen meals, disposable plates and glasses, napkins and basic utensils for the kitchen.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruit to make natural juices, a range of frozen meals, disposable plates and glasses, napkins and basic utensils for the kitchen.

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 59 años de edad, es padre de 7 hijos todos ellos adolescentes, le gusta el trabajo independiente y por ello monto su propio negocio de granizado de frutas, tiene un carro de alimentos, el cual adecuo a las necesidades de su negocio, recorre los caminos de  Rionegro buscando ventas para llevar el pan de cada día a su numerosa familia. 

Carlos se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para mejorar su puesto de ventas, quiere cambiar las ruedas de su carro por unas más grandes que le faciliten el desplazamiento, pintarlo, cambiar partes oxidadas y comprar surtido principalmente de mango y apio que es por lo que se ha diferenciado ante la competencia. 

Su sueño es poder tener una vivienda propia para vivir junto con su familia
texts.en:
Carlos is a 59-year-old man, the father of 7 adolescent children. He likes to work independently, and for this he established his own fruit ice business. He has a food cart, which he outfitted to the needs of his business. He goes around the streets of Rionegro seeking sales to bring the daily bread to his large family.

Carlos is looking for a loan to improve his sales location, he wants to replace the wheels on his cart for some larger ones which will ease movement, paint it, replace rusted parts, and purchase supplies, primarily mango and celery which has differentiated him from the competition.

His dream is to be able to own his own house where he could live with his family.

loans.use: to improve his sales location, replace the wheels and rusted parts, purchase fruit such as mango, and celery.

loans.name: Adriana Maria

texts.es:
A sus 51 años de edad Adriana es una mujer que toda la vida lucho por lo que quería, nadie le regalo nada, es madre cabeza de familia, tiene un negocio de confección a terceros donde genera 4 empleos a madres como ella cabeza de familia en el sector.

Adriana trabaja por tener una buena estabilidad económica, mejorar su hogar, por sus hijos, incluso por su trabajadores que a pesar de 4 personas, junto con ella conforman 5 pues se siente las mismas 10 o 12 horas de trabajo a confeccionar prendas.

Adriana quiere solicitar un préstamo principalmente para tener capital de trabajo que invertirá en reparación y mantenimiento de maquinaria, compra de hilos, pago de jornales.

Para el final de este año Adriana se propuso conseguir otro espacio más amplio, para poner mayor número de maquinaria y así generar empleo.
texts.en:
At 51 years old, Adriana is a woman who has fought her whole life for what she wanted. Nobody ever gave her anything. She is a mother and head of household and has a business sewing for third parties. She generates 4 jobs for area mothers who are heads of household like she is. 

Adriana works to have good financial stability, to improve her home, for her children, and even for her workers. Despite there only being 4 of them, with her they are 5 and they work the same 10 to 12 hours making clothing.  

Adriana wants to ask for a loan mainly to have working capital that she will invest in repairing and maintaining machinery, buying threads, and paying workers.

For the end of this year, decided to get another, bigger space, to have a larger number of machines and to generate jobs.

loans.use: to repair and maintain her machinery, buy thread and pay workers.

loans.name: Caterin Yuliana

texts.es:
Caterine es una mujer de 30 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa en un almacén que tiene alquilado, vende solo ropa para mujer, quiso especializarse en un solo género para lograr captar más atención y que las mujeres hablen de que en su barrio hay un negocio diseñado solo para ellas.

Inicio su almacén buscando recursos para el mantenimiento de su hogar donde la espera un hijo de 10 años y para comprar una vivienda propia proyectos a largos años pero con paciencia y perseverancia se pueden cumplir.

Caterine quiere atraer mayor número de clientes, busca darle un impulso y un producto más a su negocio, por tal motivo busca un apoyo financiero para la compra de accesorios para mujeres, como aretes, collares, correas, bolsos y pulseras, le servirá mucho para tener un negocio en donde una mujer pueda irse con una muda de ropa y accesorios que le convienen, su idea es que no tenga que buscar mucho que todo lo encuentren en un mismo sitio.
texts.en:
Caterine is a 30 year old woman, She sells clothes in a store that she rents. She only sells women's clothing. She wanted to specialize in one gender to get more attention and so that women would say that in her neighborhood there is a store designed just for them.

She started her store seeking resources to support her home where her 10 year old son awaits her, as well as to buy her own home. These are long term projects, but with patience and perseverance, they can be achieved. 

Caterine wants to attract more customers. She is seeking to boost her business with more products. That is why she seeks financial support to buy women's accessories such as earrings, necklaces, belts, bags, and bracelets. It will be useful for her to have a business where a woman can go to get new clothes and accessories that suit her. Her idea is for that woman not to have to look very far because she can find everything in the same place.

loans.use: to diversify the products in her store, investing in accessories such as earrings, necklaces, bags and bracelets.

loans.name: Yunia Patricia

texts.es:
Ella es Yunia una empresaria de 28 años de edad, que trabaja en un negocio de confección a terceros, aprendió la labor gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre y con el pasar del tiempo monto su propia empresa con una máquina que compro a su madre y se la pago pro cuotas.

Yunia trabaja fuertemente para coser el futuro de su familia tiene dos hijos hombres de 11 y 12 años de edad, con su negocio se ha propuesto comprar una vivienda, pagar la educación de sus hijos y convertirse en  una de las principales confeccionista de la ciudad de Medellín. 

Yunia ahora tiene una empresa cuenta con 4 empleados, sus clientes han aumentado y se debe mucho a su servicio de entrega inmediata y cumplimiento en sus tiempos de entrega. 

Yunia quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de un vehículo para entregar mercancía, será una motocicleta y capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
She is Yunia, a 28-year-old entrepreneur who does work outsourced from clothing companies. She learned this activity thanks to her mother. With time, she opened her own company with a sewing machine she bought from her mother, who allowed her to pay it in installments. 

Yunia works hard to “sew” her family’s future. She has two sons aged 11 and 12. Her purposes with this business are to buy a house, pay for her sons’ education and become one of the most important seamstresses of the city of Medellín.

Yunia’s company has now four employees. Her customer base has grown, which is mainly the result of her fast-delivery service and her punctuality.

Yunia wants to request a loan to buy a motorcycle to deliver her products and increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to deliver her products.

loans.name: Victor Enrique

texts.es:
Víctor es un joven de 19 años de edad un hombre honesto y muy colaborativo en su familia, su mayor deseo es ayudar a su madre y pagar su estudios.
Este talentoso hombre aprendió a través de su padre los conocimientos de panadería, le pidió un dinero prestado y compro un horno donde fabrica su propios panes, consiguió sus clientes y ahora es un empresario con pedidos pendientes.

Víctor quiere solicitar un préstamo para adecuar un techo donde está ubicado el horno, su madre le facilito un espacio en su casa y desde allí trabaja, comprar materia prima e iniciar a invertir en presentación de su producto, quiere mandar hacer tarjetas de presentación para que los clientes lo contacten y sticker para diferenciar su marca de la competencia.
texts.en:
Victor is a young man, age 19, who is honest and very helpful to his family. His greatest desire is to help his mother and pay for his education.

This talented man learned baking skills from his father. He requested a loan and purchased an oven, in which he bakes his own bread. He gained customers, and now he is a businessman with pending orders. 

Victor wants to request a loan to set up a roof where his oven is located. His mother provided him with a space at her house, and he works from there.

He will purchase basic ingredients and start investing in the presentation of his product. He wants to order business cards so that his customers can contact him and stickers to distinguish his brand  from the competition.

loans.use: to set up a roof where the oven is located, purchase basic ingredients, order business cards, and stickers to distinguish his brand from the competition.

loans.name: Maria Nelly

texts.es:
María Nelly es una mujer muy activa, trabajadora, paso por momentos muy difíciles en su vida, uno de ellos fue quedar viuda, un episodio bastante complicado donde tuvo que idearse la forma para montar un negocio que le permitirá criar a sus 6 hijos.
Ya un poco más calmada después de lo sucedido se le ocurrió la idea de usar un espacio que dejo su esposo para alquilar vivienda, ya que en la zona había mucho trabajador por obras, les hablo y les comento que estaba en alquiler las habitaciones y así fue como encontró una actividad que le genero ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. 

María ha crecido mucho, en el momento se encuentra adecuando un espacio de su terreno para ampliar su capacidad, pero necesita capital para comprar materiales, por ello solicita un préstamo para comprar arena, adobes, cemento, tejado, madera y pagar mano de obra para finalizar la construcción de las habitaciones.
texts.en:
Maria Nelly is a very active, hard-working woman. She is experiencing some very difficult times in her life, for one she has been recently widowed, a very complicated event where she had to come with an idea for a business that would allow her to raise her six children. 
Now a little calmer after what happened, she got the idea to use some space that her husband left to rent out, since there are many workers in the area. She talked to them and told them she was renting rooms, and that's how she found an activity to generate income to support her family. 
Maria has grown a great deal, now she is fixing up a space on her property to expand her capacity, but she needs capital to buy materials. That is why she is applying for a loan to buy sand, bricks, cement, roofing materials, wood and to pay for labor costs to finish constructing the rooms.

loans.use: to buy sand, bricks, cement, roofing materials, and pay for the cost of labor (rent rooms)

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 45 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom attends school. She works very hard to provide for them. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 15 years.

Dolores requested a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, milk, coffee, noodles, eggs, etc. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, soap, milk, coffee, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Khabibulo

texts.ru: Это мужчина Хабибулло. Он семейный человек. Его жена швея. Она дома предоставляет услуги швеи. Хабибулло честный и целеустремленный человек. Он занимается ремонтов домов. Хабибулло с детства мечтал стать мастером по ремонта домов. На районе его все знает, потому что он авторитетный мастер. Сейчас есть новые строй инструменты. Хабибулло хочет купить себе разные и новые строй инструменты для своего карьеры. Он верит в Вас и обратился к Вам за кредитом. Хабибулло знает, что Вы никогда не откажитесь людям в помощи.
texts.en:
This man is Khabibulo. He is a family man and his wife is a seamstress who works from home. He is an honest and purposeful person who works in home renovations. As a child he dreamed of becoming a skilled tradesman in this field. Everyone in the area knows him because of his skilled work. 

New building tools have come on the market and Khabibulo wants to buy himself various new building tools for his work. He trusts in you and has approached you for a loan. He knows, that you won't turn away people in need.

loans.use: to purchase building tools for his work

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз жительница района Дж.Руми. Ей 28 лет. Она замужем и мать двоих детей. Дети ходят в садик. Она научилась шить у мамы, и в течение 3 года она таким ремеслом.  Дилафруз собирается отремонтировать дом, и улучшить жилищные условия, чтобы жить комфортно  и уютно. Она старается работать больше и получить больше, чтобы прокормить детей. Дилафруз нуждается  на Вашу помощь, чтобы отремонтировать дом. Она не смогла копить определенную сумму денег дл ремонта, и из-за нехватки денежных средств она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Dilafruz is a resident of the J. Rumy region. She is 28 and married with two children who are both in kindergarten. She learned to sew from her mother and has worked in this trade for three years. 

Dilafruz is preparing to renovate her house and improve her living conditions so that she can live comfortably and securely. She is trying to work more so she can earn more in order to feed her children. She needs your help in order to renovate her house. She hasn't been able to save enough money for the renovations and is looking for a loan for this reason.

loans.use: to renovate her home

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is married and works hard to support her family. She sells charcoal in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years.

Jessica requested a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Loleta

texts.en:
Loleta is 34 years old, married and has nine children, four of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Loleta runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.  

Loleta requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

In the future Loleta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Lolita has been in this business for four years now. She works hard to support her family. 

Lolita requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, chips, etc.

In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, chips, etc.

loans.name: Karen Patricia Z

texts.es:
Karen es una mujer luchadora, toda una guerrera, busco la vida independiente, se fue de su casa para vivir con su pareja desde joven, ahora tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad y aunque su conyugue tiene unos ingreso básicos, el amor y el compromiso pro hacer un hogar firme y estable la llevo a comenzar un negocio de cría de aves aprovechando los conocimiento y la práctica que obtuvo en la casa de sus padres. 

Comprar la vivienda donde actualmente vive es su gran propósito, pero primero quiere estabilizar su situación económica, tener un negocio rentable y apoyar a su marido y alentarlo a que se supere así mismo.

Karen quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de pollos, alimento de pollos y construcción de un nuevo galpón para albergar los pollos, la gran noticia es que se está ampliando su negocio crece y está muy motivada por ello, ayúdala, alimenta el corazón y las esperanzas de esta trabajadora empresaria.
texts.en:
Karen is a real fighter in life, really a warrior.  She sought out an independent life, leaving her home to live with her partner at a young age.  Now she has a 2-year-old son and although her partner has a basic income, her love and commitment to making a solid and stable home lead her to start a business raising poultry, taking advantage of the knowledge and practice she had gained in her parents’ home.

Her big goal is to buy the home where she is currently living, but first she wants to stabilize her financial situation.  She wants to have a profitable business and support her husband, encouraging him to improve himself.

Karen wants to ask for a loan to buy chickens and chicken feed, and to construct a new building to house the chickens.  The good news is that she is making her business grow and is very motivated to do so.  Help her; feed her heart and the hopes of this enterprising worker.

loans.use: to buy chickens, chicken feed, and to build a new building to house the chickens.

loans.name: Jumdaya

texts.en:
Jumdaya is 59 years old and married. She has six children who are in school. Jumdaya works very hard to provide for them.

Jumdaya runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

She requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like chips, noodles, canned goods, eggs, etc.

In the future, Jumdaya would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like chips, noodles, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Loyda

texts.en:
Loyda is 52 years old, married, and has eight children, two of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Loyda has been pig fattening for 10 years now, and she has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF. 

Loyda requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy works hard to support her family. Lucy is married and has a buy and sell dried squid business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried squid to sell.

In the future, Lucy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried squid to sell.

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn is 33 years old and married. She has three children.

Lyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. Lyn has been in this business for three years. 

Lyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soy sauce, vinegar, soap, canned goods, coffee, etc.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soy sauce, vinegar, soap, canned goods, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Clara Eugenia

texts.es:
Ella es Clara es una mujer trabajadora, constante en su empresa, dedicada, honesta y servicial, madre cabeza de familia, se separó de su esposo y quedo a cargo de su hija.

Clara tiene una distribuidora de insumos para la confección, vende principalmente Hilos en todo color y clase, gracias a este negocio logra generar el pan de cada día, le brinda a su hija un hogar cómodo y de calidad, una alimentación sana y la posibilidad de estudiar.

Clara es una mujer sabe superar problemas, cuando se separó se colocó las botas y nunca dejo que su hija pasara necesidades hoy gracias a sus habilidades y su perseverancia cuenta con un negocio estable que está en vía de crecimiento.

Clara quiere solicitar un apoyo económico para abastecer su negocio con hilos, comprara por cantidades principalmente el color blanco y negro que son los colores de mayor rotación.
texts.en:
Clara is a hard-working woman who is persevering in her business, dedicated, honest and helpful. She is a mother and the head of her household. She separated from her husband and kept custody of her daughter.

Clara has a sewing supplies distribution business.  Mainly, she sells thread in every color and quality, and thanks to this business she is able to put food on the table every day, give her daughter a good, comfortable home, healthy food, and the possibility to study.

Clara is a woman who knows how to overcome problems; when she became separated, she went to work, and never let her daughter do without. Now, thanks to her skills and perseverance, she has a stable business that is growing. 

Clara wants to request a loan in order to stock her business with thread.  Mainly, she will purchase quantities in black and white, which are the colors with the most rotation.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of thread.

loans.name: Rhoaina

texts.en:
Rhoaina is 37 years old and married. She has two children who are in school. Rhoaina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. Rhoaina has been in this business for eight years.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like shampoo, juices, milk, coffee, sugar, etc.

In the future, Rhoaina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like shampoo, juices, milk, coffee, sugar, etc

loans.name: Verna

texts.en:
Verna is married and works hard to support her family. 

Verna has a dried-fish-making business in the Philippines. Verna has been in this business for six years now.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more boxes of fish to make dried fish.

In the future, Verna would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 50 years old, married and has two children who are both in school. Alicia works very hard to provide for them.

Alicia runs a general store in the Philippines. Alicia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, coffee, eggs, etc.

In the future, Alicia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, coffee, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Manchita

texts.en:
Manchita works hard to support her family. Manchita is married and has a buying and selling of rice grains business in the Philippines.

Manchita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Manchita has been in this business for 15 years now, and also earns additional income.

In the future, Manchita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn works hard to support her family. Marlyn is married and has a buying and selling of rice grains business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Marlyn has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is 40 years old, married and has four children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Nerissa has been pig fattening for 20 years now, and she has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Nerissa requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Nerissa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Salkynbu

texts.ru: Салкынбу, 54 года, замужем, есть 5 детей. У Салкынбу - среднее образование, занимается сельским хозяйством. Стартовав много лет назад, благодаря упорному труду Салкынбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется корова, 70 овец и лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет до 32,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Салкынбу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита позволят Салкынбу развить ее бизнес и построить дополнительные сараи для скота.
texts.en: Salkynbu is 54, married, and has five children. She is a farmer with a secondary education. Having started her farm several years ago, she now has a cow, 70 sheep, and a horse, all thanks to her hard work. She earns around 32,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to expand her business, Salkynbu applied for a loan of 110,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy livestock to increase her herd. The earnings from the loan will allow Salkynbu to develop her business and build an additional barn for the livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 45 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Antonieta works very hard to provide for the family.

Antonieta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, beer, soft drinks, noodles, detergent soap, etc., to sell.

Antonieta has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, beer, soft drinks, noodles, detergent soap, etc. 

Antonieta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, beer, soft drinks, noodles, detergent soap, etc., to sell

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas is 22 years old, single and a management major at a university in the city. He is from the Kampot province in Cambodia. Currently, he is also working for a company in the city, making a daily income of USD6.66. 

Meas was able to pay his tuition fees from his foundation year to his third year, and he is now requesting a loan to cover his fourth-year tuition fee. With the loan, Meas will have enough money to earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. 

For his future dreams, he wants to save money to run his own business, and he also dreams of having a house in the city.

loans.use: to cover his fourth-year tuition fee

loans.name: Yongy

texts.en:
Yongy is an 18-year-old, single cashier; she is working for a company in the city. She resides in the Kratie Province in Cambodia. She has been working as a cashier since 2013, earning around $5 per day. 

She is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in economics at the university in the city. Due to the fact that she is short of the finances to pay her tuition fees for the first year, she would like to request a loan. With this loan, she will be able to have enough finances to cover her university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree. For her dream, Yongy wants to find a better job with a reasonable salary.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees for the first year

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia works hard to support her family. Nelia is married and has a buying and selling of mud crabs business in the Philippines.

Nelia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more mud crabs to sell in the market.

Nelia has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income.

In the future, Nelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more mud crabs to sell in the market

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina works hard to support her family. Avelina is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Avelina requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts, gasoline, etc., for her business.

Avelina has been in this business for nine years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Avelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts, gasoline, etc., for her business

loans.name: Cecilia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ella es Cecilia es una persona de 39 años de edad, alegre, humilde, sonriente, es madre de 4 hijos, 3 mujeres de 21, 19, 14, y el hombre de 17 años de edad, vive con su esposo y se dedica a la cría de ganado porcino.

Cecilia vive en un hogar de manera, rodeado de naturaleza es muy feliz teniendo la vida que tiene, trabaja por sostener sus condiciones y cada que genera capital extra lo invierte en remodelaciones para su vivienda, sus hijos están estudiando, algunos trabajando, pero se cooperan mutuamente para que las cosas en su hogar funcionen económicamente. 

Cecilia se encuentra solicitando un préstamo en el cual busca la sostenibilidad de su negocio, comprar cerdos para abastecer sus cocheras, alimento e implementos para reparar las cocheras, quiere poner puertas corredizas de metal y tener  canales de alimentación y desechos.
texts.en:
This is Cecilia, a 39-year-old woman. She is a joyful, humble, and smiling person. She has four children: three women aged 21, 19, and 14, and a 17-year-old man. She lives with her husband and works raising pigs.

Cecilia lives in a wooden house, surrounded by nature. She is happy with the life she has and works hard to keep it. Every time she has some extra money, she invests it in remodeling her house. Her children study and some of them work. They help each other so that the family economy is in balance.

Cecilia is requesting a loan to have a sustainable business. She will buy pigs to fill her pens, feed, and materials to repair the pens. She wants to install metal sliding doors and build feed containers and gutters for the waste.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fill her pens, feed, and materials to repair the pens.

loans.name: Nelinda

texts.en:
Nelinda is married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nelinda is 35 years old, and three of her children are in school.

She has a buying and selling of vegetables business in the Philippines. Nelinda requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional varieties of vegetables to sell.

Nelinda has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Nelinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional varieties of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
A $700 loan is offered to Juliana to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as noodles, beer, slippers, cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee, water and biscuits. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Juliana independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, beer, slippers, cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee, water and biscuits

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 51 years old and married with four children. 

Carolina is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Carolina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Carolina has been in pig fattening for eight years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Carolina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Uverlina

texts.es:
Uverlina es una persona solitaria, no tiene pareja ni hijos, solo a sus padres, todo lo que tiene lo ha ganado con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio, desde joven siempre le ha gustado trabajar, ahorro y compro el material para construir una casa que aunque es de madera, es propia y agradece mucho a sus padres por darle el terreno.

Uverlina genera ingresos vendiendo alimentos, usa la cocina de casa para fritar los pasteles, empanas y antojos, los cuales vende en tiendas y en su propio hogar. 

Su sueño es poder tener una vivienda construida en material (concreto y adobe), tener un puesto de venta de alimentos, un local propia, ser una distribuidora y estar en todas las tiendas y panaderías de la ciudad.

Uverlina produce actualmente 15 productos diarios, con esto le basta para el sostenimiento de su hogar, pero siente y cree que puede vender y producir mucho más por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de materia prima para aumentar su producción diaria a 20, vendiendo estos productos diarios le permite soñar con comprar a futuro una freidora industrial para producir en masa y ver más cerca ese sueño de tener una vivienda en material.
texts.en:
Uverlina is a solitary person. She doesn’t have a partner or children, only her parents. Everything she has, she earned through great effort and sacrifice.  She has always liked to work, ever since she was young. She saved up and purchased the materials to build a house which, even though it is made of wood, is her own; and she is very grateful to her parents for giving her the land.

Uverlina generates income selling food. She uses the kitchen in her house to fry the cakes, empanadas, and antojitos [traditional snacks] that she sells in stores and in her house.

Her dream is to be able to have a house built of concrete and adobe; have a food sales stand and her own store; and be a distributor to all the stores and bakeries in the city.

Currently, Uverlina produces 15 products daily, which is enough for her to support her home, but she feels and believes that she can make and sell much more. That is why she wants to request a loan for the purchase of basic ingredients to increase her daily production to 20. 

Selling these products daily allows her to dream of purchasing a commercial fryer in the future, in order to mass produce and see her dream of having a permanent store come closer to becoming reality.

loans.use: to purchase basic ingredients in order to increase her daily production.

loans.name: Rolina

texts.en:
Rolina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell mud crabs business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more mud crabs to sell.

Rolina has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Rolina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more mud crabs to sell

loans.name: Manuel Dario

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 29 años de edad, que vive solo y está tratando de sacar un negocio de venta de leche adelante, tiene las vacas pero el pasto que usa para alimentarlas es alquilado, en el momento Manuel está atrasado en una cuota pues que el dinero del arriendo lo debió usar en medicamentos para sus vacas y ahora el arrendatario le pide el capital. Manuel quiere solicitar un préstamo que le permita pagar el arrienda, adelantar un mes y comprar concentrado para su vacas. 

Tu apoyo ayudara a que Manuel siga teniendo disponibilidad de las tierras, seguirá ejerciendo su profesión y ya que compro lo necesario para su vacas puede concentrarse en generar ingresos para su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 29-year-old man who lives alone and is trying to make his business of selling milk a success.  He has cows, but the grass that he uses to feed them is rented.  At the moment, Manuel is behind on his payment because he had to use the rent money for medicine for his cows, and now the tenant is asking for the money.  

Manuel wants to request a loan that will allow him to pay rent and get ahead one month, and to buy feed for his cows.

Your support will help Manuel to continue having access to the land, to continue his job, and to buy what is necessary for his cows so he can concentrate on generating an income for his growth.

loans.use: to pay rent and get ahead one month, and to buy feed for his cows.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Irene is 30 years old and both of her children are in school.

Irene has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Irene has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Victor Alonso

texts.es:
Hoy Víctor está a punto de dar un gran paso en su vida, pasar de ser un empleado a tener un negocio propio, porque se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de dos vacas en periodo de gestación con las que arranca su vida como independiente, buscando mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda conformada por su pareja, su hijo de 7 años y la bebe de 1 mes de edad.

El sueño de Víctor es tener una granja con muchas vacas, darle a su familia una vida digna, ampliar su familia, sería muy feliz logrando estos objetivos.

Víctor pide tu apoyo ya que quiere unirse al gremio de lecheros de Antioquia, apóyalo, has un sueño realidad.
texts.en:
Víctor is on the verge of making a big step forward in his life as he will stop being an employee and start running his own business. He is asking for a loan to buy two cows in their gestation period with which he can kick-start is life as a business owner. He is looking to improve the conditions of his home where his partner, 7 year-old son and one month year-old baby all live. 

Víctor's dream is to have a farm with lots of cows, to provide his family with a decent life and to extend his family. He would be very happy if he managed to achieve these objectives. 

Víctor is asking for your support to help him move into the dairy industry in Antioquia, make his dreams come true.

loans.use: to start up a dairy production business and buy two cows in their gestation period.

loans.name: Jamoliddin

texts.ru: Жамолиддин 40 летный мужчина. Он на районе живет вместе женой и детьми.  Жамолиддин много лет своей жизни провел на скотном дворе, ухаживая за скотами. На сегодняшний день деятельность скотоводство является основным источником дохода в семью Жамолиддин. У Жамолиддин на скотном дворе есть мелко рогатый скот.  И он старательно продвигается вперед, чтобы увеличить их поголовья. Иметь большое количество животных  даст Жамолиддин успешный бизнес в этой сфере и хорошее обеспеченное будущее. Для купли скотов,  он просит кредит. Он надеется, что после финансирования дела пойдут отлично, и Жамолиддин может расширить  свою деятельность.
texts.en: Jamoliddin is a 40 year old man who lives with his wife and children. He has spent many years of his life in the barnyard taking care of livestock. His livestock business is currently providing the main source of income for his family. He keeps small livestock and is diligently moving ahead and increasing his herd. Having a large number of animals means having a successful business and a secure future. In order to buy livestock, he is asking for a loan. He hopes that everything will go well after the financing and that he will be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and increase his herd

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 66 years old, a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Delia has a foot-wear retail business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more foot-wear to sell.

Delia has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Delia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more foot-wear to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 48 years old and has two children who are in school.

Elena is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 4000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elena has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa es una joven de 27 años de edad, madre de dos hijas de 2 y 5, es una comerciante que se dedica a la venta de ropa de hombre y dama la cual distribuye a amigos, familiares y personas del barrio.
Rosa inicio el negocio por necesidad económica, pues años atas se preocupaba más por estar en casa y cuidar a sus hijos hoy como la necesidad es grande sale a vender estos productos diariamente pues los ingresos que genera son muy importantes para el sostenimiento de su hogar.

Rosa para poder vender un producto debe realizar largos desplazamientos, parte de sus ganancias las destina a pagar transporte para acceder a algunos barrios y terrenos lejanos, la competencia en el sector es muy fuerte por ello debe ofrecer productos económicos y de calidad. 

Rosa quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar surtido de ropa de hombre y mujer y guardar un poco de capital, para surtir en otro momento, el motivo es porque ella ofrece a sus clientes comodidades de pago y mientras recoge cartera ese capital que ahorra sirve mucho para comprar algún pedido especial que le realice un cliente.

Todos estos esfuerzos los une en dos sueños que es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y pagar la educación de sus niñas.
texts.en:
Rosa is a young woman who is 27 years old. She has two daughters who are 2 and 5 years old. She is a saleswoman who earns a living selling clothing for men and women which she sells to friends, relatives and people in her neighbourhood.
Rosa started the business for financial need. Years before, she was more worried about being at home and looking after her children but today, as the need is great, she goes out selling these products on a daily basis as the income that she earns is very important for sustaining her household. 

In order to sell her products, Rosa has to travel long distances. She uses some of her income to pay for transport to get to some neighbourhoods and places far away. The competition in the sector is very strong and therefore she needs to offer good value and quality products.

Rosa is asking for a loan to buy stock of clothes for men and women and to keep some capital to use for stocking up at another time. The reason for this is that she offers her customers they chance to pay in instalments, while she collects the money the capital that she saves is very important for buying any special order placed by a customer.

All of her efforts are for two dreams which are to improve the conditions of her home and to pay for the education of her daughters.

loans.use: to buy clothing stock for men and women.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Jean is 42 years old and has four children who are in school.

Mary Jean has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Mary Jean requested a PHP 26,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Mary Jean has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Mary Jean would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lydia is 51 years old.

Lydia has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Lydia has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Jhon Roland

texts.es:
El socio Jhon Roland se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia,el socio es una persona que trbajadora que por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a su familia. El socio solicita el credito para comprar un ganado y alimentos para los ganados.
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Jhon Roland continue with his business raising cattle. He is a person who through his work gets his family ahead. He is requesting a loan to buy a cow and feed for his cattle. He is happy with the loan and promises to comply with the installments of his loan.

loans.use: to buy a cow and feed for his cattle.

loans.name: Asan

texts.ru: Асан, 61 год, женат, есть 4 детей. Образование среднее. 5 лет назад начал заниматься сельским хозяйством - животноводством и птицеводством. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 21 индюшка. Сам разводит и выводит индюшат. Асан знает всю технологию, регулярно делает прививки. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 4,000 сом (KGS). Так как сейчас корм подешевел, Асан решил приобрести его по выгодной цене на будущее, поэтому и обратился в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от бизнеса Асан будет вкладывать в постройку специальных сараев для индюков.
texts.en: Asan is 61, married, and has four children. He has a secondary education and starting farming five years ago, raising livestock and poultry. He currently has two cows and 21 turkeys. He raises and breeds the turkeys himself. Asan is familiar with all of the technology and regularly does vaccinations. His monthly income is around 4,000 som (KGS). Since feed prices are currently low, Asan decided to buy it at a bargain price for future use. This is why he applied for a loan of 15,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank. Asan will use the profits from his business to invest in building a special barn for the turkeys.

loans.use: to buy feed for his turkeys

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 63 years old and married with eight children. Maria works hard to provide for her family. For three years, she has operated a general store in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from farming vegetables. Maria requested a 6000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF), to buy items to sell in her store such as liquor, personal care products and groceries. Maria has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. Maria aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Blanca Olivia

texts.es:
Ella es blanca una empresaria de 33 años de edad, sería, regía, de temperamento templado, una persona muy correcta y justa en sus acciones, se dedica a la porcicultura, vive de la cría y venta de cerdos, no tiene pareja, no tiene hijos se dedica en cuerpo y alma a hacer crecer su negocio y tiene muy buenas ideas que requieren capital para ejecutarlas. 

Mejorar sus ventas, aumentar su inventario de animales son sus objetivos y la tiene muy motivada el hecho de que encontró como realizar estas dos labores, se encontraba juntando capital para una ampliación, pero no tenía capital para abastecer las cocheras y construir los canales de alimentación, bebida y el de desecho de excremento, no quería involucrarse en prestamos pocos confiables.

Un día llego a la puerta de su casa la corporación interactuar, ofreciéndole su gestión y la posibilidad de pertenecer a la comunidad Kiva, quedo encantada y ahora quiere solicitar un préstamo con el cual destruirá las paredes de sus cocheras para construir unas más largas y amplias, comprar cerdos, construirá lso canales y comprara alimento.
texts.en:
Blanca is a 33 year old entrepreneur. She is serious, regal, of mild temperament, a very correct and just person in her actions. She works and lives from raising and selling pigs. She has no partner and no children. She dedicates herself body and soul to expanding her business and she has good ideas that need capital to undertake them.

To improve her sales, and increase her inventory of animals are her objectives and she is very motivated by the fact that she has found how to do these two things. She is getting together capital for an expansion but she does not have the capital to adapt her sheds and build troughs for food, drink and to take away the excrement. She does not want to be involved in questionable loans.

One day the Interactuar corporation came to her doorstep offering their management and the possibility of belonging to the Kiva community. She was delighted and is now requesting a loan with which she will tear down the walls of her sheds to construct larger ones, buy pigs, construct the troughs and buy feed.

loans.use: to renovate her sheds, buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Marlis Judith

texts.es:
Marlis es una mujer de 28 años de edad que se dedica a la actividad de cultivo de papaya, tiene una hermosa familia conformada por dos hijas de 12 y 11 años de edad que le colaboran mucho en su campo y ellas las recompensan con algún dinero para que se compren dulces  y es como manera de agradecimiento por el esfuerzo que realizan.

Como se puede ver en la foto su cultivo apenas está en periodo de maduración, pero al estar tan grande, tiene muchos depredadores, como murciélagos, insectos, roedores entre otros y ella necesita protegerlos pero no cuenta con el capital para comprar los insumos.

Por tal razón Marlis se quiere apoyar en un crédito para comprar el abono, pesticidas, gallinaza, insecticidas que necesita para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos
texts.en:
