Marlis is a 28 year old woman who woks a job growing papaya.  She has a beautiful family made of two daughters who are 12 and 11 years old.  They help a lot in her fields, and she compensates them with some money so that they can buy sweats as a way to thank them for the work that they do.

As you can see in the photo, her crop is just reaching maturity.  But for being this big, they have many predators such as bats, insects, and rodents among others, and she needs to protect them.  But she does not have the capital to buy the products.

For this reason, Marlis wants support from a loan to buy the fertilizers, pesticides, chicken manure, and insecticides that she needs to maintain her crops.

loans.use: To buy the fertilizers, pesticides, chicken manure, and insecticides that she needs to maintain her crops.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta, age 58, is from Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She is married with four children. Violeta has a motorcycle transport business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the members of the local community. She earns a good income doing this type of activity; however, Violeta is now trying to expand her business and has also decided to start a small restaurant. She presented her project proposal to Kiva's partner, Paglaum MPC, to finance the project. Violeta has applied for a loan of 50,000 PHP to pay for the repair and maintenance of her motorcycle and to purchase the needed cooking utensils and raw ingredients to start her new business. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wants her business to be well known and to build a good business for her loyal customers. With her extra income, she wishes to send all her children to school so they may have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her motor and purchase the needed cooking utensils and raw ingredients to start her new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to use in his work.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 47 years old and married with two children.

Cynthia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Cynthia has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from buy and sell rice.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Cynthia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Manuel Gregorio

texts.es:
Él es Manuel es un hombre soltero, responsable, un adulto que inicio hace mucho más de 25 años un negocio de cría de peces y hasta ahora ha sido el sustento de él y de su familia, aunque es soltero tiene dos hijos por los cuales responde.

Manuel vive una vida tranquila, no tiene muchos lujos, tiene lo necesario para vivir y con eso le basta, no es conformista solo que siente a gusto, tiene alimento, una casa y su negocio que puede atender en cualquier instante del día.

Como la cría de peces le genera mucho tiempo muerto, Manuel quiere aprovechar esos lapsos para traer a su hogar otros dos animales, pues quiere implementar una cría de gallinas y pollos, paralelo a su venta de peces.

Manuel solicita un préstamo para la compra de pollos, gallinas y materiales para la construcción de dos galpones uno para cada especie.
texts.en:
This is Manuel.  He is a single, responsible man.  He is an adult that began more than 25 years ago a business raising fish.  Until now, this has been the sustenance for him and his family.  Although he is single, he has two children for whom he is responsible.

Manuel lives a calm life.  He does not have many luxuries.  He has what he needs to live and this is enough for him.  He is not a conformist and feels at ease.  He has food, a home, and his business that he can attend to at anytime during the day.

As raising fish generates a lot of dead time for him, Manuel wants to take advantage of these lapses to bring two other animals to his home.  He wants to start raising hens and chickens, parallel to his selling of fish. 

Manuel is requesting a loan to buy chickens, hens and materials to build two sheds, one for each species.

loans.use: To buy chickens, hens, and materials to build two sheds, one for each species.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert owns an welding machine shop in Pagadian. He diligently pays all his obligations from the earnings of his shop. Recently, he applied for a loan to purchase more equipment for his welding machine shop business. He is adding an extension shop in a nearby village, and he wishes to earn more doing this type of business.

loans.use: To purchase more equipment for the expansion of his welding machine shop business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. Evangeline is married and has a bakery business in the Philippines.

Evangeline requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, margarine, yeast, butter, sugar, etc. for her business.

Evangeline has been in this business for 3 years now.

Evangeline would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, margarine, yeast, butter, sugar, etc. for her business

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto es un empresario agropecuario que se encarga de surtir peces en  parte de los negocios de montería, los años de experiencia y la buena calidad de sus peces le han abierto un espacio en los congelados y neveras de restaurante y negocios. 

Mejorar es siempre lo que le apunta Edilberto, agradece mucho a corporaciones como Interactuar pro el apoyo que le brinda a empresarios como él, ayudándolo a crecer y hacerse en un lugar en el mercado.

Edilberto ya a sus 66 años de edad piensa en tener sostenibilidad de su negocio, vivir con lo que tiene, cuidarlo, protegerlo y cuando llegue el momento dejarle el legado de su negocio a sus dos hijos.


Solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en dos cosas, la primera el alimento de los peces, gracias a la buena y abundante alimentación que les da, sus peces son gordos y de excelente sabor, el otro es realizar un mantenimiento preventivo a las pozos, para no atraer enfermedades y que tengan un agua limpia.
texts.en:
Edilberto is an agricultural entrepreneur who is in charge of supplying fish to the businesses of Montería.  The years of experience and the good quality of fish have opened him a space in the freezers and coolers of restaurants and businesses. 

To improve is always Edilberto's goal.  He is very thankful of the corporations like Interactuar for the support that they offer to businessmen like him, helping him to grow and to get himself a place in the market.

Edilberto, now 66 years old, thinks about having sustainability in his business, to live with what he has, to care for it, to protect it; and when the moment arrives, leave the legacy of his business to his two children.

He is requesting a loan to invest in two things.  The first, fish food.  Thanks to the good and abundant food that he gives them, his fish are fat and have an excellent flavor.  The other is to do preventative maintenance on the wells, to not attract sicknesses and so that they have clean water.

loans.use: To buy fish food and do preventative maintenance of the wells.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a 64-year-old widow with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Divina requested a 25,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Divina has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Divina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Korng

texts.en:
Korng is a 21-year-old, single student who is pursuing an accounting major in her second year, and she lives in the Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. She has been also working as a shop assistant since 2014, making USD 5 each day. 

Korng would like a loan because she is lacking the finances to cover her second-year tuition fees. This is her second loan cycle with Kiva through Kredit MFI. With the loan, she will have enough finances to go through the second year successfully. For her future goals, Korng dreams of running a souvenir shop and saving money to renovate the house.

loans.use: to cover her second-year tuition fees.

loans.name: Sabougnouma  1 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA 1  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TIGUIYA, commune de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: le riz, l’arachide et le maïs avec SAFIATOU la personne au milieu sur la photo position assise. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 4 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 225 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma 1 group is composed of married women averaging 36 years of age, with three children. They all live in polygamous families in Tiguiya, in the community of Kolondieba, a prefecture in the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. 

The group members are on their ninth loan, having duly repaid their prior loan. They grow rice, peanuts, and corn, which is the case of Safiatou, for example. She is the one seated in the middle on the photo. With her loan she plans to buy agricultural inputs [such as fertilizers] and seeds as well as pay the cost of labor to work her filed of 4 ha [10 acres]. After harvesting, she sells her produce in Kolondieba, to a mixed clientele. She plans to earn a revenue of 225,000 CFA francs, which will allow her to pay off her loan and help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds as well as to pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en: Maricris is preparing for the post-harvest operations of her palay (unhusked rice) business in Molave. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for  threshing, drying, storing and processing her harvest to make way for another cropping season. She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and took out a loan. Maricris hopes to see all her children finish their degree and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for post-harvest operations

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is from Molave, Zamboanga del Sur in the Philippines and she is a single parent who is bravely raising her 3 children. She has a livestock business and raises native chickens for sale. 

Susan wants to increase her income, so she engaged in buying and selling native chickens. In need of additional capital, she requested a loan to purchase materials to build steel chicken cages that have wider space for her chickens and to pay for more inventory of native chickens to sell.

Susan deeply wishes to be able to sell more live chickens each week, so she can save enough money for future emergencies and to renovate her house. She hopes to become a supplier of chickens in towns and neighborhoods.

loans.use: to build steel chicken cages that have wider space for her chickens and to pay for more inventory of native chickens for sale

loans.name: Nor Ann

texts.en: Nor Ann is 34 years old and married. She lives in Pagadian. For the past five years, she has been a farmer. Nor Ann is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. While doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 50 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-fledged member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for supporting her gardening activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizer. In the future, Alicia wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizer.

loans.name: Eldefonsa

texts.en:
Eldefonsa is a 32-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines and has requested a 7,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Eldefonsa has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Florame

texts.en:
Florame is a 35-year-old married woman and a very hard-working entrepreneur. Florame has four children who are currently in school.

Florame has a general store business in the Philippines. Florame requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

Florame has been in this business for four years. In the future, Florame would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Luis Rodolfo

texts.es:
Luis, estudio hasta bachiller, está casado y su pareja trabaja en los oficios domesticos y vendiendo cosmeticos; tiene un hijo que vive con él y está estudiando. 

Luis, trabaja con ganado de repasto, lo ha hecho por más de 4 años y lo aprendio de sus padres, para conseguir un ingreso economico para su familia; tambien trabaja de mecanico y en la agricultura; su trabajo está a 1 kilómetro de distancia y llega caminando. 

Luis, necesita el crédito para comprar ganado de repasto, con esto mejorara mucho su negocio, porque podra incrementar su hato de ganado. 

Sus sueños son, trabajar muy fuerte para darles un mejor futuro a su familia y a la vez sueña con tener su propio taller de mecanica.
texts.en:
Luis finished high school and is married now.  His wife takes care of their house and sells cosmetics to earn an extra income.  His son is in school.  

Luis has kept cattle for 4 years, a business that he learned from his parents.  He works as a mechanic and farm laborer, as well, and his income from his different activities covers the family's expenses.  He keeps the cattle a kilometer away.

Luis is applying for a loan that he will use to buy more cattle.  The investment will allow him to grow his herd.  

For the future, Luis wants to carry on his business so that he can provide a better future for his family.  He also hopes to open his own (auto?) repair shop one day.

loans.use: to buy cattle for his livestock business.

loans.name: Jean Richard

texts.fr:
Jean Richard est un père de famille très consciencieux de ses devoirs et responsabilités en tant que tel. Il vit avec sa femme et ses deux enfants dans une maison encore en location en ce moment. Ses enfants sont tous scolarisés actuellement.
Auparavant, son activité génératrice de revenu était la vente des friperies et depuis 2010 jusqu'en 2013, il était employé de son beau frère dans sa boucherie. C'était là qu'il avait acquis ses expériences en boucherie. Ensuite, il démarrait son propre boucherie avec son économie (240,000ariary).
Son désire est de développer et étendre son commerce, améliorer son étale, attirer beaucoup de clients, afin de pouvoir construire sa propre maison.
Il a 40 ans, il s'efforce d'offrir une meilleur condition de vie à sa famille, de plus sa femme est très solidaire avec lui, elle est secrétaire fonctionnaire.
texts.en:
Jean Richard is the father of a family and is very conscientious of his duties and responsibilities as such.  He lives with his wife and his two children in a house which is still being rented at the moment.  His children are both currently in school.  
Before, his revenue-generating activity was selling second-hand clothing, from 2010 until 2013 when his brother-in-law employed him in his butcher's shop.  After that, he started his own butcher's shop with his savings (240,000ariary).  He hopes to develop and grow his business, improve his reach and attract more clients in order to build his own house.  He is 40 years old and he is making an effort to offer his family better conditions of life.  In addition, he and his wife really support each other; she is a government secretary.

loans.use: to buy meats and giblets

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “YANAHUARA SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Ana Maria se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,la socia vende salchipapas que es un plato a base de salchichas y papas, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere que sus hijos que terminen de estudiar, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant grande. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar salchichas y papas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “YANAHUARA SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”. The bank is located in the Urubamba district in Urubamba province in the department of Cusco.

The member Ana Maria still makes a living selling food. She sells "salchipapas" (sausapotatoes) which is a dish made essentially from sausages and potatoes. The member is an enterprising woman that wants to use her business to allow her children to finish their education. Her dream is to have a large restaurant. The member is asking for a loan to buy sausages and potatoes.

The member is happy with the loan and promises to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy sausages and potatoes.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is heading into the next cropping season. She wants to prepare her land and seedbed well. She needs a sufficient supply of rice fertilizer and herbicides to get more produce and also needs a new knapsack sprayer. So, she has applied for a loan from the cooperative. Teresita hopes to save enough for the purchase of a rice thresher to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice fertilizer and herbicides to get more produce

loans.name: Pearly

texts.en:
Pearly is thankful that she was granted a 14,000 PHP loan that she used for pay for a spare tire and maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings helped cover their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to pay for an oil change, fuel and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. It is important that her tricycle is always in a good running condition to ensure efficient service and continuous income. She thanks God and you for your good heart and the financial help that will be given her.

Pearly plans to buy another tricycle unit to improve their business.  She prays that God will bless her family abundantly. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for an oil change, fuel, and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca works hard to support her family. Francisca is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Francisca requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Francisca has been in this business for five years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

Francisca would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 55 years old and married with six children. With one child in school, Elisa works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home care products and other groceries.

Elisa has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, biscuits, junk foods, candies, beverages, coffee and other groceries.  In the future, Elisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Dasa

texts.en:
Dasa is 49 years old and married. Dasa works very hard to provide for her family.

Dasa runs a buy-and-sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Dasa has been in this business for 10 years. . 

In the future, Dasa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is a hard-working entrepreneur and mother of seven children.

She has a business selling purified water retail in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional purified water to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling personal care products.

Vergie dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase additional purified water to sell.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida is 62 years old, married and has eight children. She lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Norte. Leonida and her husband earn a living through farming. They mastered doing this type of activity when they got married. Farming has supported her children's education and her family's needs. She joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative in 2011. She is a hard-working mother who has strong determination to pursue her goals for the benefit of her family, alleviating poverty. Leonida requested a loan to purchase fertilizer to have a good crop yield on her corn and vegetable farm. This will give her farming income a big boost. Someday, she hopes to buy land to expand her farming activities and venture into agri-business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to have a good crop yield on her corn and vegetable farm

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is thankful that she was granted a PHP 10,000 loan to buy gallons of mineral water to sell. Through her earnings, she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would like to apply for another PHP 20,000 loan to buy several gallons of mineral water to sell at retail prices. She is thanking God and you for your good heart and a good outcome for her mineral water retail business.

Jinky aims to sustain and expand her water distribution. She prays that God will bless her to have an abundant life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of he work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

 All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional mineral water to increase her product inventory.

loans.name: Geralyn

texts.en:
Geralyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 37 years old and has two children who are in school.

Geralyn has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell. Geralyn has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Lea

texts.en:
Ma. Lea is 40 years old with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Lea is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Ma. Lea has been in this business for four years and earns additional income from buying and selling fruit.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor works hard to support her family. Eleonor is married and has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Eleonor has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Eleonor would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a 49-year-old married mother of four children, two in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Nilda has a buy-and-sell spice business in the Philippines. Nilda requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount NWTF to buy more spices to sell..

Nilda has been in this business for three years. In the future, Nilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Estela

texts.es:
Rosa es una señora de 31 años de edad, estudió hasta 3° grado, está casada y es madre de 3 hijos de las edades de 1, 5 y 9 años, los dos primeros estudian y el último de un año se queda con ella en casa, con ellos también viven los padres de Rosa.

Rosa se dedica a la elaboración de petates de tule, ella aprendió ese trabajo desde muy pequeña pues sus padres se lo enseñaron, además hace huertos caseros siembra chipilín y lo vende y su esposo trabaja en la brigada desde hace 10 años prestando su servicio.

Rosa invertirá el crédito para comprar madera y pagar mano de obra para reparar el techo de su vivienda.

Ella sueña con ampliar su vivienda para darles mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y que ellos puedan seguir estudiando y en un futuro puedan tener una profesión.
texts.en:
Rosa, 31, left school after the 3rd grade.  She is married and has 3 children: 1-, 5-, and 9-years old.  The two oldest children are in school and the youngest is still at home.  Rosa's parents live with the family.

Rosa makes a living making and selling tule mats [that are commonly used for bedding here].  She learned to make the mats from her parents when she was a girl.  She also makes and sells chipilin and other prepared food.  Her husband has worked for the local "brigada" [police?] for 10 years.  

Rosa will use this loan to pay for the labor and materials she needs to repair her roof.  

For the future, Rosa wants to expand her house so that she can provide a better quality of life for her children.  She also hopes her children will finish school and find good careers.

loans.use: to repair her roof.

loans.name: Rafaela Santos

texts.es:
Rafaela tiene 58 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ningún grado académico, su esposo falleció y ella se quedó a cargo de sus 6 hijos, 5 de ellos ahora están casados por lo tanto solo viven con un hijo y una nieta que se encuentran estudiando.

Rafaela se dedica al negocio de preparación y venta de tamales, cosecha y vende guineos y también compra y vende aves de corral, decidió dedicarse a este negocio porque era su sueño desde que era niña, ella comenta que así la criaron sus padres, de su negocio obtiene ganancias que le ayudan a los gastos del hogar, su hijo y su nieta le ayudan en sus tiempos libres.

Rafaela invertirá el crédito para comprar cuatro quintales de abono y cancelar unas cuentas pendientes.

Ella sueña con ampliar su negocio para que su nieta y su hijo trabajen de la mano, darles el estudio hasta que ellos sean profesionales y decidan qué hacer con su vida.
texts.en: Rafaela is 58 years old and never had the opportunity to study. Her husband passed away and she was left with the care of her six children. Five of them are now married so only one of them and a grandchild who is studying live with her. Rafaela works in the business of making and selling tamales, growing and selling bananas and also buys and sells poultry. She decided on this business because it was her dream since she was a child. She says that is the way her parents brought her up. From her business she obtains the income to help with the household expenses. Her son and grandchild help her in their spare time. Rafaela will invest the loan to buy four quintals of manure and pay some outstanding bills. She dreams of expanding her business so that her grandchild and son can work with her and she can provide them their education until they are professionals and decide what to do with their lives.

loans.use: to buy four quintals of manure and pay off some existing bills.

loans.name: Nehad

texts.en:
Nehad is a 33-years-old married woman from Khan Younis city. She is the mother of three sons and one daughter. Her husband works in transferring goods between the wholesalers and traders using his rickshaw. It is a good business and provide him with a good income. 

After few years of working with this rickshaw, Nehad's husband would like to repair and maintain his rickshaw so he took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him keep it in good running order. This will increase his productivity and also his income
Nahed appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay for repairing and maintenance on her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in 2012 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education offered by the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the co-op's various programs and services. She has a small piece of farm land near her home. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy farm inputs. Monica dreams of having a happy, healthy life and adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia Eufemia is 32 years old, married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Eufemia has a general store business in the Philippines. Eufemia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Eufemia has been in this business for three years. In the future, Eufemia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
Genevieve is 34 years old and a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Genevieve runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like coffee, detergent soap, cereals, canned goods, and soy sauce to sell.

Genevieve has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Genevieve would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like coffee, detergent soap, cereals, canned goods, and soy sauce to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 39 years old and married with five children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Fe has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines. Fe requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more bundles of used clothes to sell.

Fe has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Fe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 54-year-old married mother of six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Alma has a produce-vending business in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more watermelons to sell in her food stall.

Alma has been in this business for three years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more watermelons to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Zuleyma Guadalupe

texts.es:
Zuleyma de 30 años de edad, estudió hasta 3° grado, está acompañada  y es madre de 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 estudian y todos dependen de ella.

Zuleyma se dedica a la elaboración de pan dulce y su hijo de 13 años sale a venderlo en su comunidad, se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace un tiempo, lo aprendió trabajando en panaderías y es un oficio que le gusta mucho y le genera ganancias, también en su tiempo libre le ayuda a su esposo con la agricultura para el bienestar de su familia.

Ella invertirá el crédito para comprar abono, pagar mano de obra, y comprar harina, aceite, sal, levadura, etc. para elaborar pan.

Su sueño es darles a sus hijos buena educación para que sean personas preparadas, además desea que su negocio siga siendo rentable.
texts.en:
Zuleyma, 30, left school after the 3rd grade.  She is married now and has 5 children.  Her 3 oldest children are in school and the two youngest are still at home.  

Zuleyma has a business making pan dulce.  Her 13-year old son sells what she makes.  She learned the business when she worked for a baker and says that it gives her a good income.  She also helps her husband with his farming business. 

Zuleyma will use part of this loan to buy flour, cooking oil, salt, etc. for making pan dulce and the rest to pay for labor and supplies for the family's farming business.

For the future, Zuleyma wants her children to get good educations so that they can find good jobs.  She also hopes her business will continue to be profitable.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “YANAHUARA SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Rosario se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cria cuyes y gallinas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere poner su tienda de abarrotes ya que es su sueño tener su propio negocio, la socia también quiere tener un lugar más amplio para que pueda vender sus animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y también alimentos para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our member, Rosario, belongs to the YANAHUARA SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC community bank in Urubamba, a district in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

Rosario has an animal sales business.  She raises and sells guinea pigs and chickens.  She hopes to earn enough to open a small grocery one day.  She would also like to expand the area where she keeps her animals.  For now, she is applying for a loan, part of which she will use to buy guinea pigs and chickens and the rest to buy animal feed.

Rosario is grateful for the loan and committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy animals for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a  47-year-old single mother of four children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Ana has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Ana requested a PHP 9,000 loan NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Ana has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Analotis

texts.en:
Analotis works hard to support her family. Analotis is married with one child and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Analotis requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish and other materials for her business.

Analotis has been in this business for 10 years now, and earns additional income from fishing.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other materials for her business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet works hard to support her family. Janet is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Janet requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Janet has been in this business for seven years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

Janet would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery stock to sell

loans.name: Jacqueline Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “YANAHUARA SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Jacqueline Elizabeth se dedica al negocio de  internet, la socia tiene una cabina de internet, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener otro negocio de internet. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar una computadora.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our member, Jacqueline Elizabeth, belongs to the YANAHUARA SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC community bank in Urubamba, a district in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

Jacqueline Elizabeth is an enterprising and hard-working woman.  She sells Internet services and has a space in town where her customers can come to use the Internet.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to expand the business and, specifically, to buy another computer.  The business is, she says, her means of getting ahead in the world.

Jacqueline Elizabeth is grateful for the loan and committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her Internet services business.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Avelina is 51 years old now.

Avelina has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Avelina has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is 50 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in school.

Aurora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Aurora has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Aurora aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ayda Rosa

texts.es:
Ayda es una mujer de 53 años de edad que con su negocio de cría de aves ayuda a su esposo en el mantenimiento de su hogar, es madre de 5 hijos pero todos ellos son mayores de edad y tienen su respectiva familia y aunque no se olvidan de su madre y le ayudan con capital no le gusta ser una mantenida y trabaja por su cuenta. 

Mejorar las condiciones de su casa es su sueño, expandir su local, tener sostenibilidad del negocio, aumentar el número de aves es objetivo para este año.

Ayda necesita un apoyo financiero para la compra de pollos, alimento, y materiales para construir un nuevo galón, tu préstamo servirá mucho a esa mujer del campo porque permitirá tener un galpón extra para duplicar su actividad, mejorar sus ingresos y a la larga su pequeño aporte se ve reflejado en los supermercados y tiendas donde quizás este a la venta algunos de sus pollos.
texts.en:
Ayda is 53 years old. She has a business raising poultry, and through this work she is able to help her husband to keep their home.

She is the mother of five children, all of the them grown up and with families of their own. They do not forget their mother and give her a hand financially, but rather than depending on the support of others, Ayda prefers to work on her own.

Ayda dreams of improving the conditions in her home. To expand her business successfully, increasing the number of poultry, is her objective for this year.

She needs financial assistance to buy chickens, feed, and to build a new coop. Your loan will be of great help to this woman from the countryside, because it will allow her to have an additional coop and double the activity, thereby increasing her income. 

In time, her small business may reach the supermarkets and stores where they can sell some of her chickens.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, and materials to build a new coop.

loans.name: Lamdaria

texts.en:
Lamdaria works hard to support her family. Lamdaria is married and has a fish pond operator business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase a new breed of milk fish and pay for laborers' salaries.

Lamdaria has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Lamdaria would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new  breed of milkfish and pay for laborers' salaries.

loans.name: Edwin Johansen

texts.es:
Edwin, forma parte de una familia integrada por su esposa y sus hijos, dependen tres personas económicamente de él, no tiene familia en el extranjero; es propietario de una venta de accesorios para la costura, su negocio lo heredo de su familia, lo atiende desde hace 20 años en un horario de 7:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., su ventaja es que esta frente a un supermercado y hay mucha afluencia de clientes y su desventaja es la alta competencia que existe en la zona.
Invertirá en botones, zippers, broches, encajes, perlas, etc., al por mayor de esta manera ahorrara en la compra y tendrá oportunidad de ofrecer mejores precios para lograr que sus clientes prefieran sus productos y así tener nuevas ganancias con las que cubrirá sus obligaciones.
Edwin desearía tener su bazar en el mercado y asegurarle un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Edwin is part of a family made up of his wife and their children. There are three people who depend economically on him. He has no family abroad.

He is the owner of a sewing accessories business which he inherited from his family and has been doing this for twenty years. He works from 7:00AM until 5:00PM. The advantage is that he is in front of a supermarket and there is an abundance of customers and the disadvantage is there is a lot of competition in the area.

He will buy buttons, zippers, snaps, lace, pearls, etc., buying at wholesale so he can save in the purchase and will have the opportunity of offering better prices so his customers will prefer his products and he will have new profits with which to meet his obligations.

Edwin would like to have his bazaar inside the marketplace to ensure a better future for his family.

loans.use: to buy buttons, zippers, snaps, lace, pearls, etc., at wholesale so he can save in the purchase and will have the opportunity of offering better prices

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is 36 years old and has four children. Jona is married, and her children are currently in school.

Jona is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jona requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Jona has been in this business for three years, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa heads up for the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well, especially the much needed land and seedbed preparations. She wants to have enough supply of corn fertilizer, for which she applied a loan from the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative.

Rosa hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase corn fertilizer

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Eva is 49 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Eva has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Eva has been in this business for 4 year. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ceriaca

texts.en:
Ceriaca is a woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ceriaca is 54 years old now.

Ceriaca has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She gas requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell .

Ceriaca has been in this business for 19 years. In the future, Ceriaca would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 29 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jenelyn has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. Jenelyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and beauty products for her business.

Jenelyn has been in this business for five years. Jenelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and beauty products for her business

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “YANAHUARA SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Antonia se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the Yanahuara Señor de Torrechayoc Community Bank located in the district of Urubamba, province of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco.

Antonia earns her living selling dishes such as chicken cooked in the oven, soups, and stir-fried meat dishes. She works from 8 am to 6 pm and has had her business for several years. All is going well. Her dream is to own a restaurant.

She is seeking a loan to buy ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and chicken. She is happy to get a loan and promises to pay back the money according to the schedule.

loans.use: buy ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and chicken

loans.name: Celinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “YANAHUARA SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Celinda  se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia hace anticuchos que es un plato a base de carne y papas, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar papas y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Celinda is a member of the Yanahuara Señor de Torrechayoc Community Bank located in the district of Urubamba, province of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco.

Celinda earns her living selling food. She wants to get ahead by running this business. She makes anticuchos which is a dish based on meat and potatoes. Her dream is to expand her food business. She is seeking a loan to buy potatoes and meat.

She is happy to get a loan and promises to pay back the money according to the schedule.

loans.use: buy ingredients such as potatoes and meat

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is encouraged that she was granted a 19,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she has been able to send her children to school and fund their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a 40,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy large quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, instant noodles, and frozen foods which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales, thus increasing her earnings to cover their everyday needs and her children's schooling. She is thanking God and you for your good heart and the financial help that will be given her. 

Jennifer dreams of having a bigger general store. She prays that God will bless the works of her hands and help her live an abundant life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 54 years old and married with two children.

Delia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Delia has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Delia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Lerma

texts.en:
Ma. Lerma is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Lerma is 47 years old and has six children who are presently in school.

Ma. Lerma has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. Ma. Lerma requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase motorcycle spare parts and gasoline and pay for vehicle maintenance for her business.

Ma. Lerma has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and gasoline and pay for vehicle maintenance for her business

loans.name: Khumora

texts.ru: Хумора из Пяндж. Она замужем, и на районе живет вместе мужем и свекровью. Ее муж занимается растениеводством, и помогает Хуморе в работе. Ей всего 20 лет и она дехканка. Очень мало встречаются такую дехканку  в таком юном возрасте. Дехканы очень трудолюбивые, и они любить зарабатывать своим честно нажитым трудом.  У Хумора есть собственный земельный участок, на который она трудиться уже 3 года.  Хумора получила этот опыт от родителей, она очень благодарна им. Она хочет получить богатый урожай и старается всеми способами. Для этой цели она просит кредит для покупки минеральных удобрений. Хумора верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Khumora is from Pyandj. She is married, and lives in the country with her husband and mother-in-law. Her husband grows crops, and he helps Khumora with her work. She is only 20 years old she is a dehkan [a mid-sized Central Asian farm] farmer. It is very rare to meet a dehkan farmer that is so young. Dehkan farmers are very hard-working, and they love to earn their living through the their own honest labor. 

Khumora has her own plot of land, on which she has labored for 3 years now. Khumora got this opportunity from her parents, and she is grateful to them. She wants to have a rich harvest, and she is seeking out every possibility to help her achieve this goal. With this in mind, she has requested a loan to buy mineral fertilizers. Khumora trusts in you and your support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 year.

Angeles requested a loan from NWTF for 22,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc

loans.name: Ma. Regina

texts.en:
Ma. Regina is 30 years old and married with one child.

Ma. Regina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell such as milk, coffee, drinks, canned goods, noodles and spices.

Ma. Regina has been in this business for one year. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as milk, coffee, drinks, canned goods, noodles and spices

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 32 years old and has three children. Two of her children are in school.

Edna is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Edna has been in this business for 10 years, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Edna would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea is a 21-year-old single woman. She is from Svay Rieng Province in Cambodia. She is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in nursing. She is a student in the first year at a university in her province. Her mother runs a business at home. 

Sophea is requesting a loan because she lacks the finances to pay her tuition fees from the first to the third year. With this loan, she will be able to cover her university fees and earn skills to achieve her future goal. In the future, Sophea hopes to run her own clinic.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees from the first to the third year

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jesusa is 49 years old, and one of her children is currently in school.

Jesusa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jesusa requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Jesusa has been in this business for six years. Jesusa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mahmudahon

texts.en: Mahmudahon is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1955. She is living in a small town. She is married and has children. For more than 35 years she has been sewing traditional women's dresses. She sews modern design dresses and has permanent customers every day. Basically she sews traditional mattress “Kurpacha”. The annual income of her family is somewhat enough for family needs such as food and clothes. However, her daughter is sick now and she doesn't have money to treat her. She asked for help from IMON and requested a loan to treat her daughter in a medical clinic. She hopes to be supported and have a healthy daughter.

loans.use: to treat her daughter in a medical clinic.

loans.name: Liboria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “YANAHUARA SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Liboria  se dedica al negocio de venta de granos secos como maiz, trigo entre otros, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de granos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maiz, cebada y trigo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Yanahuara Señor de Torrechayoc", located in the district of Urubamba, belonging to the province of Urubamba and the administrative division of Cusco. 

Liboria sells dried grains like corn and wheat, among others, and through this business she wants to get ahead. Her dream is to expand her grain selling business. She is asking for a loan to purchase corn, barley and wheat. 

She is happy because of the loan and promises to make the payments for what she owes.

loans.use: to purchase corn, barley and wheat.

loans.name: Takeshi

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “YANAHUARA SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Takeshi  se dedica al negocio de transporte, el socio tiene un mototaxi que hace servicio de taxi,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el sueño del socio es comprarse una moto. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su moto.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Takeshi belongs to the “YANAHUARA SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC” communal bank which is located in the district of Urubamba, which belongs to the province of Urubamba in Cusco department.

Takeshi works in transportation. He has a motorcycle with which he offers taxi services. He works from 8 am until 7pm. His dream is to buy a motorcycle. He is requesting a loan to buy motorcycle tires. He is happy with the loan and promises to comply with the payment of his installments.

loans.use: to buy tires for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco de 78 años de edad, es una apersona  muy conocido en su comunidad por su servicio a los demás, está casado y tiene 2 hijos.


Francisco se dedica a la venta de agua desde hace 8 años, motivado por las ganancias que le genera decidió continuar con esta actividad ya que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, también se dedica a la agricultura. 



Él solicita este crédito para comprar materiales de construcción ya que se encuentra reparando el techo de su casa que se encuentra en mal estado.

Sus metas a futuro son tener una vivienda adecuada con las mejores condiciones para su familia y apoyar en la educación de sus nietos.
texts.en:
Francisco, 78, is a person who is well-known in his community for his service to others.  He is married and has 2 children.

Francisco has had a business selling water for 8 years.  Motivated by the earnings he generates, he decided to continue with this activity,and now it is his main source of income.  He is also a farmer. 

Francisco is requesting this loan to buy construction materials, because he is now making repairs to his roof, which is in bad condition.

For the future, Francisco's goal is to have a home that is in an optimal state for his family. He also wants to support his grandchildren with their education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to fix his roof

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 49 years old and married. Marcelina is married and has three children who are all presently in school.

Marcelina is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Marcelina requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marcelina has been in this business for 14 years, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 53 years old and married. Elena has eight children, three of whom are in school.

Elena is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Elena has been in this business for 18 years, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elena would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel de 56 años de edad, estudió hasta 9° grado de educación básica, es casado y padre de 10 hijos de los cuales 5 ya son independientes y los otros 5 aún estudian.

Miguel se dedica a la agricultura, lo que cosecha le sirve para darle la alimentación a sus hijos y otra parte la vende, él tiene muchos años de experiencia en este trabajo el cual aprendió de sus padres desde muy pequeño, el lugar de trabajo le queda a medio km de su casa y el horario es de 5:00 a.m a 1:00 p.m y sus hijos le ayudan en su tiempo libre.

Él necesita este crédito para comprar abono y pagar alquiler del terreno donde cultiva.

Su mayor sueño es darles el estudio a sus hijos y que ellos sean buenos  profesionales en un futuro  para que su condición de vida sea diferente.
texts.en:
Miguel, 56, has as 9th grade education.  He is married, and is the father of 10 children, 5 of whom are already independent.  His other 5 children are in school.

Miguel is a farmer.  He sells part of his crops, and uses the rest to feed his children.  He has many years of experience in this line of work, which he learned from his parents at an early age.  His fields are half a kilometer from his house, and he works from 5am until 1pm.  His children help him in their free time.

Miguel needs this loan to buy fertilizers and to rent some land to cultivate.

Miguel's main dream is to provide his children with an education so that they can become good professionals in the future and have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to rent some land to cultivate

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita, 54, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines, is married to Lorenzo and is a mother to her three children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nenita operates a "Piso-Net" business. Piso Net is basically a combination of PC rental and Arcade rental services wherein customers can pay for the services by inserting coins into the machine. There is more need for services like these as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school requirements. She also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume or any office documentation as well as people who just love to surf the net and use the social network. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 450 in profit every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy an additional Piso Net unit for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Nenita dreams of giving her family a better and sustainable livelihood. She also aspires for her business to expand and progress. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy an additional Piso Net unit for her business.

loans.name: Ana Jesús

texts.es:
Ana de 44 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y trabaja como albañil y sus hijos se encuentran estudiando.  

Ana se ha dedicado a la elaboración de pan desde hace varios años y sale a venderlo a su cantón, su pan es muy bueno y delicioso y muy gustado en el pueblo y sus alrededores por lo que es muy buscada  para las temporadas de semana santa y navidad.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar harina, azúcar, sal, levadura, leche para elaborar pan y también comprará insumos agrícolas. Esto le servirá de mucho pues así se gana l vida a diario.
 
Ella sueña con seguir trabajando con esta institución para poder superarse.
texts.en: Ana is 44 years old, married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer and works as a bricklayer and her children are studying. Ana has worked making bread for a number of years. She goes out and sells it in her canton. Her bread is very good and delicious and well-liked in the community and it's surroundings. People look for it during Easter week and Christmas. She needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, salt, yeast and milk to make bread and also agricultural inputs. This will help her a lot as this is how she earns her living each day. She dreams of continuing working with this institution in order to excel.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, salt, yeast and milk to make bread and also agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa de 76 años de edad habita en casa propia desde hace 12 años junto a sus dos hijos mayores de edad que le apoyan con los gastos de su hogar. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que presta sus servicios domésticos lavando ropa ajena, pero además cuenta con una venta de tortillas, lo cual le permite que sus ingresos sean mejores. Rosa anteriormente solicito un  crédito que le permitió realizar la conexión de agua potable en su vivienda, por lo que se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo recibido y de nueva cuenta solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir las paredes del cuarto de lámina ya que teme por su seguridad y en invierno la lluvia se filtra deteriorando sus pocas pertenencias.
texts.en:
Rosa is 76 years old and has lived in her own home for 12 years together with her two grown up children who support her with the household expenses. She is an entrepreneurial woman who offers her services washing clothes for other people, but she also sells tortillas, which allows her to increase her income. 

Rosa previously asked for a loan which allowed her to connect to a drinking water supply in her house, for which she feels very grateful for the support received and so she is asking for a new loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to construct walls for the room made of metal sheeting, since she fears for her security and in the winter water leaks in damaging her few possessions.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to construct walls for the room made of metal sheeting.

loans.name: Arlynessa

texts.en: Arlynessa is 42 years old. She is married with four children. Her major source of income is rice farming. She is also engaged in palay trading and sells rice. She has been in this business for 11 years. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income to her due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Arlynessa wants to expand her rice production so that her customers will be served well and so that she will be able to supply more bags of rice in the market. She is planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She had previously availed loans to purchase more bags of palay to produce more rice and now she is re-applying for a loan for her rice production business.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of palay to produce more rice.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis, de 78 años de edad, no estudio porque el centro escolar estaba muy lejos y no podía transportarse, está acompañado y su pareja es ama de casa, ella tiene 5 hijos, pero solo 3 viven con ellos porque los otros dos murieron, los tres que viven con él, trabajan en la agricultura.

Luis, es sastre desde hace 14 años, todo lo que sabe lo aprendió gracias a que un tío le enseño como debía hacerlo y desde ahí decidió dedicarse a esto; antes de eso se dedicaba a la agricultura y a trabajar en cafetales, ahora trabaja en su casa y a veces cuando su esposa tiene tiempo le ayuda, su horario es de 8:00 a 6:00 de la tarde.

Luis, está solicitando el crédito para comprar tela, hilo y otros materiales que necesita para hacer las prendas, esto va a mejorar su calidad de vida, porque obtendrá más ganancias y podrá comprar algunas cosas que le hacen falta para el hogar.

Luis, espera dejar un gran legado para su familia, además las ganancias de su negocio las utiliza para comprar artículos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Luis is 78 years old and did not go to school because it was very far away and he could not get transportation. He lives with his partner who is a housewife. She has five children, but only three live with them because the other two died. Three live with him and work in agriculture.

Luis has been a tailor for 14 years and learned everything he knows thanks to his uncle who taught him how to do it, and since then he decided to conduct this business. Previously he worked in agriculture and in coffee plantations. Now he works in his house and sometimes when his wife has time, she helps him. His schedule is from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.

Luis is requesting the loan to purchase fabric, string and other materials that he needs to make garments. This is going to improve his quality of life since he will have more profits and will be able to purchase some things that are needed for the household. 

Luis hopes to leave a legacy for his family and he uses the profits from his business to buy items for his home.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, string and other materials he needs to make garments.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 42-year-old working woman. After she married, she felt that she should help her husband to improve their financial condition, so she started a business selling garments in her locality. She buys variety of clothes from wholesale market at lower rates and then sells them to the people of her community at profit. Shazia believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. She is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. 

Shazia has taken out a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase new collection of clothes(ladies garments) to increase sales and earn substantial profits. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase new collection of clothes(ladies garments) to increase sales and earn substantial profits

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is 49 years old and he has 4 children two of them are going to college and the other two are going to school.  

Juan is a widower and he is still working at the transportation business.  Juan needs a loan to fix the seating and to buy tires for his vehicle.  He's been working as a driver for 4 years.

He is asking you to trust him again.  He works hard and he will give his best.

loans.use: to fix the seating and to buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
La socia Primitiva pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN CHANCA.
La socia continua con su negocio de venta de comestibles, ella continua con la tienda de abarrotes la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros. 
La socia agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado
texts.en:
Primitiva is a member of the VIRGEN CHANCA communal bank. She continues with her business selling groceries and has been doing so for quite some time. It has been going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day.  She is a responsible and hard-working person so she is able to help her family get ahead in this way.

Primitiva has asked for this loan so she can buy rice, sugar and other things. She is grateful to the investors for her her loan and is pleased with the support that has been offered to her.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and other things.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Richel is 49 years old and both of her children are in school.

Richel has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Richel has been in this business for three years. In the future, Richel would like to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 24 years old with two children. With two children in school, Judith works very hard to provide for them.

Judith runs a General Store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, eggs, home product care, and other groceries.

Judith has been in this business for 5 years now. 

In the future, Judith would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, eggs, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en:
Joselito is 51 years old. Joselito is married and has four children who are in school.

Joselito is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Joselito requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise his livestock.

Joselito has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Joselito would like to save enough money so she could afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise livestock

loans.name: Marretta

texts.en:
Marretta works hard to support her family. She is single with four children and has a manicure and pedicure service business in the Philippines.

Marretta requested a loan of 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

Marretta has been in this business for 5 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 58 years old and single.  

Juana is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Juana requested a loan of 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Juana has been farming vegetables for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Juana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jacquelyn

texts.en:
Jacquelyn is 35 years old, is married and has three children.

Jacquelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc

Jacquelyn has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from a buy and sell frozen foods business.

She successfully paid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Jacquelyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 38 years old and married. Gloria works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, personal care products and other groceries. Gloria has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, personal care products and other groceries

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 43 years old now.

Elizabeth has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested for a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 55 years old and has three children who are in school.
