Epifania has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Epifania has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Epifania has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Epifania would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Agustina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling beauty products. Agustina is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Agustina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 62 years old and has one child in school.

Gloria has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Gloria has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Gloria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира, 55 лет, в разводе, есть ребенок. У Гулмиры- высшее образование, с 1995 года занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Гулмиры на сегодняшний день имеется 8 коров, 70 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Гулмира направит на развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Gulmira is 55 years old, divorced, and has a child. Gulmira has a higher education. Since 1995, she has been practicing livestock farming. Thanks to her hard work, Gulmira currently has 8 cows and 70 sheep on her farm. For the further development of her business, Gulmira turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 25,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock to increase the size of her herd. Gulmira will use the earnings from the loan on the further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 58 years old and she lives at her mother-in-law's house. She is married. Her husband is a driver and she sells used clothes. The couple has a son. 

Ana needs a loan to fix the roof at the place where she lives. As you can see in the picture, the roof is damaged and could get worse if she doesn't do something. That is why she hopes you can help her again. Ana and her husband are fine, both are healthy.

loans.use: to fix the roof at the place where she lives

loans.name: Los Heraldos Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS HERALDOS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mariluz ella es soltera y tiene 50 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cafetin,la socia vende tortas,cafes y pasteles,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere abrir otro cafetin,la socia es una mujer emprendedora. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tortas, empanadas y pasteles.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de internet, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal back “Los Heraldos” (The Heralds).  This bank is located in the district of Cusco which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Mariluz is single, 50 years old and has 3 children.  She works in her business - a small café.  She sells cakes, coffee and pastries.  She already has several years in this business and it is going very well for her.  By means of this business she wants to open another small café.  She is a very enterprising woman.  She is requesting the loan to purchase cakes, pies and pastries.
 
The other members work in an internet business, a business selling clothing, a grocery store business and a restaurant business.

Mariluz is grateful to those who are a part of this dream by means of this method and she is committed to paying her installments in the period established.

loans.use: to purchase cakes, pies and pastries.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 39 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Loida has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Loida has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Loida would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in Ajakurt village of the Tavush region with his family: his parents, wife and 16-year-old son. 

David is involved in a car repair service. From the small rented garage, David provides auto repair service for local people in Ajakurt village. His family also specializes in honey production, which is also a very important source of income for the family. 

Because the work with auto repair takes too much time from David, his 71-year-old father is the only one who manages the honey production. David takes the produced honey to the nearby regions for sale using his own truck. He has applied for this loan to ask lenders to help him with renovation of the truck to bring it to working condition and transport products to the market. He also would like to make gas installation on the truck to reduce costs, so more income is left for the family. 

David has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the truck to bring it into working condition and transport honey products to the market, and to pay for gas installation on the truck to reduce costs

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Charita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Charita is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Charita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gloria is 51 years old and has one child in school.

Gloria has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Sabrina

texts.en:
Sabrina is a talented woman.  She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1991, and is living in the district with her family.  She is married and has children.  She is an honest, responsible, and clever person.  

From 2008 to 2011 Sabrina worked as a laboratory assistant at a government agency, and from 2011 to 2013 she worked as an accountant at the democracy party of her country.  Since 2013 she has worked at the ministry of finance of her district as a specialist.  She is also a second year student studying at the University to earn her higher education in business law.  

The salary that she earns from her work is not enough to feed her family as well as pay tuition fees.  She is requesting financial support from KIVA and IMON International to pay her higher education costs.  She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to pay her higher education costs.

loans.name: Adriana Paola

texts.es:
Adriana es una joven mujer de 23 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de leyes. 
Ella es inteligente, responsable, comprometida, constante, dulce, cariñosa, sensible y sincera. Sus estudios lo realiza en una universidad privada ubicada en la zona central caracteriza por agrupar a la mayoría de las instituciones educativas publicas y privadas. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados. 
Adriana es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lacio lo usa suelto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que sólo habla en familia y habla español porque estudia y vive en la ciudad. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que trabajan independientemente, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Ella estudia la carrera de leyes y se encuentra en 4 año de 5 años que dura la carrera; disfruta ayudando a las personas, le gusta entender los problemas legales para encontrar la mejor solución conveniente para ambas partes, su carácter es de servicio, “mi tiempo lo reparto en los estudios y trabajando como tramitadora legal…” comenta. La ventaja de sus actividades es que los horarios no se cruzan entre sí, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para pagar sus gastos universitarios. Su sueño es ser profesional para ascender en su trabajo y desea realizar la compra de libros y pago de cuotas de su carrera. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que se dedica al estudio profesional. 
Es por esos motivos que Adriana solicita un préstamo para la compra de libros y pago de cuotas de su carrera para ascender en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Adriana, a single, young woman, has no children and is 23 years old. Currently, she is studying in a Law school.  She's intelligent, responsible, committed, persevering, sweet, affectionate, sensitive, and sincere.  She studies in a private university located in the central district, known for bringing together the majority of the public and private educational institutions.  The climate is cold and dry with temperatures between zero and 12 degrees centigrade during the day.

Adriana is short, dark, and thin, with brown eyes, and she wears her long, straight black hair loose.  Her native language is Aymara, which she speaks only with her family; she speaks Spanish because she's a student and lives in the city.  She lives in her parents' home.  They work independently.  They live in their own house made of brick and cement with a tin roof and a dirt floor, and have potable water, electricity, and gas service.

She studies law and is in her fourth year of the five-year program.  She enjoys helping people and likes to understand legal problems and find the best solution for both parties.  She is service-oriented by nature.  "I divide my time between my studies and working as a legal processor," she said.  The advantage of her activities is that her schedules don't interfere with one another.  The disadvantage is that she doesn't have the money she needs to cover her university expenses.  Her dream is to be a professional so she can move up in her job.

She wants to buy books and pay her university fees.  This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the four years she has been pursuing professional studies.

loans.use: to buy books and to pay her university fees so she can move up in her job

loans.name: Virgen De Copacabana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE COPACABANA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gloria ella es soltero y tiene 61 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales como maiz, trigo entre otros, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de granos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maiz, cebada y trigo.


Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo ya que sus trabajos no le dieron el premiso en las horas de la reunion.

 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de madera, negocio de fotocopiadora, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de carros.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "Virgen de Copacabana" [Virgin of Copacabana], which is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and administrative region of Cusco. 

Gloria is single, 62 years of age and has two children. She works selling grains such as corn and wheat, among others, and through this business she wants to get ahead. Her dream is to expand her grain selling business. She is asking for the loan in order to purchase corn, barley and wheat. 

The photo of the members that is pasted onto the group photo was taken after the meeting because they asked to be excused for work-related reasons since their jobs did not give them leave for the meeting. 

The other members are engaged in businesses such as selling lumber, a photocopy business, a grocery shop, and selling cars. 

Gloria thanks those who are a part of her dream through this medium and she promises to make the payments of her dues within the established timeframe.

loans.use: to purchase corn, barley and wheat.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia has operated a sari-sari (variety) store business in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines, for almost 4 years.  She generates income through her business. 

She is a member of PMPC in the year 2014 and requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital.  Antonia is thankful for the help given by PMPC.  She wants to buy additional inventory of canned goods, sugar, laundry soap, and shampoo to sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital for her "sari-sari" (variety) store business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
“A hardworking and diligent mother” best describes Lucy, who is from Dumingag. She and her husband are farmers who earn their living planting rice, corn, vegetables, and root crops.

As an active member of Kiva's field partner PMPC, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to pay for a good variety of seedlings and buy bags of fertilizer and compost. In the future, she hopes to improve her farm and live a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to pay for a good variety of seedlings and buy bags of fertilizer and compost.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 75 years old and married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Erlinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Erlinda has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Josefina Arevalo de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida sus tres hijos y su nieta, ella posee un negocio de venta de comida ubicado en la playa que está cerca de su casa, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios gracias a su trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante con su familia, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de carnes, pescados, mariscos, pollos, verduras, frutas, refrescos, granos básicos, etc. todo por mayor y así poder continuar con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Josefina Arevalo, age 55, lives in her own house with her life partner, their three children, and her granddaughter.  She has a business selling food, which is located at the beach that is close to her house.  She has a lot of customers because of the good prices.  Thanks to her work, she has been able to get ahead with her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy meat, fish, seafood, chicken, vegetables, fruits, soft drinks, and basic grains, etc.  She will buy everything wholesale.  This way she will be able to continue with her work in order to have better earnings and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy meat, fish, seafood, chicken, vegetables, fruits, soft drinks, and basic grains, etc.

loans.name: Akmal

texts.ru: Акмал житель города под названием Худжанд. Худжанд большой и красивый города Республики Таджикистан. Акмал родился и вырос в городе Худжанд. Он хорошо знает все точки города. Акмал любить водить машину, и он решил заняться таксистом. Уже год он продвигает свою любимую работу. Еще он берет заказы на свадьбы. Вот так он зарабатывает на жизнь. Сейчас сезон свадьбы, и у него данный момент много заказов  на свадьбы. Но его машина сломался ему надо починить машину. Для ремонта нужны деньги. Акмал решил взять кредит и отремонтировать свою автомашину. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ему восстановить автомашину и быстрее начать работу. Он верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Akmal is a resident of a town called Khujand. Khujand is a large and beautiful town in the Republic of Tajikistan. Akmal was born and raised in Khujand. He knows all parts of the town well. Akmal loves to drive, and he decided to become a taxi driver. He has been doing his beloved work for a year. He also takes orders to drive for weddings. This is how he makes his living. Now it is wedding season, and he has a lot of wedding orders at the moment. But his car has broken down and he needs to repair it. He needs money for repairs. Akmal has decided to take a loan and repair his car. The requested loan will help him to repair his car and start work more quickly. He believes in you and in your support.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 47 years old and married.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal business for 8 years and also earns an income from a general store.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia is 56 years old and has three children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

For the past year Inocencia has operated a sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines. She is applying for a 7000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy additional items to sell like eggs, personal care products and other groceries. She is working to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Nelida

texts.en:
Nelida is 35 years old and has four children.  She is married and three of her children are still in school.

For 3 years now, Nelida has operated an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.  She requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.  She has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Ronita

texts.en:
Ronita works hard to support her family.  She is married and has two children.  For 6 years she has operated a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines.

Ronita requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional plastic items to sell in her stall.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional plastic items to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Joan is 26 years old and has two children who are in school.

Joan has a buy and sell of rice business in the Philippines. Joan requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Joan has been in this business for three years. In the future, Joan would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is single and has a butane-refilling business in the Philippines.

Lolita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional tank of butane for her business.

Lolita has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional tank of butane for her business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda has a small business selling food she makes. Her goods sell well every day since she is the only vendor in her barangay, or neighborhood.

Recently Rosalinda approached Kiva's field partner Paglaum for a 14,900 PHP loan to buy ingredients to make her snacks. She works continually to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make her snacks.

loans.name: Laurabet

texts.en:
Laurabet is 42 years old and has three children. She is married and all of her children are in school.

Laurabet is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Laurabet has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Laurabet would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Humor

texts.ru:
Хумору 53 года. У нее двое детей. Им 19 и 17 лет. Для нее ее дети это все, смысл жизни и мотивация в работе. Ее дети являются долгожданными. Хумор старается быть хорошей и примерной матерью. 
    Хумор работает в сфере торговли. Она продает ткани для шитья национальной женской одежды. Вот уже 4ый год она продвигает свой бизнес. Хумор планирует привести новый товар для летней одежды. Для привозки и купли необходимо еще не денежные средства за счет них она планирует осуществить свой план.
texts.en:
Humor is 53 years old. She has two children. They are 19 and 17 years old. Her children are everything for her, the meaning of her life and her motivation to work. He children were long-awaited. Humor tries to buy a good and exemplary mother.

Humor works in the field of trade. She sells cloth to sew national women's dress. She is now in her fourth year of business. Humor plans to bring in new goods for summer clothing. More money is essential to buy and transport them, and she intends to carry out her plan with it.

loans.use: to buy cloth for summer clothing.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 45 years old and married with four children who are still in school. Marina works very hard to provide for them.

Marina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, sugar, drinks, etc.

Marina has been in this business for three years. 

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, sugar, and drinks

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May works hard to support her family. She is married with two children and has a buy and sell of personal collection items business in the Philippines.

May requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy personal collection items to sell like beauty soap, body lotion, bags, wallet, shoes, etc.

May has been in this business for two years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy personal collection items to sell like beauty soap, body lotion, bags, wallets, and shoes

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business making dried fish in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to make dried fish.

Leah has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Leah would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 44 years old and married with four children. Lolita works very hard to provide for them.

Lolita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like snack foods, soft drinks, sanitary pads, diapers, detergent soap, cereals, etc. to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft drinks, sanitary pads, diapers, detergent soap, cereals, etc. 

Lolita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like snack foods, soft drinks, sanitary pads, diapers, detergent soap, and cereals to sell

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 38 years old and married with three children. One child is still in school. Mercedita works very hard to provide for them.

Mercedita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, breads, noodles, etc.

Mercedita has been in this business for five years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, breads, and noodles

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is 22 years old and married with two children. She is in the agricultural business, raising ducks in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her ducks.

Rubina has been in this business for three years now and has borrowed from NWTF two times in the past to sustain it. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her ducks

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a 48-year-old married woman with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Elisa has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Susanita

texts.en:
Susanita is 52 years old and married with four children, who are all still in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Susanita has been in this business for three years now and has borrowed from NWTF three times in the past to sustain it. She would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 48 years old and married with three children. One child is still in school. Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc.

Vilma has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc

loans.name: Zumrad

texts.en: Zumrad is a gentle woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1960. She is living in a remote district with her family. She is married and has four children. She is a teacher for the initial class. She has many years of practice at private as well at governmental schools. She is an honest, responsible and generous teacher. She works hard and raises her children well. She wants her children to become well educated and be a specialist in their major. One of her children is going to enter the university and she needs to pay his tuition fee. She appealed to IMON asking for financial support to pay the higher education costs of her son. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to pay higher education costs for her son

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is married and works hard to support her family. She has a handicraft business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials like wire, shells, etc. for her business.

Lydia has been in this business for 21 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials like wire, shells, etc. for her business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a frozen food retail business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional frozen foods to offer for sale.

Veronica successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is relisting Veronica's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional frozen foods to offer for sale.

loans.name: Didier Antonio

texts.es:
Didier, de 20 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a culminar sus estudios para salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

El desea desempeñarse como vendedor de mercancía variada tales como ropa, accesorios como billeteras y algunos cosméticos, entre otros, en el municipio de Lorica.

Esta actividad desea iniciarla con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y para sus estudios, además de poder contribuir con los gastos en su hogar.
Es un joven emprendedor y muy disciplinado.

El solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de ropa al por mayor y de este modo aprovechar la oportunidad que le presenta la Corporación Interactuar de ser independiente.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresario y tener unos ingresos más estables y agradece a todas las personas que puedan contribuir con su sueño.
texts.en:
Didier, just 20 years old, clearly understands what he wants in life and is determined to complete his studies in order to get ahead and to have a good life.

He wishes to become a vendor of a variety of merchandise, such as clothing, accessories like billfolds, and some cosmetics, among other items, in the municipality of Lorica.

Didier has decided to initiate this activity via an effort to find the necessary resources to sustain himself and continue his studies, in addition to being able to help cover household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to purchase an ample selection of clothing at wholesale and, in this manner, to take advantage of the opportunity of becoming independent that Corporacion Interactuar is offering.

Didier's hope is to progress as an entrepreneur and have a very stable income. He is grateful to all those who can contribute to his dream.

loans.use: to buy an ample selection of clothing at wholesale and, in this manner, seize the opportunity to become independent.

loans.name: Ugloy

texts.ru: Углой женщина, которая не боится труда,  и всегда думает продвигать работу вперед, быть успешным человеком.  В районе Кубадиен отличная погода для сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Углой занимается растениеводством почти 5 лет. Она из тех женщин, которая сильная и трудолюбивая. Углой рожденная дехканка для такой деятельности. Углой 49 лет. Она замужем и имеет детей. Ей на работе помогают дети и невестка. Углой выращивает кукурузу. Она должна обработать урожай минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить качественный урожай. Минеральные удобрения поможет избавить микробы и насекомые от саженец, и поможет дать качественный урожай. Углой хочет, чтобы получила качественный и богатый урожай, и по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом для купли минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Ugloy is a woman who is not afraid of labor, and always thinks about advancing her work and becoming a successful person. There is excellent weather in the Qubadiyon region for agricultural activity. Ugloy has been growing crops for nearly five years. She is one of those women that is strong and hard-working. Ugloy is a born farmer. She is 49 years old. She is married and has children. Her children and her daughter-in-law help her work. Ugloy grows corn. She must treat her crop with mineral fertilizer in order to get a high quality harvest. Mineral fertilizer will help to rid the seedlings of microbes and insects, and will help to give a high quality harvest. Ugloy wants to receive a high quality and rich harvest, and so she has applied for a loan to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and treat her crops with it.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Divina works hard to support her family. She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines and also earns income from farming rice. Divina is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Divina has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 37 years old and married with two children. With her two children currently in school, Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines  and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, coffee, soft-drinks, beers, etc. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional quantities of the above products to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, coffee, soft-drinks, beers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en:
Pelagia is 56 years old and is married with nine children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store. She has been running the general store for 17 years and also earns income from food vending.

Pelagia has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Pelagia aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Aimed with her dream of living in a decent subdivision and operate several branches of her canteen, Letecia is working really hard to improve her business. She knows that the income derived from her canteen varies from time to time. It is affected by the school schedule and presence of students to whom she usually caters. That is why she is targeting to have an alternative business like peanut butter production and direct selling.  She also plans to renovate her canteen in order to make it more desirable to customers. These are the reasons why Letecia needed some help from you in the amount of PhP 60,000. She is positive that she can pay it back because she just holds minor responsibilities now, being separated from her husband, Jimmy, who is running an upholstery business.

Letecia is living in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental, one of the areas affected by Typhoon Haiyan that devastated the Philippines in November 2013. She’s one of those hardworking people who were able to “build back better” her business. She draws inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories of their life and business and to draw strength the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: start a peanut butter production business

loans.name: Lucien

texts.en:
A survivor is always a survivor!

This is Lucien, a 49-year-old “sari-sari” (variety) store owner who is married to Rolando, a 51-year-old driver. They reside in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental together with their children. They had survived the wrath of Typhoon Haiyan in November 2013. Lucien’s variety store business was affected by the typhoon but with the help of her family, they were able to rebuild it.

Lucien’s income from her store varies from time to time as it is usually affected by the competition within the area. Consumers are inclined to buy from a store that has wide variety of items and merchandise. Lucien hopes to expand her business by adding to selection of supplies in order to meet the demands of consumers. With that method, she would be able to boost her income that she can use in their house renovation. She humbly seeks your help through PHP 30,000 loan. She sincerely prays, through your support, that her family will eventually enjoy a comfortable life which she knows God wants them to have. 

Lucien meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Gigina

texts.en:
“I want to help others. I dream of giving employment to my friends, neighbors, and relatives.” This is Gigina’s aspiration. She’s not only concerned about herself but wishes to succeed together with others. She’s a “sari-sari” (variety) store owner and her husband Wilfredo drives their taxi cab for income. They have one child who is already in college. 

Gigina wants to buy a franchise for their new taxi unit and to employ a relative as driver. She’s also planning to buy new merchandise for her store. Eventually her goal is to expand her store into a big grocery and hire an unemployed youth as cashier or merchandiser. Furthermore, she desires to buy more taxi units so other drivers in their community can earn a living.

That is why Gigina is seeking for a loan assistance through you. She needs a PHP 50,000 loan that will surely go a long, long way. She has been a dutiful member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy a taxi

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 48 years old and married with four children. One of them is currently in school.

Mercedita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for five years now and has borrowed from NWTF six times in the past to sustain her business. She would like to build and expand it to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 22 years old and is married with two children. With one child currently in school, Rosalina works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. Rosalina has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items, such as candies, bread, biscuits, coffee, toothpaste, detergent soap, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Rosalina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is 53 years old and is married with five children. With one child in school, Ma. Elena works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell. Ma. Elena has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as soap, canned goods, soft-drinks, and other groceries. 

In the future, Ma. Elena would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosalinda is 61 years old and has four children who are still in school.

Rosalinda has a buy-and-sell eggs business in the Philippines. Rosalinda requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more trays of eggs to sell to her customers.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy eggs

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 35 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Leah works very hard to provide for them.

Leah runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, home products  and other groceries.

Leah has been in this business for 1 year now.   In the future, Leah would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 48 years old and married with six children.  

Lorna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Lorna has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from buying and selling fire wood.

Lorna aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosemarie is 45 years old and three of her children are currently in school.

Rosemarie has a buy-and-sell jewelry business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more jewelry to sell to her customers.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy jewelry

loans.name: Maria Lita

texts.en:
Maria Lita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maria Lita is 44 years old and has one child in school.

Maria Lita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Maria Lita has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is 48 years old, married and has three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lerma has a used clothing business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of used clothing to resell.

Lerma has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: buy used clothing

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.en:
Maria Lucia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maria Lucia is 47 years old and has one child in school.

Maria Lucia has a buy and sell of personal care products business in the Philippines. Maria Lucia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like lotion, etc.

Maria Lucia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Maria Lucia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like lotion

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lucia is 45 years old and one of her children is in school.

Lucia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Lucia has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Lucia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Farogat

texts.ru: Фарогат рада, что есть люди, которые поддерживает ее. Она погасила предыдущий кредит. Фарогат веселая и шустрая женщина. Она дома предоставляет услуги портнихи. Сейчас Фарогат решила расширить деятельность. Она хочет арендовать точку для ателье, и взять себе ученицу. Для такого плана ей нужно определенная сумма денег, для аренды. И хочет купить швейную (вышивочную) машинку, чтобы приобрести больше клиентов. Фарогат будет очень рада на Вашу поддержку. Поддержите ее достичь своих целей.
texts.en: Fagorat is glad that there are people who support her. She repaid her previous loan. Fagorat is a happy and nimble woman. She offers her services as a seamstress at home. Now Farogat has decided to expand her business. She wants to rent a place for a studio and to take on an apprentice. She needs a certain sum of money for this plan, for rent. And she wants to buy a sewing (embroidery) machine to acquire more clients. Fagorat will be very grateful for your support. Please support her in achieving her goals.

loans.use: to rent a place for a studio and to buy a sewing (embroidery) machine.

loans.name: Sabougnouma  2 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA 2  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  34 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TIGUIYA, commune de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: le riz, l’arachide et le mais avec ROKIA la 2ème personne de la droite à la gauche sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 3,5 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 210 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group SABOUGNOUMA 2 are married women who average 34 years of age and 2 children each. They all live in polygamous families in TIGUIYA, a commune of KOLONDIEBA, a prefecture in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They partnered with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season, and this is their 10th loan cycle with the MFI. All past loans were correctly repaid.
ROKIA grows rice, groundnuts and maize; she is the member standing second from the right in the group photo. She will use her loan to buy inputs and seeds, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 3.5 hectares of farmland. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold in Kolondieba to a clientele consisting of both men and women.  

Rokia expects to earn a profit of 210,000 FCFA, which she will use to repay her loan and to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing for the farming season.

loans.name: Hakimjon

texts.en:
Hakimjon is a clever guy. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1995 and is living in the district with his family. He is single and lives with his parents. He is a university student and is well known among students and friends.

Hakimjon is a responsible, bright, talented and punctual person. He is one of the active participants at classes. During his education, his goal is to learn the necessary subjects to be a specialist of his major.

He appealed to IMON and Kiva, asking for financial support to pay his tuition fee. He awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a 45-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nilda has a rice vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 9 years. 

Nilda requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Nilda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Yulduz

texts.en: Yulduz is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1990. She is living in a small town with beautiful seasonal scenery and cheerful residents. She is married and has two children. In her area, most people have two activities at the same time because the standard of living requires them to do so. She wanted to help her husband and does an activity of selling and buying dried fruit to contribute to the family budget. She participated in a three-day training provided by IMON to startup clients. She was satisfied with the knowledge gained and willing to start her new business. She appealed to IMON and Kiva to get a loan to start her new business. She is planning to buy dried fruit to sell. She awaits the Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy dried fruit to sell

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Her name is Ester, 51, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Sancho, an electrician, one of her children is already in college. The couple work hard to provide for their family’s daily personal and household needs. 

Esther operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.  

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan, which she will use to buy grocery items like rice, instant noodles, coffee, cookies, beverages, and several packs of frozen foods such as hot dogs, cured beef, and pork meat to sell at her small store. She is positive that she will have a good return on her investment, and that her earnings will be a great help to cover their daily sustenance and send her child to college. She is also thanking God for your good heart and the financial help.

Ester hopes to grow her business so her child can complete her college education. She prays for God to bless her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To add some grocery items and buy several packs of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice and feed retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of feed and rice to offer for sale.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Maura's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of feed and rice to offer for sale.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 33 years old now.

Mary Ann has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Mary Ann has been in this business for two years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 39 years old and has two children. Merlina is married and two of her children are in school.

Merlina is in the agricultural business farming root crops in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Merlina has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Merlina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Juan De Jesús

texts.es:
Juan, de 54 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene cuatro hijos.

Juan, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura desde que era un niño; todo lo que sabe lo aprendió gracias a su padre, quien cultivaba maíz, frijol y maicillo; y este año pasado se atrevió a cultivar plátano; ese cultivo le está generando buena producción, debido a que el terreno es bastante fértil.- Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, viaja a la ciudad que está a 5.3 kilómetros de su casa, el recorrido lo realiza en transporte publico y la cosecha la comercializa con los habitantes de la zona y en el mercado municipal. 

El préstamo que está solicitando es para ampliar su cultivo de plátanos y aplicarle la fertilización adecuada, para aprovechar una parte del terreno que tiene disponible y que es fértil para el cultivo de plátano. 

Sus sueños son construir su casa de bloque, con cuatro habitaciones separadas, ya que la casa que tiene está dividida por carpetas plásticas y cartón y es de adobe con madera. Además, quiere enviar a su hija al bachillerato para que asista a la universidad.
texts.en:
Juan is 54 years old and has a life partner and four children.

Juan has made a living working in agriculture since he was a boy. All that he knows he learned thanks to his father who cultivated corns, beans, and sorghum. This past year he attempted to plant bananas. This crop is generating a good production due to the fact that the land is very fertile. He travels to the city that is 5.3 kilometers from his house to buy his agriculture inputs. He makes the trip via public transportation. He sells his harvest to the residents of the area and in the municipal market.

His is requesting the loan to increase his banana crop and apply adequate fertilizer to it in order to take advantage of some land that is available and fertile for growing bananas.

His dream is to build his own house out of cinder block with four separate rooms. The house he has now is made of adobe and wood and is divided up by plastic tarps and cardboard. He also wants to send his daughter to high school so that she can attend university.

loans.use: to increase his banana crop and apply adequate fertilizer to it.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a portable solar kit for her business, and she wants to increase her income and standard of living.

loans.name: Sabougnouma  3 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA 3  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  31 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TIGUIYA, commune de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: le riz, l’arachide et le mais avec SALI la 2ème personne de la gauche à la droite sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 3,5 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 210 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group SABOUGNOUMA 3 are married women who average 31 years of age and 4 children each. They all live in polygamous families in TIGUIYA, a commune of KOLONDIEBA, a prefecture of the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They partnered with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season, and this is their 6th loan cycle with the MFI. Past loans were correctly repaid.
SALI grows rice, groundnuts and maize; she is the member standing second from the left in the group photo. She will use her loan to buy inputs and seeds, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 3.5 hectares of farmland. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold in Kolondieba to a clientele consisting of both men and women. Sali expects to earn a profit of 210,000 FCFA, which she will use to repay her loan and to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing for the farming season.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 39-year-old married woman with two children.

Marilyn works hard to provide for her family and has run a General store for 3 years. She needs a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase groceries to sell.  She earns additional income selling personal products.

Marilyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase  groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of vehicles business in the Philippines.

Vilma requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy another vehicle to sell to her customer.

Vilma has been in this business for eight years now.

Vilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy another vehicle to sell to her customer

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.en:
Raymunda is a 63-year old married woman with four children, sheworks very hard to provide for them.

Raymunda has run a general store for 5 years and requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy eggs, canned goods, other groceries.home care products.

In the future, Raymunda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy eggs, canned goods, home care products,  and other groceries.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with two children, both attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a door-to-door clothes selling business for 2 years. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. 

She will use 50,000 KES to purchase bulk quantities of  clothes to re-sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Meggie

texts.en:
Meggie is a married woman  with three children, all attend school. They live at their own house that has electricity but not running water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for ten years, and sells from home to restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

She will use the loan to purchase bundles of fish to re-sell. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish.

loans.name: Olga Patricia

texts.es:
Olga a sus 34 años de edad, debido a la falta de oportunidades de empleo y por necesidad económica se motiva a independizarse y conseguir ingresos por su cuenta, por eso desea iniciar un negocio de restaurante que estará ubicado en su casa.

Ella desea ofrecer en su negocio almuerzos, arepas de queso, patacones de plátano, chorizos con arepa, butifarras, arepas de chócolo, gaseosas entre otros, con esto espera conseguir los recursos necesarios para satisfacer sus necesidades básicas. 

Olga es una mujer trabajadora, pujante, emprendedora, solicita el crédito como apoyo para invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (sillas, carpa) e insumos para elaborar los alimentos (carnes frías, aceite, arepas, plátanos, gaseosas) para tener disponibilidad y variedad de productos que satisfagan los gustos de todos sus clientes, de esta forma podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.

Gracias al apoyo de la Corporación Interactuar y a los prestamistas de Kiva podrá montar este negocio y conseguirá ser independiente.
texts.en:
Olga, 34, is motivated to become independent and earn her own income because of financial need and the lack of job opportunities.  She wants to sell lunch in her home: cheese arepas [corn cakes], fried plantains, chorizo arepas, Catalan sausage, corn arepas, sodas, and other dishes.  She hopes to earn the resources required to satisfy her basic needs.

Olga's a hardworking, energetic, and enterprising woman.  She's requesting the loan to help her invest in fixed assets (chairs, a tent) and ingredients to make the dishes (cold cuts, oil, arepas, plantains, soda) to have a variety of products available to satisfy the tastes of all her customers.  That way she'll be able to have a better quality of life and well-being.

Thanks to the support of Interactuar Corporation and to Kiva lenders she'll be able to set up this business and achieve independence.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets (chairs, a tent) and ingredients to make her dishes (cold cuts, oil, arepas, plantains, soda)

loans.name: Kobiljon

texts.ru: Это Кобилчон. Он занимается выпечкой лепешки, где у него есть пекарня. У Кобилчон золотые руки. Он вкусно печет лепешки. У него есть много клиентов, и он печет на заказ, на свадьбы и на мероприятия. Кобилчон женатый человек. У него  одна 8 летняя дочка. Жена швея. Она дома предоставляет услуги портнихи. Кобилчон счастливый человек, он любить свою семью, и старается для семьи. Он хочет отремонтировать свой дом. Но для ремонта у него нет определенная сумма денег. Кобилчон по этой причине обратился к Вам за кредитом. Он надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: This is Kobiljon. He bakes flatbreads in his bakery. Kobiljon has golden hands. He bakes tasty flatbreads. He has a lot of clients, and he bakes to order, for weddings and events. Kobiljon is a married man. He has an eight-year-old daughter. His wife is a seamstress. She offers tailoring services at home. Kobiljon is a happy man, he loves his family and tries hard for them. He wants to renovate his house but he lacks the necessary sum of money for renovations. For this reason Kobiljon has turned to you for a loan. He hopes for your support.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with four children, all attend school. Rose owns a house that  has electricity  but not running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Rose operates a home-based charcoal selling business. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators.
 
She wants to purchase sacks of charcoal to re-sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to re-sell.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is married and has three children, all attend school. She rents a house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated  a poultry business to earn an income. She sells to restaurant operators and neighbors. Her major challenges are the high cost of transportation  and seasonal changes.

She wants to purchase more chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Omar Dario

texts.es:
Omar de 27 años de edad, instalo en su casa un corral para criar cerdos buscando tener una micro-empresa para generar recursos y aportar en su casa los recursos que tanto escasean. 

Es soltero y aprendió de esta profesión porque nació en una familia campesina donde adquirió empíricamente estas actividades. 

Buscando ser más competitivo en el sector y dar buenos precios Omar quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de dos cerdos y cuido para alimentarlos haciendo de sus cerdos animales de gran calidad para los posibles compradores. 

Omar es trabajador y sueña con tener su propia casa y no se detendrá hasta conseguirla pues quiere vivir en ella junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Omar is 27 years old. He installed a pen at his house to raise pigs in looking to start a small business to generate an income. He wanted to support his home with the resources they were so badly lacking.

He is single and learned this profession because he was born to a rural family where he acquired these skills empirically.

In order to be more competitive in the field and offer good prices, Omar wants to request a loan to buy two pigs and feed for them. He will raise good quality pigs for potential buyers.

Omar is a hard worker and dreams of having his own home. He won't stop until he achieves it because he wants to live in it with his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with one pre-school child.. She lives at her own house that has electricity and running water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past  year to sell wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of collecting payment from credit customers. 

She wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with three children, all attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and running water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the  three years to sell wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators.

She wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase  sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman with five children, all attend school. She lives at her own house that  does not have electricity and running water.

She has operated a retail shop business for one year to sell wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators.

She wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Eveline

texts.en:
Eveline is a married woman with five children, all attend school. She owns a house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Eveline operates a grocery stall to sell at the market. She faces a challenge of high cost of competition. 

She wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions to re-sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Mwahija

texts.en:
Mwahija is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses are medication and school fees.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of needing to repay creditors for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул, 54 года, замужем, есть 3 сына. У нее среднее образование, занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, Айнагул на сегодняшний день имеет 2 коровы, 10 овец. Также на земельном наделе мерою 1,56 Га, она выращивает ячмень для реализации. Ежемесячный доход Айнагул около 19,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айнагул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Айнагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Ainagul is 54 years old, married, and has three sons. She has a secondary education, and she rears animals and grows crops. Thanks to her hard work, today Ainagul has two cows and ten sheep. She also grows barley for sale on a 1.56 hectare plot of land. Ainagul's monthly income is about 19,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Ainagul has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy two steers for fattening and resale. Ainagul plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further development of her business so that she will be able to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy two steers for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Ykybal

texts.ru: Ыкыбал, 40 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее высшее образование, на протяжении 5 лет занимается животноводством. На сегодняшний день, благодаря упорству и целеустремленности Ыкыбал в ее хозяйстве имеется 4 коровы. Ыкыбал хочет приумножить поголовье скота, в связи с этим она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. На доходы от кредита Ыкыбал хочет увеличить поголовье скота и в скором будущем построить большой еще сараи для скота.
texts.en: Ykybal is 40 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She has a higher education, and she has been rearing animals for five years. Today, thanks to her perseverance and ambition, Ykybal has four cows. Ykybal wants to increase the size of her herd, and so with regard to this she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 45,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow. Ykybal wants to increase the size of her herd using the proceeds from the loan and to build another large barn for her livestock in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a cow in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Anarkul

texts.ru: Анаркуль успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто откликнулся и помог в финансировании. На сегодняшний день Анаркуль имеет 2 коровы с 2 телятами. На ежедневной основе продает экологически чистое молоко. Ежемесячный доход - около 10,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анаркуль обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сомов (KGS) на покупку дополнительно 2 коров. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность в будущем построить дом.
texts.en: Anarkul successfully repaid her loan, having used it for its intended purpose. She is grateful to Kiva Fund and to everyone who responded and helped to finance her. Today Anarkul has two cows with two calves. She sells organic milk on a daily basis. Her monthly income is about 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Anarkul has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy an additional two cows. She plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further development of her business in order to be able to build a house in future.

loans.use: to buy two cows to increase her herd.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as pesticides, compost, and corn, among other items.

loans.name: Venera

texts.ru: Венера, 47 лет, замужем, 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, Венера на сегодняшний день имеет: 2 коровы и 4 овцы. На 1,75 Га земли выращивает хлопок. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Венера обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом для покупки 10 овец, удобрений для обработки почвы и выращивания органического хлопка, а также на найм сезонных рабочих для сбора урожая. Венера намерена и дальше увеличивать и развивать свой бизнес.
texts.en: Venera is 47 years old, married, and has two children. She has a secondary education, and she rears animals and grows crops to get income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, today Venera has two cows and four sheep. She grows cotton on 1.75 hectares of land. Her monthly income is about 12,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Venera has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan to buy ten sheep, fertilizer to treat her land and grow organic cotton, and also to hire seasonal workers to harvest the crop. Venera intends to keep increasing and developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and hire seasonal workers to harvest organic cotton, as well as to buy ten sheep.

loans.name: Mauricio Ernesto

texts.es:
Mauricio de 35 años de edad, procreó 2 hijos pero su esposa se los llevó a USA por lo tanto él se encuentra solo.

Mauricio trabaja de mecánico, esta actividad la aprendió de su padre, hoy en día es su principal fuente de ingresos y es muy reconocido por la calidad con la que realiza el trabajo.

Él necesita este crédito para comprar un compresor para pintar carros, será de mucha ayuda pues es una de sus principales herramientas de trabajo.

Su sueño es ver algún día a sus hijos y que su taller mecánico se mantenga activo.
texts.en:
Mauricio, 35 years old, has two children but his wife took them to the USA; therefore, he is alone.

Mauricio works as a mechanic.  He learned his job from his father.  Today, this is his principal source of income, and he is well known for the quality with which he does his job.

He needs this loan to buy a compressor to paint cars.  It would help a lot since it is one of his main work tools.

His dream is to see his children someday and that his mechanic workshop stays active.

loans.use: To buy a compressor to paint cars.

loans.name: Margarita Del Carmen

texts.es:
Margarita, de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, es madre soltera, se separó de su esposo por problemas personales; ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos, a la agricultura y a cuidar unas gallinas que tiene en su casa y los huevos los vende.- Desde muy pequeña, su papá le enseño la agricultura, ya que en la familia tenían que trabajar para ganarse el pan de cada día, pero eso le sirvió mucho ya que hoy en día, ella se dedica a la agricultura y le enseña a sus hijos.

Margarita, también hace tamales de elote y sale por las tardes a venderlos, tiene casi quince años de dedicarse a vender tamales. 

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar abono, fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas, pesticidas y pagar el alquiler del terreno donde cultivara este año, ella esperan que hoy si sea mejor el invierno anterior.

Margarita, desea seguir cultivando la tierra y seguir ayudándole a sus hijos para que estudien y que se preparen academicamente, ya que es la única herencia que ella les dejara.
texts.en:
Margarita, 45, studied up to ninth grade.  She's a single mother.  She separated from her husband for personal reasons.  She's a homemaker and she farms and raises chickens at home and sells their eggs.  She learned agriculture from her father at a very young age, because in her family they had to work to earn a daily living.  This helped her a lot, though, because now she works in agriculture and teaches it to her children.

Margarita also makes corn tamales and goes out to sell them in the afternoon.  She has sold tamales for almost 15 years.
