The loan she's requesting is to buy soil amendments, fertilizer, seeds, herbicide, and pesticide, and to pay the rent on the land she's going to farm this year.  She hopes it will be better now than last winter.

Margarita wants to keep farming and helping her children to study and prepare themselves academically, because it's the only legacy she will give them.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, fertilizer, seeds, herbicide, and pesticide, and to pay the rent on the land she's going to farm this year

loans.name: Tiesiri Group

texts.fr:
Séba  est la femme qui  tient la daba en main au bout sur la photo.
 Séba  est une femme malienne mariée à un cultivateur de sa localité. Elle est mère de six (06) enfants âgés de  5 à 25 ans parmi lesquels aucun n’est scolarisé. 
Non alphabétisé ; elle fait la culture d’arachide pendant l’hivernage pour gagner sa vie et pour pouvoir supporter les charges de ses enfants. 
Séba  fait recourt au prêt du RMCR parce qu’elle n’a ni les moyens, ni les équipements de pouvoir agrandir sa surface  cultivée et mieux entretenir son champ.
Avec le prêt du RMCR, elle achètera plus de semences d’arachide, de l’engrain et payera de la main d’œuvre aux charriés pour labourer son champ.
Son travail étant saisonnier, elle prévoit une marge  de 125000 FCFA pour la saison.
a
texts.en:
Sèba is the lady holding a daba in the group photo. She is a Malian woman married to a local farmer. She has six children aged 5 to 25, none of whom have received formal schooling. Herself illiterate, Sèba earns a living growing groundnuts during the rainy season to help support her children. 

Sèba is seeking a loan from RMCR because she does not have the means or the materials needed to expand and better maintain her farmland.  

Sèba will use her loan to buy groundnut seeds and fertilizers, and to pay for the labor needed to plow her field.  

This being a seasonal activity, Sèba expects to earn a profit of 125,000 FCFA for the season.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her farming activity.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: La barbería es lo que más le gusto a Oscar desde muy joven, por lo que cuenta con 10 años de experiencia, que le permiten contar con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus servicios, pero además cuando le solicitan presta sus servicios de albañil, lo que le permite obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Oscar tiene 56 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa y su hijo de 15 años de edad al que ya enseña el oficio con el que se gana la vida. Oscar desea instalar su propia barbería en su vivienda, la cual le permitirá obtener mejores ingresos económicos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: máquina para cortar cabello, tijeras, talco, sillas, etc.
texts.en:
Being a Barber is what Oscar liked to do most since he was very young.  Due to this, he has 10 years of experience which allowing you to have a lot of customers seeking his services. Aside from this when asked  he serves as mason, allowing him to obtain better income. 

Oscar is 56 years old and lives with his wife and 15 year old son to whom he already teaches the craft with which he earns a living. Oscar wishes to install his own barbershop in his home, which will allow for better income. For this reason, he is applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in: hair clippers, scissors, talc, chairs, etc.

loans.use: to invest in: hair clippers, scissors, talc, chairs, etc

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.es: El señor Raymundo, de 70 años, casado, amable, humilde y trabajador.  Desde hace 14 años es fiel cliente de la institución, y ahora solicita crédito a los inversionistas de Kiva, para aumentar la producción. Él se dedica a la preparación y venta de nacatamales y los comercializa en uno de los mercados más grande de la capital. Con el crédito solicitado invertirá en la compra de 5 cerdos, maíz y papas.  Pudiendo así obtener más ganancias y seguir cumpliendo con los pagos del crédito.
texts.en: Raymundo,70, is married, and he is kind, humble, and hardworking. He's been a loyal client of the institution for 14 years, and now he is requesting a loan from the Kiva lenders to increase his production. He has a business making and selling nacatamales, (a local dish of corn, meat and rice wrapped in banana leaves), which he sells in one of the largest markets in the capital. With the loan he is requesting, he will invest in 5 pigs,corn,and potatoes.  This way,he can increase his earnings and continue to make the payments on his loan.

loans.use: to buy 5 pigs, corn,and potatoes

loans.name: Maria Fidelina

texts.es:
María, de 78 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, ya que en la época de antes tenían que trabajar desde muy pequeños y sus padres no tenían la capacidad económica para poder ponerles a estudiar; María, se separó de su esposo cuando su ultimo hijo tenía un año de edad, en total tiene 9 hijos, de los cuales uno de ellos ya falleció y los demás tienen sus propios hogares, ella solo vive con un nieto.

María, se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 25 años de edad, actualmente trabaja solo con su nieto, porque es poco lo que cultivan, solo siembran media hectárea de terreno, su horario de trabajo es desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta  las 10:00 a.m. ya que por la edad de ella, no puede trabajar hasta muy tarde.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar un saco de abono y para pagarle a una persona para que le ayude a su nieto para preparar el terreno donde cultivan. 

Sus sueños son, que Dios le de vida para seguir trabajando y que a su nieto no le falte nada y su vejez sea muy alentadora.
texts.en:
María, 78 years old, did not have the opportunity to study; since in the earlier times, they had to work from a very young age and her parents did not have the economic capacity to be able to send them to study.  María separated from her husband when her youngest child was one year old.  In total, she has nine children.  Of them, one has already passed away and the others have their own homes.  She only lives with one grandson.

María has been working in agriculture since she has 25 years old.  Currently, she works alone with her grandson because they cultivate little.  They only plant half an hectare of land.  Her work schedule is from 6:00am until 10:00am.  Because of her age, she cannot work very late. 

The loan that she is requesting is to buy a sack of fertilizer and to pay someone to help her grandson to prepare the ground where they cultivate.

Her dreams are that God give her life to continue working and that her grandson lacks nothing and that his old age be very inspirational.

loans.use: To buy a sack of fertilizer and to pay someone to help her grandson to prepare the ground where the cultivate.

loans.name: El Sol De Cupiche Group

texts.es: “EL SOL DE CUPICHE” es un grupo conformado por socios responsables dedicados a prestar servicios de lavado de carro y al comercio minorista. Aydee tiene 31 años de edad es conviviente con 01 hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta sobre pedido para niños y adultos. Y a la se dedica al lavado de carro con el apoyo de su esposo. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más ropa para niños de estación de invierno. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Aydee es la tercera del lado derecho tiene a su bebe en brazos.
texts.en:
"EL SOL DE CUPICHE" is a group formed by responsible members who work providing car wash services and in retail businesses. 

Aydee is 31 years old lives in common law and has 1 dependent child. She sells on request for children and adults. She also offers car wash services with the support of her husband. The loan will be invested in buying more children's clothes for the winter season. 

The group thanks the KIVA investors for the offered loan. Aydee is the third on the right and has her baby in arms.

loans.use: to purchase more winter clothing.

loans.name: Elsa Imelda Del Socorro

texts.es:
Muy trabajadora y siempre alegre, Elsa tiene 54 años y tiene un negocio desde hace más de 10 años vendiendo lencería para mujer en su ciudad natal, Xalapa, conocida también como La ciudad de las flores, en Veracruz, estado ubicado en el Golfo de México. Elsa vive con su hijo que actualmente está estudiando en una universidad de su región. Elsa inició este negocio porque le gusta ser comerciante y por la necesidad de tener mayores fuentes de ingresos.
Un préstamo de MXN 12,000 le ayudará a comprar mercancía en grandes cantidades para hacer inventario y expandir su catálogo, lo que le ayudará a incrementar sus ventas notablemente. Al apoyarla en este préstamo ayudarás a Elsa a tener las ganancias suficientes para seguir pagando los estudios universitarios de su hijo. Es una mujer muy comprometida, segura y responsable, por lo que estará a tiempo en sus fechas de pago en su segundo préstamo con Konfío para solicitar otro en un futuro.
texts.en:
A hard worker and always happy, Elsa is 54 years old and has had a business for 10 years selling women's lingerie in her home city, Xalapa, also known as the city of flowers, in the state of Veracruz, located in the Gulf of Meixco. Elsa lives with her son who is currently studying at a university in their region. Elsa began this business because she wants to be a seller and in order to have a larger income.

A loan of MXN 12,000 will help her buy merchandise in large quantities to have inventory and expand her collection, which will notably help her increase her sales. The support of this loan will help Else have sufficient earnings to continue paying for the university studies of her son. She is a committed, sure, and responsible women, and because of this will be on time with her repayments of her second loan with Konfio in order to get another one in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like corsets in large quantities

loans.name: Elisaina Lorena

texts.es:
Elisania, de 25 años, inicio con un negocio de parqueadero hace aproximadamente 2 años con el afán de buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos para poder sobrevivir.

En el momento, encuentra su motivación para trabajar incansablemente en su esposo.

Solicita un préstamo para la realización de mejoras locativas a su negocio.

Con este préstamo podrá mejorar este espacio que es tan vital en su negocio

Apoya a Elisania para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Elisania is 25 years old and started her business about two years ago. She runs a paid parking lot, and started it in order to find work to generate an income and make a living. Right now her main source of encouragement is her husband, and she works tirelessly.

She is requesting a loan to make improvements on her parking lot. This loan will allow her to improve this space, which is essential for her business.

Support Elisania so that she can keep working!

loans.use: to improve her business site.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita has always dreamed of owning a stall for her fruit and vegetable retail business to support her seven children. She used her loan to purchase fruits and vegetables for retail and to be sold. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables for her retail outlet

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 46 years old and married with five children. With two children currently in school, Esmeralda works very hard to provide for them.

Esmeralda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Esmeralda has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, shampoo, fabric conditioners, detergent soap, cooking oil, etc. 

In the future, Esmeralda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neeither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is food.
For over five years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and other items. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and other items for her open air store

loans.name: Mirna Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mirna nació en 1974 en San Luis Potosí, en donde su comida típica tiene una gran historia cultural, combinando lo mejor de México con España, como el maíz y la carne de puerco y pollo. Por esa razón, Mirna a sus 41 años es una chef, emprendedora, comerciante y muy optimista. Siempre encuentra el lado positivo de las cosas, aun cuando se le presentan grandes retos en su camino. 
Mirna es madre soltera, y con la intención de darle las mejores condiciones de vida a su hijo, además de su trabajo como chef, comenzó un negocio vendiendo productos de belleza por catálogo hace 5 años. Su negocio ha tenido tanto éxito que hoy ya tiene un establecimiento formal. Con un préstamo de MXN 10,000 será capaz de comprar productos de belleza en grandes cantidades como maquillaje, cremas, esmaltes de uñas y otros, así como cubrir los gastos operativos de su tienda. 
Mirna tiene un sueño: ver a su hijo desarrollarse profesionalmente. Con este préstamo, ella será capaz de ofrecerle todas las herramientas posibles a su hijo para que pueda finalizar sus estudios universitarios y pueda estar preparado para la vida. Mirna está muy agradecida con Kiva y los prestamistas que la apoyen para cumplir sus metas. Con los ingresos derivados de este préstamo podrá realizar pagos en tiempo y forma en su primer préstamo con Konfío.
texts.en:
Mirna was born in 1974 in San Luis Potosi, where the typical food has a rich cultural history, combining the best of Mexico with Spain, such as corn and pork and chicken. For that reason, Mirna, aged 41, is a chef, entrepreneur, merchant and optimistic. She is finding the positive side of things, even when presented with great challenges in her way.
Mirna is a single mother, and with the intention of giving the best conditions of life to her son, started a business selling beauty products by catalog five years ago, in addition to being a chef. Her business has been so successful that today she already have a formal establishment. With a loan of MXN 10,000, she will be able to buy beauty products in large quantities such as makeup, creams, nail polish and other things, as well as cover the operating costs of her store.
Mirna has a dream: to see her son develop professionally. With this loan, she will be able to provide all possible tools for her child to finish college and be prepared for life. Mirna is very grateful to Kiva lenders for the support to accomplish her goals. With the income from this loan, she can make payments in a timely manner ob her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy beauty products in large quantities such as makeup, creams, nail polish and other things, as well as cover the operating costs of her store.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity but nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over ten years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators.
With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat for her open air store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase on his stock of soft drinks and meet customers' demand. Also to pay school fees.

loans.name: Deysi

texts.en:
Deysi is a single woman, she doesn't have children but she helps her mother with the expenses  She lives with her mother but her mother is a retired person, so Deysi is the only one that supports the home.  Deysi works at a supermarket but her pay is not good so she needs a loan to buy milking products.

So she is planning to start her own business. She hopes you can help her.

Deysi is healthy and she has some experience selling groceries She would like to expand her business to La Paz city As you can see in the picture, her living conditions are humble

loans.use: to buy milking products

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rowena is 45 years old and has one child in school.

Rowena has a buy and sell processed food business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more processed food to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Rowena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more processed food to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a woman and 46 years old. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Teresita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 4000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Teresita has been in this business for 19 years. In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married mother of one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and  piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, Margaret has operated an open air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of business. 

With the KES 30,000 loan, Margaret wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Cynthia Ivanova

texts.es:
Cynthia tiene 36 años, está casada y es madre de dos niños de 10 y 5 años. Cynthia era maestra pero cuando se convirtió en madre dejó de trabajar. Para poder brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos, apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y gracias a su espíritu de emprendedora, inició un negocio vendiendo ensaladas, tortas y fruta a la salida de la escuela de sus hijos con ayuda de su propio coche. 
Con un préstamo de MXN 10,000 podrá convertir su negocio en un establecimiento más formal y comprar ingredientes para preparar los platillos que a todos tanto gustan. Con este préstamo de Kiva podrá incrementar sus ventas notablemente, con las que podrá tener más y mejores productos y en un futuro abrir su propio restaurante. 
Cynthia es una mujer perseverante, comprometida, una buena madre y muy responsable, por lo que estará a tiempo en sus fechas de pago en su primer préstamo con Konfío gracias al incremento en sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Cynthia is 36 years old, married and the mother of two children aged 10 and 5 years. Cynthia was a teacher but when she became a mother stopped working. To provide the best for her children, to help her husband with household expenses, and thanks to its spirit of entrepreneurship, she started a business selling salads, cakes and fruit at the exit of her children's school with help from using her own car.
With a loan of MXN 10,000, she can turn her business into a more formal establishment and buy ingredients to prepare all the dishes people like. With this Kiva loan she may significantly increase her sales, with which she will have more and better products in the future and open her own restaurant.
Cynthia is persistent, committed, a good mother, and a very responsible woman, so she will be timely on her payment dates on her first loan with Konfío thanks to the increase in revenue.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and convert her business into a more formal establishment

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over one year, Bintihamisi has operated an open air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and transportation in her place of business. 

With the KES 15,000 loan, Bintihamisi wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.fr: Matilda a 33 ans. Elle est célibataire et n’a pas encore d’enfants. Évoluant dans une famille de situation très précaire,  elle a eu l’idée, il y a six ans, de créer une petite activité pour générer des revenus capables d’aider la famille. Elle a mis sur pied une petite boutique de de boissons gazeuses en gros. Au début, cela n’a pas été facile. Mais à force de persévérer, elle est aujourd’hui une commerçante très prospère. Elle veut voir grandir son activité. Elle demande du crédit pour diversifier son stock.
texts.en: Matilda is 33 years old. She is single and does not yet have any children. Coming from a family in a very precarious situation, she had the idea six years ago to start a small business to earn some income to be able to help the family. She launched a small shop of carbonated drinks. In the beginning, it wasn’t easy. But after some perseverance, she is now a prosperous storekeeper. She wants to grow her business. She is asking for a loan to diversify her stock.

loans.use: to add a stock of energy drinks to her shop

loans.name: Georgina Del Socorro

texts.es:
Georgina tiene 32 años y vive en Campeche, un estado al sur de México que comparte frontera con Guatemala y Belice, y que es conocido por su gastronomía, herencia de la cultura Maya que está enriquecida debido a la variedad de productos del mar. El pescado y el camarón son uno de los principales ingredientes de muchos platillos de toda la región. 
Gracias a la diversidad gastronómica de la región, Georgina decidió poner un negocio vendiendo comida a sus conocidos y amigos desde su hogar para tener un ingreso extra. Además de su negocio, Georgina tiene un empleo como auxiliar administrativo en una institución gubernamental. Con un préstamo de MXN 10,000 Georgina podrá comprar ingredientes de la mejor calidad para preparar los platillos que tanto le gustan a todos sus amigos y familiares. Gracias a esto, podrá llegar a más personas para que en un futuro pueda poner su propio restaurante. 
Georgina está muy agradecida con Kiva y los prestamistas por confiar en ella y apoyarla en el cumplimiento de todas sus metas. Por esta razón, Georgina será muy puntual en las fechas de pago en su primer préstamo con Konfío para solicitar otro préstamo en unos meses.
texts.en:
Georgina is 32 and lives in Campeche, a state in southern Mexico which shares a border with Guatemala and Belize, and is known for its gastronomy, inherited from the Mayan culture that is full of a variety of seafood. The fish and shrimp are one of the main ingredients in many dishes across the region.
Thanks to the culinary diversity of the region, Georgina decided to start a business selling food to her acquaintances and friends from home to earn extra income. In addition to her business, Georgina has a job as an administrative assistant in a government institution. With a loan of MXN 10,000, Georgina can buy the best quality ingredients to prepare the dishes her friends and family are so fond of. Thanks to this, she can reach more people in the future and can open her own restaurant.
Georgina is very grateful to Kiva lenders who trust her and support her in meeting all of her goals. For this reason, Georgina is very punctual on payment dates on her first loan with Konfío in order to take out another loan in a few months.

loans.use: to buy the best quality ingredients to prepare the dishes her friends and family are so fond of

loans.name: Parvina

texts.en:
Parvina is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1986. She  lives in a small town and is married with two children. She and her husband are teachers at a secondary school. 

She is interested in opening a new business for sewing traditional dresses for women at home in her free time. She participated in a three day training provided by IMON to start up clients. She gained the necessary knowledge about how to open a new business. Recently, she appealed to IMON and Kiva asking financial support to buy a sewing machine for starting a new business. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for starting a new business making women's clothing

loans.name: Melsa

texts.en:
Melsa is encouraged that she was granted a 25000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various direct-selling personal products to sell to her customers. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. Aside from being a dealer of popular brands of personal goods she also sells ice candy and mineral water on the side.

She would now like to apply for a 40000 PHP loan which she will use to pay for the merchandise products to meet the advanced orders of her customers, for ingredients to make her ice candies and buy mineral water to sell. Her earnings help sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you for your good heart and the financial help that will be given her. 

Melsa hopes to buy a bigger refrigerator to store her ice candies. She wants to send all her children to college and see them become professionals someday. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for personal products like footwear, toiletries, underwear; to pay for powdered juice, sugar  and to buy mineral water to sell.

loans.name: Pricilla

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Pricilla works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her personal products retail business. Pricilla is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Pricilla has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jellebeth

texts.en:
Jellebeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jellebeth has been in this business for four years. Jellebeth earns more income from personal product retail.

Jellebeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Annalie

texts.en:
Annalie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 32 years old and has two children who are in school.

Annalie has an ornamental swan making business in the Philippines. Annalie requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business.

Annalie has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her ornamental swan making business

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is 40 years old and has three children. She is married and all of her children are in school.

Mirasol is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mirasol requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Mirasol has been in this business for seven years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mirasol would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Artyom

texts.en:
Artyom is taxi driver from Armavir town, where he lives with his wife, two kids, and brother. Artyom drives a taxi from Armavir town to Russia, taking migrant laborers to a neighbouring country for work.

With the loan, he will pay for renovation of the car, purchase new tires for it, and also cover car insurance costs to be able to continue taxi driving and gather income for his family's living.

Artyom has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Artyom hopes to receive lenders' support to invest in his taxi driving work and generate more income for his family.

The start-up program will give Artyom a chance to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the car, purchase new tires for it, and also cover car insurance costs to be able to continue taxi driving and gather income for his family's living.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
Maria tiene 54 años y está divorciada. Hasta hace unos meses estaba a cargo de muchos niños pequeños como maestra en un jardín de niños pero ahora está jubilada. Para continuar teniendo ingresos ella inició un negocio explotando al máximo sus habilidades y pasión por cocinar. Ella vende chorizo y chilorio, un platillo mexicano originario de Sinaloa. 
Maria es muy conocida en su ciudad porque sus productos son únicos y diferentes a los de la competencia. Todos sus clientes siempre sienten curiosidad por conocer la receta secreta de su abuela. Maria prepara todos los alimentos en su propia casa y por esa razón le gustaría un préstamo de MXN 10,000 para comprar ingredientes como carne y chiles, así como una trituradora de carne, envases y etiquetas para mejorar la presentación final de todos su productos. 
Maria tiene un sueño por cumplir: llevar su negocio hacia un establecimiento más formal y expandirse a otras regiones para ser económicamente estable y poder dejarles un patrimonio a sus hijos y nietos. Ella está muy agradecida con Kiva, Konfío y los prestamistas por confiar en ella en este proyecto. 
Al apoyar a Maria ella será capaz de agilizar su producción, mejorar la receta con ingredientes de la mejor calidad, así como causar una mejor impresión al momento de la entrega. Gracias a todo eso, sus ventas incrementarán notablemente, al igual que sus ganancias, mismas que le permitirán pagar a tiempo y ahorrar para seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old and is divorced. Until a few months ago, she was in charge of many young children as a teacher in a kindergarten but is now retired. For continued income, she started a business making the most of her skills and passion for cooking. She sells sausage and chilorio, a native Mexican dish from Sinaloa.
Maria is well known in the city because her products are unique and different from the competition. All customers are always curious to know the secret recipe of her grandmother. Maria prepares all the food at home and for that reason would like a loan of MXN 10,000 to buy ingredients such as meat and chiles, and a meat grinder, packaging and labels to enhance the final presentation of her products.
Maria has a dream to fulfill: take her business to a more formal establishment and spread to other regions to be financially stable and to leave an estate to her children and grandchildren. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders and Konfío who trusts her on this project.
By supporting Maria, she will be able to streamline production, improve the recipe with ingredients of the highest quality and cause a better impression at the time of delivery. Thanks to all that, her sales will increase considerably, as will profits, which will allow her to pay on time and save for further growth.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat and chiles, and a meat grinder, packaging and labels to enhance the final presentation of her products.

loans.name: Almutasim Billah

texts.en:
Almutasim Billah is a 30-year-old married man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his wife and one child. Almutasim works as an employee in the public sector, where he earns a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family’s needs. He decided to find an additional job, which is distributing goods using a rickshaw.

Almutasim took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw for work. This will increase his income and also improve his family's living conditions.

Almutasim appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for work.

loans.name: Rogelene

texts.en:
Rogelene is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a watch repair business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional materials needed for her watch repair shop.

Rogelene has been in this business for ten years. She earns additional income from raising pigs.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Rogelene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to  purchase additional materials needed for her watch repair shop

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 34 years old and married with three children. All three children are in school and Virginia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like detergent soap, eggs, biscuits, coffee, milk, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, eggs, biscuits, coffee, milk, shampoo, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like detergent soap, eggs, biscuits, coffee, milk, and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Ernanita

texts.en:
Ernanita is 48 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Ernanita works very hard to provide for them.

Ernanita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like water, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Ernanita has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Ernanita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like water, canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 38 years old, and four of her children are in school.

Helen has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Helen has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 56 years old and has ten children. Estrella is married and has two children who are in school.

Estrella is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Estrella requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Estrella has been raising pigs for 30 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Estrella would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Myra Luz

texts.en:
Myra Luz is 37 years old and married with three children, all in school.  Myra Luz works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, home care products and other supplies.

Myra Luz has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Myra Luz would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, home care products and other supplies

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna 41 years old teacher from Armavir town. She lives with her husband, mother-in-law and daughter. Anna's only son serves currently in the army.  Anna, after finishing her work at school, is involved in convenience food production in her house. She makes different type of cutlets and other products from meat and sells it in local stores. 

Today Anna needs a loan to purchase materials for making convenience food, a meat chopper and freezer needed for her business. Her loan has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
The Start Up program, will enable her to invest in her business and enlarge it.

loans.use: to pay for materials for making convenience food, a meat chopper and freezer needed for her business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with one child,  who does not attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operation.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for reselling in her store

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a single woman and has been blessed with two kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Mwanamisi operated a fish selling business, which has been operational for over ten years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Mwanamisi dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married mother of four children, all of whom  do not attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Jose Gregorio

texts.es:
Jose, radicado zona rural del municipio de Los Cordobas, siempre se ha desempeñado en el sector agropecuario al lado de su familia donde aprendió estos menesteres. 

Lleva unos meses con su propia cría de cerdos de engorde para la venta y distribución en varias zonas del su pueblo. 

Sueña con mejorar el número de cerdos para criar y solicitó a la Corporación Interactuar un crédito con el que adquirirá un cerdo.

Las ganancias obtenidas por el aumento de sus animales será mucho mayor lo que le permitirá tener un mejor nivel de vida sin tanta dificultad económica.

De este negocio depende su esposa
Su mayor sueño es poder tener una casa propia y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Jose, who lives in a rural area in the municipality of Los Cordobas, has always worked hard at farming, alongside his family, who taught him this work. 
For a few months he has been raising and fattening pigs for sale and distribution in various areas of his town. 

He would like to increase the number of pigs he has to raise, and he applied for a loan from the Corporacion Interactuar to buy a pig. 

The income he will earn with more animals will be much greater, which will allow him to have a better quality of life with less economic hardship. 
His wife depends on this business. 
His biggest dream is to have his own house and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a pig to raise

loans.name: Julito

texts.en:
Julito is a 56 years old, married and has six children to provide for. Julito, as a father, wants to give his family a good life and provide for his children's needs. Julito is engaged in rice production as his business to earn for living. He aims to increase his income and be able to provide for his children's educational needs. 

He needs to increase his rice production so that he can increase his income also. So he decided to borrowed a loan at GDMPC to purchase fertilizer for the rice farm to produce good harvest on the farm.

Julito plan for the future to save money out from his business for the educational needs of his children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for his rice farm.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
His name is Carlos, 59, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Jocelyn, who has an ornaments business. The couple work hard to provide for their daily sustenance. 

Carlos has operated a tricycle for seventeen years already. His tricycle carries up to four passengers. In the Philippines especially in the provinces like Silang, tricycles are a common means of transportation. Jeepneys and buses are limited within the small towns and very few people own a vehicle. The town people usually ride a tricycle from their homes to market, church, to their friend’s homes and to other destinations within their community. They even transport from one town to the other. He earns a minimum of Php 800 a day. 

To help him continue his transport business, he is requesting a Php 19000 loan which he will use to pay for the maintenance of his tricycle. It is important that his unit is always in a good running condition to ensure efficient service. He is thanking God and you in advance for your good heart and the financial help that will be given him for it will surely help cover their everyday needs and enable them to save for their old age. 

Carlos aims to buy another tricycle to improve his income. He prays that God will prosper his family abundantly. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and were he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of his tricycle.

loans.name: Higinio

texts.en:
Higinio is grateful that he was granted a PHP 25,000 PHP loan which he used to buy raw ingredients like meat, rice, vegetables, and condiments needed in his food stall business. Through his earnings he is able to support his family and meet their daily basic needs.

He would like now to apply for another PHP 25,000 loan which he will use to buy ingredients like fresh pork, beef, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and rice needed to cook dishes to serve at his food stall. His earnings helped sustain their everyday needs and fund his children's schooling. He is thanking God and you for your good heart and the financial help that will be given him.
 
Higinio aims to grow his business to give his family a better quality of life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Fe is 57 years old and has one child who is in school.

Fe has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. Fe requested a PHP 26,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her nipa-roofing.

Fe has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her nipa roofing business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 52 years old, married and she has no children, but then she work hard to help her husband to earn for a living.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like coffee, milk, noodles, etc. to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like coffee, milk, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is 57 years old and married with six children. Virgilia works very hard to provide for them.

Virgilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Virgilia has been in this business for 6 years. 

In the future, Virgilia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 37 years old and has nine children. She is married and has two children are still in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pig in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Glenda has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed onw times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is a married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 41 years old.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like pants, shirts, etc..

Marita has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like pants, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Gelyn

texts.en:
Gelyn is 28 years old and married, with three children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Gelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like junk food, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Gelyn has been in this business for one year and she sells a variety of items, such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Gelyn would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like junk food, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Tutyati

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents: Tutyati. Tutyati lives in South Bandung, located in West Java, about three hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her only son.

Tutyati owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. As a woman, she realized that it’s really important for her to help her husband increase their income so they can save more money for their children’s education. That’s why she decided to join Ruma. She feels happy as well because ever since she joined Ruma, she can give more contribution to her community. Her community sees Tutyati as a friendly, trusted, and informative mobile service provider.

As the business grows, Tutyati needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can have access to stay connected with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart.

Tutyati’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community, with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Tutyati is the one who is standing in her own stall. She is thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to connect with their loved ones.

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes teaches dancing in Gyumri town. He lives with his parents and grandmother.

Hovhannes has a group of students to whom he teaches various dance styles. To be prepared for the new coming performance in next month, Hovhannes needs to purchase costumes.  

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Hovhannes will be very grateful to receive your support and continue his lovely work.

loans.use: to pay for dance costumes needed for a group to be prepared for the dance performance

loans.name: Rashmeen

texts.en:
Rashmeen is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her four children and her husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family, and her husband has been running a mobile shop for past three years. 

Rashmeen's husband wants to purchase different types of mobile phone accessories for his business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore Rashmeen has applied for a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she’ll enable her husband to purchase relevant items for his business purposes so that he can earn more income to manage his business and household.

Rashmeen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to assist her husband to expand his mobile phone business

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi was encouraged that she was granted a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her personal, household and business expenditures.  

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy additional Avon supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed for her business. She needs to meet the increasing demand for her personal products, especially now that school time has started. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s schooling and meet her family's daily needs. She is thanking God and you for your good heart and the financial help that will be given her.

Noemi dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to send all her three children to school. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, to buy deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 38 years old and married, with one child. She works very hard to provide for the family.

Rosalinda runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Rosalinda has been in this business for three years and she sells a variety of items, such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Marie Fe

texts.en:
Marie Fe is a woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 39 years old.

She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

Marie Fe has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the rent on land where he will sow his crops, as well as buying fertiliser and seeds.

loans.name: Hambardzum

texts.en:
Hambardum is involved in cattle slaughtering in Gyumri town. He lives with his wife and two sons (aged 13 and 6 years). 

Hambardzum using his own car to transport meat to local market. He now needs this loan to purchase cattle and renovate the car, which is very important for him to continue his work. 

Hambardum has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. 

The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.The Start Up program will give Hambardzum a chance to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and renovate the car

loans.name: Kisinsima Abetereine Group

texts.en:
John is a male Ugandan who is aged 37 years, married, and has four children aged 10, 8, 6, and 2; three children attend school. He is a committed member of Kisinsiima, group a rural based group.

John’s main source of income is a retail shop but he is also a farmer which helps him to earn more income. He has applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to restock his shop with items most demanded by his customers. He hopes this will help him to to make more profit and he will also be able to pay back the loan very well.

His dream for the future is to grow his shop into a wholesale shop to earn more profits; he is however challenged by bad debtors and poor road network which slows his business. John is hard working and appreciates the efforts of Kiva lenders who stand with the low income earners.

loans.use: to boost his retail business by buying more stock ro sell

loans.name: Nguoc's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguoc is a Thai ethnic woman and a member of Nguoc's Group. She currently lives with her husband and her two children, one daughter and one son, in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from her husband’s meager civil servant salary, so the income is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses. She saved a small amount of money and she wants to buy fertilizer for the coffee her family grows. Because the saved amount is not enough, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.
	
She expects that the loan will help her family have money to better care for the coffee field of her family and that, next year, it will bring her family an abundant crop. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan to M7 Microfinance Institution Limited (M7-MFI) on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Sampa

texts.en:
Sampa is a young entrepreneur from Alipurduar.  She is only 24 years old and resides with her 28 year-old husband with whom they are blessed with a boy child.  They live in a small village in the state west Bengal, India.

Sampa's husband has a small jewelry shop and Sampa actively involved in cattle rearing. She enjoys dairy farming. Milking her cows is her hobby. She supplies milk to her neighbors to generate additional income for the family. Now she wants to expand her business and satisfy the demand of her customers. But the biggest challenge she faces is a lack of business capital.

To solve this problem, Sampa is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via BJS to purchase an additional dairy cow. An additional cow will provide her with a lot of benefits.  She will be able to produce more milk and increase her sales volume. 

Sampa's dream is to build her capital and asset base in order to lead a financially secured life in future.
She thanks her lenders for this financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to expand her existing business.

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila is a mother of 3 daughters and 3 sons. She is a housewife living in a small town of Lahore. Jamila is an old lady aged 55, who spends her entire life for her children. Her daughters are very good at studies and aim to become something and prove their potentials, whereas her sons are really good at studying and are hardworking.

She applied for the loan so that her eldest son could buy a new rickshaw as he has a 3-year long experience and wants to drive his own vehicle to help his mother with the financial matters. Jamila is thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC for the favor.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 59 years old.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Luisa has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Laxmi Group

texts.en:
Laxmi Group started in the year 2015 at Bhawanipatna of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. There are twelve active, self-dependent women, with an objective for developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood. All the members of concerned group have their own profession and business.

Satyabhama is one of them who taken a great role in her own development and their group members’ livelihood improvement. She is standing as the third person from right hand side with a raised hand in the photo. She is about 49 years old and living with her small family, her husband and two children. 

Satyabhama has been engaged in the tailoring occupation in her own home of Bhabanipatna for the last ten years. Her husband is also helping her to promote the business. Through the concerned business, she earns a monthly income of 7,500 INR. 

Her opinion is that from this small income it is very difficult to maintain her family, and after that, to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible. So she formed a group for strengthening social relations and to avail a loan for the expansion of her business.

She planned to purchase a quantity of tailoring raw materials and another tailoring machine from the local market. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for construction of a house and to provide better education to her children.

The other 11 members of the group are also smart at their professions and also actively engaged with differ professions like vegetable vending, milk business, popped rice business, paddy growing, general store, and transport business. With this loan, they hope to boost their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase a quantity of tailoring raw materials and another tailoring machine

loans.name: Hue's Group

texts.en:
Hue, born in 1985, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family has four members, including her husband, her two children one son and one daughter. Her family is now living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is from cultivation and breeding, so the annual income after deducting all costs is about VND 40 to 50 million. However, the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and save a small amount of money. Because her two children are at school age, one is in the 5th grade and one is in the 1st grade, the saved amount is not enough to cover the children's education expenses. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to invest in her children’s education in the coming period.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her two children have better conditions for learning, and they will have a brighter future. She will work hard to earn money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to invest in her children’s education

loans.name: Chom's Group

texts.en:
Chom, born in 1988, is a Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband and her lovely son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from selling groceries, so the monthly income is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and save a small amount of money. She intends to repair her house because it is downgrading, but the saved amount is not enough to do so. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to buy materials for repairing her house.

She hopes the loan amount will help her family have an opportunity to repair their house and make it become more spacious, and all members of her family will have better living conditions. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Hang's Group

texts.en:
Hang, is a Thai ethnic woman who joined in the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner in January 2011. She lives with her husband and her two daughters in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her two daughters are obedient and good at learning. The elder daughter is in grade 5, and the youngest one is at kindergarten.

Her family’s main income is from her husband’s meager civil servant salary, but it is just enough to cover the living expense of the whole family and save a small amount of money. She wants to invest in her children’s education but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She expects that the loan amount will help her children have better conditions for learning, and she will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to invest in her children’s education

loans.name: Xe's Group

texts.en:
Xe, born in 1972, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family has three members including her husband, her son and she. The family lives in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from breeding and cultivation so the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and save a small amount of money. She wants to invest in breeding by buying more breeding pigs and food for these pigs but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family have money to invest well in the breeding, and next year the breeding model will bring her family a considerable profit by selling several pig herds.

loans.use: to invest in breeding livestock.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman and has been blessed with five children all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale and to start another business in the near future

loans.name: Vanya

texts.en:
Vanya is from Gyumri town where he drives a taxi. He lives with his mother, wife, and 19-year-old daughter.

Vanya is careful, responsible, and hardworking and works as a taxi driver, work that he's been doing for the past three years.

Vanya has now applied for this loan to be able to renovate the car that he drives to continue providing taxi service. Vanya has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the car.

loans.name: Dmytryi

texts.en:
Dmytryi is an entrepreneur from Pavlograd. He is married with a 12-year-old son. He sells men's clothing items at a local marketplace. Dmytryi owns his vending location. He has been in this business for 9 years. One of the biggest issues he is facing at the moment as a businessman is unstable currency rates which affect all small businesses in Ukraine. 
Dmytryi is seeking a loan of 50 000 UAH to buy seasonal clothing merchandise and re-stock his inventory before summer. He is planning to buy men's leather jackets, artificial leather items, wind jackets, sportswear and t-shirts to sell this summer and grow his business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing merchandise and re-stock his inventory before summer

loans.name: La Amistad De Ollantaytambo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sofia Karen ella es conviviente y tiene 29 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se les tomo  la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de venta de verduras y negocio de tienda de abarrotes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo" communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Ollantaytambo, belonging to the province and department of Cuzco. 
Sofia Karen is a member. She is 29 years old, is married and has 3 children. She works in her restaurant business and makes different dishes such as roast chicken, soups and beef stir-frys. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. and has been doing this job for 8 years and is doing very well. Her dream is to have her own restaurant. Sofia Karen is asking for a loan to buy products to cook with such as rice, vegetables and chicken. 
(The member that is fixed to the group picture had her photo taken after the meeting, as she was not able to be present for the picture due to work obligations.) The other members of the group make a living selling crafts, fruit, vegetables and running a grocery store. 
Sofia Karen thanks those that contribute to her dream through this loan, and she promises to pay off the loan by the deadline.

loans.use: to buy products to cook with such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that  neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat. She wants to improve her life. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat and to improve her life.

loans.name: Blanca Rubia

texts.es:
Blanca, de 55 años de edad, no estudio, ya que su familia no contaban con los recursos para que ella pudiera estudiar, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja como vigilante, tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales uno se encuentra en su casa.

Blanca, tiene una tienda en su casa, de esa manera le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace 8 años, antes era su mamá quien tenía la tienda y Blanca,  antes se dedicaba a la venta de plantas.

Blanca, está solicitando el crédito para comprar maíz, frijoles, arroz y otros productos para poder seguir con su negocio, con el préstamo espera ampliar su tienda.

El sueño de Blanca, es poder mejorar su negocio y comprar más productos.
texts.en:
Blanca is 55 years old.  She didn't have much schooling since her family did not have the economic resources to allow her study.  She is in a common-law relationship  and her partner works as a security guard.  She has 4 children, of which only one lives in the home. 

Blanca has a store in her house.  In this way she helps her partner with house expenses.  She has worked at this business for 8 years.  Before that, it was her mother who had the store and Blanca used to sell plants.

Blanca is requesting the loan to buy corn, beans, rice and other products to be able to continue with her business.  With the loan she hopes to expand her store.

Blanca's dream is to be able to improve her business and to buy more products.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, rice and other products

loans.name: Hanh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hanh, born in 1983, is a Thai ethnic woman. She is living with her husband and her two children, one son and one daughter, in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family lives mainly based on cultivation and breeding, so the income is just enough to cover the living expenses and save a small amount. Because she has to pay for her children’s education fees, the saved amount is not enough to do it. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to pay for the education costs of her children.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan from M7-MFI on time. She hopes that the loan amount will help her children have better learning conditions, and then they will have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for the education costs of her children.

loans.name: Oanh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Oanh, born in 1982, is a Thai ethnic woman. She has been a member of the program of M7-MFI since November 2013. She is living with her husband and her three children, two sons and one daughter, in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family lives mainly based on cultivation and breeding, so the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and save a small amount. Because she has to pay much for the children’s education, she does not have enough money to buy seeding corn for the coming crop. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to buy seeding corn.

She will find an extra job to work to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time. She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in cultivation, with the productivity of the coming crop half as much again as last year.

loans.use: to buy seeding corn.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Forence is 41 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Forence works very hard to provide for them.

Forence runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, bevergares, personal product care and other groceries.

Forence has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

In the future, Forence would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, bevergares, personal product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
Angelina de 30 años de edad, tiene una hija de su primer matrimonio el cual no funcionó, pero ahora ha encontrado a otra persona con quien ha decidido rehacer su vida y están esperando un bebé.

Angelina se dedica a los oficios domésticos, su pareja a la agricultura, trabajan con el fin de apoyarse económicamente para mantener a sus hijos. 

Ella solicita este crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para realizar la siembra de granos básicos, este crédito será de mucha ayuda pues junto a su esposo podrá llevar a cabo su cosecha.

Angelina cuanta con muchos deseos y sueños pero lo que más anhela es ver crecer a su hijos y que no les falte el alimento diario.
texts.en: Angelina is 30 years old. She has a daughter from her first marriage that did not work out, but she has found another person to rebuild her life with and they are expecting a baby. Angelina makes a living in domestic chores. Her husband makes a living in agriculture. They work in order to support themselves financially and provide for their children. She is asking for a loan to buy agriculture supplies for planting basic grains. This loan will be a lot of help and she and her husband will be able to carry out their harvest. Angelina has many wishes and dreams but what she longs for most is to see her children grow and know that they will have food every day.

loans.use: to buy agriculture supplies for planting basic grains.

loans.name: Myrlie

texts.en: Myrlie  is 59 years old residing at Larena, Siquijor. She joined PMPC on January 2012 in order to access the programs and services of the said coop. Recently, loan an amount of PHP 13,000.00 to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital, which is selling a variety of food products in the local community. Myrlie would like to readily have stocks of canned goods, milk, sugar and noodles for her customers, this way she will not lose sales.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and use it as working capital

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is 47 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Gampis, Sindangan. Zenaida operates a fishing business and owns fish cages, as well. She earns a small income each month doing this type of work, supporting the needs her family especially her children's education who are now enrolled in college to get a degree. Zenaida requested a loan of 20,000 PHP, which she will use to repair her fishing boat and maintain other fishing equipment to improve and expand her fishing business. In the future, she hopes to concrete her house.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat and maintain other equipment to  expand her fishing business and pay college fees

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 65 years old, the widowed mother of seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rosario has a general store business in the Philippines. Rosario requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

Rosario has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Rosario would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity or piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to increase her sales

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 54 years old, married and has four children.  

She is in the agricultural business farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marilou has been farming sugarcane for 5 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
