Gemma Gemma is 47 years old, married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Gemma has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Gemma has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Gemma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Hernando De Jesus

texts.es:
Con su servicio de jardinería, Hernando intenta salir adelante día a día para que a su hijo no le haga falta nada.

Trabaja todos los días durante 4 horas prestando su servicio en el municipio de El Carmen de Viboral principalmente.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de una guadañadora y herramienta de jardinería, pues la herramienta que utiliza actualmente es alquilada y tiene que pagar por ella.
texts.en: Hernando with his gardening service tries to get ahead day by day so that his son doesn't lack for anything. He works four hours daily mainly providing his services to the Municipality of El Carmen de Viboral. He is requesting a loan to buy a mower and gardening tools as he tools he uses currently are rented and he has to pay for them.

loans.use: to buy a mower and gardening tools.

loans.name: Wilber

texts.en: Wilber is 42 years old and married with 10 children. He comes from Iryangabi and does coffee trade. He took a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to buy more coffee to trade. It is apparently a season for coffee in his area and he thinks that this will help to boost his business and income. This will help him to sort his challenge of not having a permanent shelter for the family, since he will be able to raise money to construct one after the financial boost.

loans.use: to boost his coffee trade business by buying coffee to sell.

loans.name: Lavender Group

texts.en:
Gina is the featured borrower of Lavendar group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to work as housekeepers and support their beloved families. 

Gina is a 41-year-old single mother, who has been working as a housekeeper to provide the necessary standard of living for her beloved child.  She is working hard to make sure that her child can benefit from the best education and living to make sure he can acquire a better future. 

Today, Gina is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, since she is a loyal Al Majmoua borrower, for the same purpose she usually acquires; to send the money to her beloved child to cover his educational and increasing living needs and to improve his living. She proved to be a borrower in good standing for three previously repaid loans.

Gina is the first lady from the left. As for the other group members, Clarissa is the first from the right, and Marifi is the lady at the center.

loans.use: to send it to her beloved child to cover his educational and living needs and improve his living.

loans.name: Nory

texts.en:
Nory works hard to support her family. Nory is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Nory has been in this business for 9 years now.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to make dried fish.


In the future, Nory would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Hector Dario

texts.es:
Hector con 56 años, radicado en una zona rural del municipio del Carmen de Viboral, siempre se ha desempeñado en el sector agropecuario al lado de su familia donde aprendió estos menesteres, lleva varios años con su propia cría de pollos para la venta y distribución en varias zonas del su pueblo. 

Sueña con aumentar el número de pollos para criar y solicito a la Corporación un crédito con el que adquirirá varios de estos animales y los insumos para la alimentación de estos, las ganancias obtenidas por el aumento de sus animales serán mucho mayor lo que le permitirá tener un mejor nivel de vida sin tanta dificultad económica.
texts.en: Hector at 56 years old resides in a rural part of the district of El Carmen de Viboral. He has always worked in agriculture beside his family where he learned this work. He has had his own business raising chickens to sell and distribute in various areas of his community for a number of years. He dreams of increasing the number of chickens to raise and has requested a loan from the Corporation to buy a number of these animals and supplies to feed them. The profit obtained from the increase in his animals will be much greater which will permit him to have a better standard of living without so much financial hardship.

loans.use: to buy a number of chickens and supplies to feed them.

loans.name: Erberta

texts.en: Erberta has a clothing business. Being a microfinance member of PMPC, she diligently pays all her obligations from the earnings of her business. Recently, she applied for a loan to  purchase stocks of RTW for buy and sell business. Erberta is thankful of the help given.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of clothing for her business

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio had a small piggery business until he became a boss with his own meat shop. He has managed to have enough meat supplies for his shop and rolls over his capital to gain more profit. 

Every day he makes good sales because of his good selling skills. Recently he approached Paglaum for much-needed capital to pay for five piglets and bags of feeds. In the future, he hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to pay for five piglets and bags of feeds in order to build a home for his family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support her family. Edna is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Edna requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Edna has been in this business for 11 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Edna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store in order to expand her business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Veronica tiene 33 años y vive con su esposo e hijo en Ixtapaluca, en el Estado de México, en donde los platillos típicos de la región se han perdido debido a la cercanía con la capital del país, pero entre ellos destacan los frijoles amanegüas, frijoles quebrados, conejo en chile macho y chilaquiles en molcajete. Veronica siempre ha tenido un gran gusto por la cocina y por esa razón tiene un trabajo como gerente en un restaurante. Siguiendo su pasión y sus ganas de tener algo propio, quiere iniciar un negocio de comida desde su propio hogar. Esto le permitiría tener los mayores ingresos posibles para lograr una mejor estabilidad financiera. Veronica es muy trabajadora y responsable, y con este préstamo ella podrá invertir en ingredientes para arrancar su negocio de comida. Veronica está abierta a cualquier conocimiento que pueda adquirir para tener un mejor desarrollo personal y profesional. Gracias a este préstamo podrá generar las ganancias suficientes para seguir despegando su negocio, así como cumplir sus obligaciones en su primer préstamo con Konfío.
texts.en: Veronica is 33 years old and lives with her husband and son in Ixtapaluca, State of Mexico, where the typical dishes of the region have been lost due to the proximity to the capital, but among the "frijoles amanegüas, frijoles quebrados, conejo en chile macho, and chilaquiles en molcajete" remain. Veronica has always had a great taste for the kitchen and for that reason has a job as a restaurant manager. Following her passion and desire to have her own business, she wants to start a food business from her own home. This would allow her to have the highest possible revenue for better financial stability. Veronica is hardworking and responsible, and with this loan, she will invest in ingredients to start her food business. Veronica is open to anyone who can give her knowledge to better her personal and professional development. Thanks to this loan, she may generate enough revenue to take off her business and to fulfill her obligations on your first loan Konfío.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare typical dishes of her region

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge in that creditors expect too short repayment periods for goods taken on credit. 

With this loan, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Mauwa

texts.en:
Mauwa is a married woman and has five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food.

For the past five years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbors and town dwellers stop-by. She faces the major challenge of seasonality.

With the loan she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding her business into a modern café in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking oil

loans.name: Samakeni

texts.en:
Samakeni is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years she has owned a food stall business where there are neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding the business to a modern.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is a 36-year-old married woman. She lives in Ijevan town with her husband and two children. The only source of income for the family is her husband's monthly salary from working in construction as a migrant worker in a neighboring country. Gohar was unemployed and looked after her children. 

She decided to start a business in order to increase the family's income five months ago. She got involved in clothing sales. The loan will help Gohar to purchase new stock of clothing to resell to customers. The startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and SEF, enables her to get a loan of AMD 250,000. With the received loan she will purchase clothes at wholesale prices and will resell them. Gohar awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing to resell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts such as tires and windscreens, so as to offer better transportation services to clients.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus is 49 years old, married and has three children. Two of them attend school and need tuition fees and allowances. 

Jesus is an entrepreneur aiming for a good income. He raises hogs and also manages a meat shop at the public market. He wants to improve the growth of his hogs so he is now asking for additional capital of PHP 50,000 to buy feed and medicine for the hogs. This will help his hogs so they will grow healthier and he can gain better profits upon selling the meat. 

Jesus hopes to continue educating his children so they will become successful in their lives someday.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for his hogs

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 36-year-old married woman, living with her four children in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She deals in selling fresh foods as a vendor in the markets and gets additional income from growing and selling cocoa. She is very hardworking, but is challenged by inadequate capital.  She has hopes of building a permanent house and also educating her children up to University.  

Rose has requested for a loan to buy fresh foods like tomatoes, onions and cabbages to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods like tomatoes, onions and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a single woman. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three months, she has operated a clothing selling business. Selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. A major challenge she faces is the high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Jm Group

texts.en:
Agnes is the featured borrower of Jm Group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. They have always been close friends since they arrived in Lebanon after leaving their hometown in the Philippines to work as housekeepers to provide a better living for their families.

Agnes is a 46-year-old widowed mother of four children. She has been working hard as a housekeeper to provide them with all the necessities of life. She is their sole breadwinner since her beloved husband passed away.

Since Agnes has a limited monthly salary, and her children's needs are increasing, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to send it to her beloved children back in the Philippines to cover their needs.

Agnes is the first lady on the far left side of the picture. As for the other group members, Julie Ann is the lady at the center, while Arlin is the first from the right.

loans.use: To send the money to her beloved children back in the Philippines

loans.name: Sabougnouma  4 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA 4  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  30 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TIGUIYA, commune de KOLONDIEBA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: le riz, l’arachide et le mais avec MARIAM la 2ème personne de la gauche à la droite sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 3 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 180 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group SABOUGNOUMA 4 are married women who average 30 years of age and 3 children each. They all live in polygamous families in TIGUIYA, a commune of KOLONDIEBA, sub-prefecture of the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They partnered with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season, and this is their 7th loan cycle with the MFI. Past loans were correctly repaid.

MARIAM grows rice, groundnuts and maize; she is the member standing second from the left in the group photo. She will use her loan to buy inputs and seeds, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 3 hectares of farmland. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold in Kolondieba to a clientele consisting of both men and women. Mariam expects to earn a profit of 180,000 FCFA, which she will use to repay her loan and to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing for the farming season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and maize seeds for planting, so as to get a better harvest and meet client needs in food supply in the market.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 25 years old and married with two children.

Annabelle works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Annabelle has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from coconut wine vending.

Annabelle aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Remedios is 38 years old and four of her children are in school.

Remedios has a buy-and-sell spices business in the Philippines. Remedios requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more spices to sell.

Remedios has been in this business for two years. In the future, Remedios would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell.

loans.name: Hilder

texts.en:
Hilder is married with two children who both attend school . She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a cosmetic shop business, her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbours especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family basic needs. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions

loans.name: Rubidia Lisseth

texts.es:
Rubidia de 24 años de edad, se crió  con sus abuelos, está acompañada y tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella.


Rubidia se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, posteriormente los pone en venta o los destaza y vende la carne, estas actividades las aprendió de su abuela quien dedicó toda su vida a la crianza de animales domésticos.


Este crédito será invertido para comprar materiales para reparar la granja de cerdos y para comprar concentrado para los mismos.

Las proyecciones que la joven tiene para un futuro son las de establecer una granja de cerdos amplia y con mejores instalaciones y adquirir otro préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero ya que cuenta con el espacio necesario para el cuido de ganado.
texts.en:
Rubidia is 24 years old and was raised by her grandparents. She has a life partner and two children who are dependent on her.

Rubidia makes her living raising pigs, after which, she puts them up for sale or butchers them and sells the meat. She learned these skills from her grandmother who spent her whole life raising domestic animals.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of materials to repair the pig farm and to buy feed for the pigs. The young woman's plans for the future are to establish a bigger pig farm with better facilities. She will acquire another loan to buy dairy animals as she will have the necessary space to care for livestock.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair the pig farm and to buy feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Kahindi

texts.en:
Kahindi is a widowed woman with seven children, none of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that  neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operation 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour, to boost her earnings

loans.name: Phebie

texts.en:
Phebie is 48 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. Phebie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Phebie has been in this business for five years.

In the future Phebie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is 41 years old and married. She works very hard to help her husband earn a living.

She runs a pearl selling business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional strands of pearls to sell. Jamila has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future Jamila would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional strands of pearls to sell

loans.name: Idah

texts.en: Thirty-seven-year-old Idah lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of three children. Her business is popcorn frying, and she gets allowances and concessions for the disabled as a supplementary income. She got involved in her business to raise income to support her family. She has requested the loan to buy sand, cement, iron bars and timber for constructing her house. She has a family dream of completing her family house despite the challenge of inadequate capital affecting the popcorn business.

loans.use: to buy buy building materials like cement, sand and timber.

loans.name: Karmen

texts.en: Karmen is from the Kapan, Syunik region where he lives with his wife. Karmen provides auto repair services in a rented garage. He applied for this loan to purchase tools that he needs for his business.  He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Karmen hopes to receive lenders' support to invest in his business and earn income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for tools needed for his auto repair business

loans.name: Kivyavu

texts.en:
Kivyavu  is a married woman with four children .She owns a  house that neither has electricity nor piped water.Her greatest monthly expense is food.
She has operated this farming business for the past one year. With the loan, Kivyavu plans to purchase seeds and fertilizers to do farming as her business.  She mentioned transportation as a major challenge in her place of operation.She decided to join Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to carry out farming as her business.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en: Herbert is 39 years, married with three children and all attending school. He is currently working with Umeme, Uganda as a driver. He took up driving as a profession and hopes to educate his children plus providing basic needs for his family in Bundibugyo but is challenged by the low salary pay. Herbert gets additional income from his cocoa garden and has requested for a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his three children.

loans.name: Rocelyn

texts.en:
Rocelyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a boarding house, buy and sell vegetables and raising pigs.

Rocelyn dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over ten years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat, so as to boost her business

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is a singer. She works at one of the local restaurants in Kapan town and lives with her mother and grandmother. 

Susanna is a talented singer with future prospects. She is asking for this loan to purchase a new microphone, which is vital for her good performance. 
 She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Susanna hopes for your support.

loans.use: to pay for a new microphone, for her musical performances

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es: Maria tiene 54 años y vive en Saltillo, Coahuila, que comparte frontera con Estados Unidos. Maria es una madre soltera que tiene una Licencitura en Contaduría Pública. Lamentablemente la empresa en la que trabaja, cerró hace cinco años. Por esa razón ella inició un negocio dando asesoría y manejo de cuentas en su propia casa. Ella planea abrir una tienda de abarrotes con su hijo en los próximos meses para continuar teniendo mejores ingresos y apoyar a que su primogénito tenga un mejor desarrollo personal y profesional a sus 25 años. Un préstamo de MXN 10,000 le ayudarán a crear publicidad para anunciarse en más puntos de su ciudad. Ella siempre ha aplicado todos sus conocimientos para salir adelante y poder ofrecerles lo mejor a sus hijos. Cuando tenga mayor estabilidad financiera le gustaría abrir un negocio de uniformes médicos. Con este préstamo ella será capaz de aumentar su cartera de clientes considerablemente. Este es su primer préstamo con Konfío y se considera muy responsable al manejar créditos.
texts.en: Maria is 54 years old and lives in Saltillo, Coahuila, which shares a border with the United States. Maria is a single mother who has a License in Accounting. Unfortunately the company where he works, closed five years ago. For that reason she started a business providing advice and account management at home. She plans to open a grocery store with her child in the coming months to continue to have higher incomes and support her firstborn has a better personal and professional development for 25 years. A loan of MXN 10,000 will help her create advertising in more parts of their city. She has always applied her knowledge to succeed and to offer her children the best. When she has greater financial stability, she would like to open a business in medical uniforms. With this loan she will be able to increase its customer base considerably. This is her first loan with Konfío, and she is considered very responsible in handling claims.

loans.use: to cover operational costs and advertising

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Muy trabajadora y siempre alegre, Antonia tiene 41 años y está casada desde hace casi 15 años. Es madre de dos niños de 15 y 12 años. Hace un año se convirtió en una mujer emprendedora, motivada por el apoyo incondicional de su esposo, quien posee un ciber café. Actualmente, Antonia es dueña de una papelería en la que también vende artículos para fiestas. Cada semana Antonia tiene que surtir su negocio, porque siempre hay alguien que pregunta por cosas nuevas. Por eso, Antonia está solicitando un préstamo por MXN 8,000 para comprar más mercancía  en grandes cantidades como cartulinas, colores, crayones, plumas, lápices y otros, para tener un buen inventario. Antonia está casi todo el día atendiendo su negocio y cuando puede le gusta practicar ejercicio. Es una mujer muy comprometida, responsable, honesta, sencilla y moderna, que siempre se preocupa por darle el mejor trato a sus clientes. Su mayor sueño es expandir su negocio con diferentes sucursales en todo el estado y tener estabilidad financiera. “Tonia”, como sus amigos la llaman, está muy orgullosa de todo el trabajo que ha hecho con el fin de dejarles un patrimonio seguro a sus hijos. Gracias a este préstamo será capaz de expandir su catálogo de productos, así como sus ventas e ingresos, con los que cumplirá a tiempo sus obligaciones en su primer préstamo con Konfío.
texts.en: Hardworking and always cheerful, Antonia is 41 years old and married for almost 15 years. She is a mother of two children of 15 and 12 years. A year ago she became an entrepreneur, motivated by the unconditional support of her husband, who has an internet cafe. Currently, Antonia owns a stationery store which also sells party goods. Each week Antonia has to supply her business, because someone always asks for new things. Therefore, Antonia is requesting a loan of MXN 8,000 to buy more merchandise in large quantities such as cardboard, colors, crayons, pens, pencils and other things to have a good inventory. Antonia spends almost all day tending to her business and, when she can, likes exercising. She is a very committed, responsible, honest, simple, modern woman, who is always concerned about giving the best service to her customers. Her biggest dream is to expand her business with various branches throughout the state and have financial stability. "Tonia" as her friends call her, is very proud of all the work she has done in order to leave a secure estate to her children. With this loan she will be able to expand her product portfolio and its sales and revenues to fulfill her obligations on time with her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise in large quantities such as cardboard, colors, crayons, pens, pencils and other things to have a good inventory

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Un día se encontraba la señora Sandra mirando hacia cielo buscando una manera de generar recursos, pues sabía que el dinero no caía del cielo, tomar una pequeño capital ahorrado que tenia, compro algo de mercancía y la vendió; con el paso del tiempo le fue gustando mucho la vocación de ventas e hizo grandes sacrificios para poder montar un negocio comercial. 

Hoy a sus 31 años de edad, con el negocio ya montado, busca la manera de sostenerlo y poder generar empleo. 

Quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de calzado, ropa y accesorios al por mayor que le permitirán a bastecer su pequeño inventario.
texts.en:
One day Sandra looked up to the sky thinking of a way to make a living. Knowing that money doesn't fall from the sky, she took a small amount of capital that she had saved and bought some merchandise which she then sold. With the passing of time she found she liked her sales vocation very much and she started to make great sacrifices to start a retail business.

Now, at 31 years of age and with her business already established, she is looking for a way to sustain it and to be able to create jobs. She wants to request a loan to buy footwear, clothing, and accessories that will allow her to stock up on her inventory.

loans.use: to buy footwear, clothing, and accessories at wholesale that will allow her to stock up on her inventory.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 49 years old, widowed with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell.

Carmen has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from a boarding house and selling fruits.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, personal care products etc. to sell

loans.name: Zaharia

texts.en:
Zaharia is married woman with three school going children. They live at their own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a khanga ( women wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operation.
With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khanga’s (wrap arounds) for resale

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en:
Mwanamvua is married with two school going children. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a khanga ( women wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.
With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khanga’s for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in pants, skirts, blouses, and shirts.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr: Fatoumata est celle qui tient le bidon d’huile. Elle est une commerçante malienne. Elle exerce l’activité du commerce, il y a deux ans de cela .Fatoumata est instruite et titulaire du Brevet de Technicien deuxième partie(BT2) en secrétariat. Cette cliente est dévouée et courageuse .De nos jours Fatoumata  a trente(30) ans .Elle est mariée, mère de trois(03) enfants (deux garçons et une fille) dont leurs âges est entre 02 à 12 ans. Son mari, un mécanicien réparateur de moto l’aide dans cette activité .Elle fait recourt à IMF pour pouvoir renforcé sa capacité financière afin de bien épanouir son activité .Sa priorité c’est  d’aider son marie pour mieux prendre les charges de la famille et le bien-être de leurs enfants. Fatoumata fait l’achat des  cartons de bidons d’huile, dans les milieux un peu reculés ; et effectue ses ventes dans les foires de la localité. Elle pourrait investir  une somme importante dans cette activité et aurait bénéficié 30 000fcfa par mois .Le soucie de Fatoumata c’est qu’elle est souvent affrontée à des difficultés du paiement de la part de sa clientèle. De nos jours elle n’aurait subi aucune autre difficulté et ni défis du prêt sur sa vie ou celle de sa famille. Fatoumata souhaiterait faire ajouter  d’autres activités, si elle parviendra à avoir un montant plus important que son dernier prêt.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is the lady holding a jug of oil in the group photo. She is a Malian merchant who started her activity 2 years ago. She had a formal education and obtained a BT2 degree (technician’s diploma, part 2) in secretarial studies. 

Fatoumata, age 30, is a devoted and courageous person. She is married with 3 children (2 boys and one girl) aged 2 to 12 years old. Her husband is a moto mechanic who helps her with her commercial activity. 

Fatoumata turned to the MFI to bolster her capital and make her business thrive. Her priorities are to help her husband provide for their family and to ensure their children’s well-being.  

Fatoumata buys jugs of oil by the carton in remote areas, and she conducts her sales at local fairs. She could make a monthly profit of 30,000 Fcfa if she were able to invest a large amount in her activity. Her main hurdle is that she often has difficulty collection payment from her customers. At this stage, she is not facing any other real challenge impacting her or her family’s life. 

She plans to diversify her range of activity if she can obtain a more substantial loan than the previous one.

loans.use: to buy jugs of oil to sell.

loans.name: Rangi Tatu Group

texts.en:
ZUHURA, who is in her mid 30s, is married with two children who are still in school. She has been running two projects, a beauty salon and a retail shop, for seven years now. She works from 07am to 02pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Zuhura's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase both projects and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of her group. She used the profit to pay school fees, to save in her bank account, for loan repayment and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy up-to-date salon products and to increase the shop's inventory. She dreams of making her business grow big.

Zuhura will share this loan with her loan group RANGI TATU which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon products and to increase the shop's inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain and service his vehicle to be in proper condition for business growth and efficiency.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en: Jolly is 38 years, married with four children and all attending School.  She is currently dealing in both cocoa farming and getting additional income from selling second hand clothes. She lives in Bundibugyo Uganda with her family, and hopes to educate her children plus providing basic needs for them but faces a  challenge of limited capital. Jolly has requested for a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a married woman with three children, all of whom attends school. She lives at her own  house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.
With the loan, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili is a married woman with one child, who attends school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.
With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Mwajabu...

texts.en:
Mwajabu, who is in her early 50s is a widow, with one adult child.  She has been running several businesses, mamalishe, charcoal and soft drinks for ten years now.  She works from 06am to 09pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Mwajabu’s 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase on her business and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is happy with the loan and appreciated Kiva for their support .  She used the profit to build her house, loan repayment, took care of herself and covered household expenses.   She will use this loan to increase on mamalishe stock to serve more people.   She dreams of extending  her business.   

Mwajabu will make sure she pays her loan within the loan schedule.

loans.use: to increase on mamalishe (food stall) stocks to serve more people.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and herbicides for his crops and for a better agricultural product so as to meet client needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Janet operates a grocery vegetables selling stall at the market in town, selling to dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a bull for farming so as to enable her to plough her farm to plant maize crops and meet family needs.

loans.name: Era

texts.en:
Era is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional canned goods, sugar, noodles, soap, etc. for her general store business.

Era has been in this business for nine years. She earns more income from farming vegetables.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Era has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, sugar, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Vick

texts.en:
Vick is a 45-year-old married woman living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom go to school. She is a cocoa farmer who has a cocoa plantation. She also buys cocoa from other people to supplement what she has harvested for selling. She hopes to expand her business of buying and selling cocoa and she is very committed to her business. She is affected by seasonality and market competition which fail her in realizing bigger profits.

Vick requests a loan to rent cocoa gardens for subsequent harvesting and selling when the season is good.

loans.use: to rent cocoa gardens for subsequent harvesting and selling when the season is good.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman with two children who attend school. She lives at a rental house that has piped water and electricity. She cites school fees and food being her greatly monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the market place. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating of hairdressing skills in the future. She also mentioned seasonality as a major challenge in her place of operation

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Mudza

texts.en:
Mudza is a married woman and lives with her husband and two children. She has at a rental house that has electricity but no  piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to become a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village. 

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha is married and has three children. She has owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a fruit-selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the 25,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruit for resale

loans.name: Dame

texts.en:
Dame is married and has four children all of whom attend school. She rents a  house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in number of clients hence perishable of goods leading to losses.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock so as to satisfy customer needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers so as to improve soil nutrients for a better harvest and meet client needs for the food supply.

loans.name: Jhovie

texts.en:
Jhovie is 34 years old and has four children.  Jhovie is married and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business  in the Philippines. Jhovie requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feeds for her pigs.

Jhovie has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jhovie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Galilaya Tukwatanise Group

texts.en:
Moses is a 30-year-old male Ugandan who is a farmer and shopkeeper in Mpeefu, a subcounty of Kibaale district. Moses is married and has three children aged 5, 2 and 1, but only one is in school. He is responsible for taking care of him and paying school fees.

Through his group of Galilaya Tukwatanise, Moses has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 UGX from Ugafode to invest in his business of a retail shop and to buy dry corn for trade. Moses believes that the loan will improve his income and he will be able to pay on time. His dream for the future is to build a family house, but the challenges he faces include limited capital and price fluctuations. He hopes that if he keeps getting a financial boost, soon enough these will be challenges of the past.

loans.use: To boost his retail trade and buy corn

loans.name: Atrigul

texts.en: Atrigul is a careful woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1979. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has three children. Two years ago she moved to the northern part of Tajikistan from the east. A year ago she became a kindergarten teacher. She has a higher education and she is a specialist physiologist. Her mother is sick and is at home. She needs expensive treatment at a medical clinic. She appealed to IMON asking for financial support to treat her mother at the medical clinic. She hopes her mother will be treated and become healthy. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to treat her mother at the medical clinic

loans.name: Rainbow Group

texts.en:
Lily is the featured borrower of Rainbow group. She got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to work as housekeepers and support their beloved families.

Lily is a 41-year-old married mother of four children. She has been working as a housekeeper to provide them with the necessary living needs and education. She is working hard to make sure that her children can benefit from the best education and living to make sure they can acquire a better future.

Today, Lily is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to send the money to her beloved husband and children to cover their educational and living needs to improve their living.

Lily is the second lady from the right. As for the other group members, Maridel is the first from the right, Rose Marie is the first from the left, while Perlita is the second from the left.

loans.use: to send the money to her beloved husband and children to cover their educational and living needs to improve their living.

loans.name: Ezinah

texts.en:
Ezinah is 24 years old, married to Bernard, and she supports three family members. 

Ezinah has been a farmer for the last year and the business earns her an income of KES 9,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm tools such as jembes and farm inputs such as fertilizer for her farming activity so as to increase her farming produce and meet client needs.

Ezinah plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase farm tools such as jembes and farm inputs such as fertilizer for her farming activity so as to increase her farming produce and meet client needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and maize seeds for planting so as to get a better harvest and meet client needs in food supply.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers so as to improve soil nutrients for a better harvest and meet client needs with the food supply.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 54 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has piped water and electricity. She cites school fees and food as being her greatest monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the market place. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating hairdressing skills in the future. She mentioned seasonality as a major challenge in her place of operation.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 25,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that  neither has electricity but or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is married, and has one child who attends school. He has owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, he has operated a motorcycle transport business from door to door. In addition he also operates a poultry farming business which earns her other source of income. He sells to restaurant operators and local neighbours. His major challenges are high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Ksh 50,000 he wants to add on his savings and purchase another motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and other items to sell

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a married woman; she has two children, both of whom attend school. Mishi owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mishi has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as a major challenge in her place of operation. In addition, she also operates a food selling business, selling to the neighbours.
 
With the KES 30,000 loan, Mishi wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. In addition she also operates a poultry-selling business. 

With the loan, she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Juan Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Juan desde muy joven se dedica a las funciones del campo tales como agricultura y cría de animales, actividades que le enseño su padre para que saliera adelante en su vida.

Hoy en día su actividad principal es la agricultura y la producción de leche, tiene como objetivo mejorar su capital comprando una vaca lechera que le permitan abastecerse y generar mejores ingresos, y esta es la razón por la cual solicita un préstamo.

Es casado, vive en una finca con su esposa quien ha sido su más grande compañía.

Todos los días asiste su negocio y procura por hacer las cosas muy bien y sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar podrá llegar muy lejos.
texts.en:
From a very young age Juan has been dedicated to work in the fields, farming and raising animals, the way his father taught him so that he could get ahead in life. Currently, he works mostly in agriculture and in the production of milk. His goal is to improve his capital by buying a dairy cow that will allow him to provide and generate better income. This is the reason he is requesting the loan.

He is married and lives in a farm with his wife who has been his greatest companion. He tends to his business every day and procures to make everything the right way. He knows that with the help of the “Interactuar” Corporation he will succeed.

loans.use: to buy a cow to improve his production of milk.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman and has four school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a business of buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbours. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operation.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats and cows for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm herbicides for use on the farm

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 50 years old and married with three children who are in school. Rosalinda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for three years.

In the future Rosalinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Scola

texts.en:
Scola is a married woman, and has two kids who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years she has operated a poultry farming business, which earns her a source of income. She sells to restaurant operators and local neighbors. Her major challenge is high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 13,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Nanjala

texts.en:
Nanjala is a married woman with one child, who attends school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 39 years old, married and blessed with two children. He sells household plastic goods such as water jugs, cups, plates and basins. The income from the business has enabled him to provide for the needs of his family. He will be using the loan to buy more stock of plastic goods like plates, cups, jugs and water cans to sell. He hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and earn more income. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop for selling household goods.

loans.use: To buy more stock of plastic goods like plates, cups, jugs and water cans to sell. He hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and earn more income.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 58 years old and widowed with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal and coconut business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal and coconuts to sell.

Arsenia has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal and coconut business for five years and also earns an income from a general store. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 37 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

Mary Grace has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buy-and-sell charcoal.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operation. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operation. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married woman and has two kids who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a poultry-farming business which earns her a source of income. She sells to restaurant operators and local neighbours. Her major challenge is high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 10,000, she wants to add on her savings and purchase chicken feeds and chicks for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feeds and chicks for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Jurakul

texts.ru:
Чуракулу 49 лет. Он миролюбивый человек с открытой душой. Чуракул верный муж и отец троих детей. Сыновья находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации. Дочка домохозяйка, она помогает маме в работе. 
   У Чуракула имеется земельный участок, где он сажает овощи и другие сельскохозяйственные культуры. Растениеводство является  единственным источником дохода. Он имеет много планов и надеется преуспеть во всем. Но на данный момент он торопится посадить летный урожай. Так как в Таджикистане лето и осень длятся долгое время, и до декабря сохраняется теплая погода, у Чуракул есть шансы успеть реализовать посев. Но ему не хватает средств, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения и обработать землю. По этой причине он просит кредит. Поддержите Чуракул достичь своих целей.
texts.en:
Jurakul is 49 years old.  He is a peace-loving man with a very big heart.  He is also a faithful husband and the father of three children.  His sons are currently working in the Russian Federation.  His daughter is a homemaker; she helps her mom with her work.

Jurakul owns a plot of land on which he grows vegetables and other crops.  Agriculture is his only source of income.  He has many dreams and he hopes to do well with everything.  At the moment, he is busy planting toward the summer harvest.  Since the summer and the fall last a long time in Tajikistan (and the weather is actually warm until December), Jurakul has a chance to get a good crop harvest.  However, he doesn't have the necessary resources to buy mineral fertilizers to prepare his land.  For this reason, he has requested a loan.  Please support Jurakul and help him reach his goals.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more retail stock like sugar, tea leaves, flour and other household goods for resale at a profit.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 35 years old, married, and supports a family of four members. She has been in a business of bananas for the last five years earning KES 12,000 per month. She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, to open up her market through transportation of bananas to various places. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to open up her market through transportation of bananas to various places.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing the farm for a better harvest to sell in the market to meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 43 years old and married with one child.  With her child in school, Rosemarie works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like chips, noodles, soap, sugar, etc.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Rosemarie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like chips, noodles, soap, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix a single man who has no children. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

For the past two years, he has operated a dairy farming business, conducting retail sales and also selling at the market to his local residents and restaurant operators. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his place of operation. He dreams of adding more dairy cows and expanding to a motorcycle business. 

With the KES 50,000 he wants to purchase cow feeds and medicine for livestock. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase cow feed and medicine for livestock

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Donaldo Jose

texts.es:
Con mucho empuje y perseverancia, Donaldo desea iniciar un negocio de cría y levante de pollos en su casa ubicada en el municipio de La Unión.

Esta idea surge a partir de la necesidad de generar unos buenos ingresos para colaborar con el sostenimiento del hogar en que vive con su familia.

Se caracteriza por ser un hombre alegre y muy colaborador, cualidades que han hecho que se gane el cariño y respeto de la gente de la vereda.
Con este préstamo podrá dar inicio a este negocio.

El dinero será invertido en la compra de pollos, concentrado y materiales para construcción del galpón.
texts.en:
With a lot of drive and perseverance, Donaldo wishes to start a business of breeding and raising chickens in his house, which is located in the municipality of La Unión. 

This idea comes from the need to generate a good income so as to help with the sustenance of the home in which he lives with his family.

Donaldo is known for being a cheerful and cooperative man, qualities that have earned him the affection and respect of the people in his small village. 

With this loan he would be able to start his business. The money will be invested in the purchase of chickens, feed, and materials for the construction of the chicken coop.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, feed, and materials for the construction of the chicken coop.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 35 years old, a resident of Zziwa,Kyotera in Rakai district, and married with four children, all attending school. He is also taking care of one child who is an orphan and lives in a rural area with his family. Charles deals in a business of farming where he grows mainly coffee and the rest of the crops, which he started in 2004 with the aim of looking after his family. In addition to that, he also carries out trading in coffee and cattle rearing. He works 6 days of the week and 10 hours per day.

Charles wants a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to buy fertilizers for his coffee plantation.  His major customers are the coffee processing factories. However, he is apparently faced with challenges of limited capital and climatic changes such as drought, which he hopes will soon be a problem of the past since he is getting a financial boost.

Charles is a hardworking man, who always wants to see his family in a good standard of living, and is hoping to widen his coffee plantations to increase his income base.

loans.use: to clear the bush in his coffee plantation and buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare motorcycle parts for repair and maintenance so as to offer better transport services to his clients.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en: Alona is from Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, in the Philippines. She and her husband have a livestock business. They raise chickens for sale either dressed or live. Since, she wants to be more productive, she engaged in buying and selling native chicken for additional earnings. To expand her resources, Alona requested a loan to purchase nails, wood and wire to build an additional chicken cage that has wider space for her chickens and pay for more inventory of native chicken for sale. Alona deeply wishes to sell more dressed and live chickens each week, to save enough money for future emergencies. She hopes to become a supplier of chickens in the town and neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase nails, wood and wire to build an additional larger chicken coop and pay for more inventory of native chickens for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers come. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients, hence perishable goods leading to losses.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, charcoal and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, charcoal and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Vigince

texts.en:
Vigince is a widowed woman with four children who all attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees, food and clothing.

She is taking out a Kiva loan of KES 30,000 to invest in her farming business. With the loan, Vigince plans to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her farming business.

She decided to join Yehu to get access to a loan and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her farming business.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 29 years old and married with two children. With her children in school, Brenda works very hard to provide for them.

Brenda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, personal product care and other groceries.

Brenda has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, junk foods, candies, canton, juices and other groceries. 

In the future, Brenda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is an accountant from Kapan town in the Syunik region. For over five years, Armen provides accounting services for different companies existing in Kapan. He lives with his wife and two kids. Armen works from his house and over those five years of hard work, he was able to have agreements with a number of companies. 

Armen now needs to purchase special accounting software, which will allow him to organize accounting for financial companies as well. This is the reason he has applied for this loan. The start-up loan program, which provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products, will help Armen to purchase the software and expand his working area.

loans.use: to pay for special accounting software needed for providing accounting services to financial companies

loans.name: Marlene Elizabeth

texts.es:
Marlene, de 34 años de edad, es una persona que estudio hasta noveno, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja en la agricultura y tienen dos hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad.

El negocio de Marlene, es la crianza de animales domésticos, ella compra y vende animales de corral, así ayuda a los ingresos de la casa, ella desempeña su negocio en el mercado del pueblo, algunas veces su pareja también le ayuda.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar cerdos, ya que por el momento tiene tres, pero ahorita está bueno ese negocio, porque genera muchas ganancias.

El sueño de Marlene, es terminar de comprar un terreno, para construir su vivienda; respecto a sus hijos quiere apoyarlos hasta que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Marlene is 34 years old and studied until ninth grade. She is partnered and her partner works in agriculture. They have two children of 5 and 3 years old.

Marlene's business is raising domestic animals. She buys and sells barnyard animals to help with the income of the house. She performs her business in the town market. Sometimes her partner also helps.

The loan she is requesting is for purchasing pigs, as she currently has three. Right now business is good, because it is generating a profit.

Marlene's dream is to end up purchasing land and to build a home for her children. She wants to support them until they are professionals.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition at her place of operation. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun is a hard-working and dedicated 42-year-old man. He runs a cafe in the center of Kapan town. This business has served to support and improve his family’s living. 

He is the father of two children, who are everything to him, and he insists on succeeding and giving them an excellent life.

Harutyun has been gaining customers little by little. He sells what he and his wife make and now he wants to try for more. He is seeking financial assistance to buy materials for food production, a refrigerator for meat and a grill machine needed for his cafe. This loan will help him to enlarge the variety of dishes he provides to his customers and for sure will make his business more profitable. 

The start-up loan program, which provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products, will help Harutyun to make his goals come true.

loans.use: to pay for materials for food production, a refrigerator for meat and a grill machine for his cafe

loans.name: Laurette

texts.en:
Laurette is a 53 year old married mother of three children’s.
